quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
author: ANTOINE DE SAINT-EXUPERY

quote: Be able to be alone. Lose not the advantage of solitude.
author: SIR THOMAS BROWNE

quote: When we cannot bear to be alone, it means we do not properly value the only companion we will have from birth to death ourselves.
author: EDA LESHAN

quote: We visit others as a matter of social obligation. How long has it been since we have visited with ourselves?
author: MORRIS ADLER

quote: We cannot confront solitude without moral resources.
author: HONORÉ DE BALZAC

quote: The result of joining two solitudes will always be a greater solitude.
author: PEDRO LUIS

quote: Solitude is a good place to visit but a poor place to stay.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: The same fence that shuts others out shuts you in.
author: BILL COPELAND

quote: There's one thing worse than being alone: wishing you were.
author: BOB STEELE

quote: Loneliness and the feeling of being uncared for and unwanted are the greatest poverty.
author: MOTHER TERESA OF CALCUTTA

quote: Of all things that can happen to us, triumph is the most difficult to endure when we are alone.
author: GABRIELLE ROY

quote: Deprived of witnesses, it shrinks at once.
author: GABRIELLE ROY

quote: Our language has wisely sensed the two sides of being alone. It has created the word "loneliness" to express the pain of being alone. And it has created the word "solitude" to express the glory of being alone.
author: PAUL TILLICH

quote: The man who goes alone can start today; but he who travels with another must wait until the other is ready.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: What a lovely surprise to finally discover how unlonely being alone can be.
author: ELLEN BURSTYN

quote: Man loves company even if it is only that of a small burning candle.
author: GEORG CHRISTOPH LICHTENBERG

quote: Fortunate, indeed, is the man who takes exactly the right measure of himself and holds a just balance between what he can acquire and what he can use.
author: PETER LATHAM

quote: Integrity is not a conditional word. It doesn't blow in the wind or change with the weather. It is your inner image of yourself, and if you look in there and see a man who won't cheat, then you know he never will.
author: JOHN D. MACDONALD

quote: Integrity has no need of rules.
author: ALBERT CAMUS

quote: We get so much in the habit of wearing a disguise before others that we eventually appear disguised before ourselves.
author: JIM BISHOP

quote: We don't know who we are until we see what we can do.
author: MARTHA GRIMES

quote: What we must decide is how we are valuable rather than how valuable we are.
author: EDGAR Z. FRIEDENBERG

quote: Our credulity is greatest concerning the things we know least about. And since we know least about ourselves, we are ready to believe all that is said about us. Hence the mysterious power of both flattery and calumny.
author: ERIC HOFFER

quote: No one beneath you can offend you. No one your equal would.
author: JAN L. WELLS

quote: The superior man is distressed by the limitations of his ability; he is not distressed by the fact that men do not recognize the ability he has.
author: CONFUCIUS

quote: No man, for any considerable time, can wear one face to himself and another to the multitude without finally getting bewildered as to which may be the true.
author: NATHANIEL HAWTHORNE

quote: Maybe taking ourselves for somebody else means that we cannot bear to see ourselves as we are.
author: ALBERT BRIE

quote: Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.
author: DORIS MORTMAN

quote: If we have our own "why" of life, we can bear almost any "how."
author: FRIEDRICH NIETZSCHE

quote: Man shies away from nothing as from a rendezvous with himself—which makes the entertainment industry what it is.
author: FRITZ MULIAR

quote: To have doubted one's own first principles is the mark of a civilized man.
author: OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES JR.

quote: When one is out of touch with oneself, one cannot touch others.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
author: CARL G. JUNG

quote: Fair play is primarily not blaming others for anything that is wrong with us.
author: ERIC HOFFER

quote: Our opinion of people depends less upon what we see in them than upon what they make us see in ourselves.
author: SARAH GRAND

quote: One can only face in others what one can face in oneself.
author: JAMES BALDWIN

quote: I have had more trouble with myself than with any other man I have ever met!
author: DWIGHT L. MOODY

quote: Being yourself is not remaining what you were, or being satisfied with what you are. It is the point of departure.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: People often say that this or that person has not yet found himself. But the self is not something that one finds. It is something one creates.
author: THOMAS SZASZ

quote: You have to start knowing yourself so well that you begin to know other people. A piece of us is in every person we can ever meet.
author: JOHN D. MACDONALD

quote: The best vision is insight.
author: MALCOLM S. FORBES

quote: Men go abroad to wonder at the heights of mountains, at the huge waves of the sea, at the long courses of the rivers, at the vast compass of the ocean, at the circular motions of the stars; and they pass by themselves without wondering.
author: ST. AUGUSTINE

quote: If a man happens to find himself, he has a mansion which he can inhabit with dignity all the days of his life.
author: JAMES A. MICHENER

quote: No sooner do we think we have assembled a comfortable life than we find a piece of ourselves that has no place to fit in.
author: GAIL SHEEHY

quote: Not until we are lost do we begin to understand ourselves.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: You may find the worst enemy or best friend in yourself.
author: ENGLISH PROVERB

quote: Know yourself. Don't accept your dog's admiration as conclusive evidence that you are wonderful.
author: ANN LANDERS

quote: Be yourself. No one can ever tell you you're doing it wrong.
author: JAMES LEO HERLIHY

quote: Often we change jobs, friends and spouses instead of ourselves.
author: AKBARALI H. JETHA

quote: Everybody thinks of changing humanity and nobody thinks of changing himself.
author: LEO TOLSTOY

quote: Everyone complains of his memory, and nobody complains of his judgment.
author: FRANÇOIS DE LA ROCHEFOUCAULD

quote: Nothing is so soothing to our self-esteem as to find our bad traits in our forebears. It seems to absolve us.
author: VAN WYCK BROOKS

quote: I don't want everyone to like me; I should think less of myself if some people did.
author: HENRY JAMES

quote: When we are confident, all we need is a little support.
author: ANDRÉ LAURENDEAU

quote: We may not return the affection of those who like us, but we always respect their good judgment.
author: LIBBIE FUDIM

quote: A man can stand a lot as long as he can stand himself.
author: AXEL MUNTHE

quote: Misfortunes one can endure—they come from outside; they are accidents. But to suffer for one's own faults—ah, there is the sting of life.
author: OSCAR WILDE

quote: We are all worms, but I do believe I am a glowworm.
author: WINSTON CHURCHILL

quote: The most difficult secret for a man to keep is the opinion he has of himself.
author: MARCEL PAGNOL

quote: Appearances give us more pleasure than reality, especially when they help to satisfy our egos.
author: ÉMILE CHEVALIER

quote: The ingenuities we practice in order to appear admirable to ourselves would suffice to invent the telephone twice over on a rainy summer morning.
author: BRENDAN GILL

quote: We have to learn to be our own best friends because we fall too easily into the trap of being our worst enemies.
author: RODERICK THORP

quote: A human being's first responsibility is to shake hands with himself.
author: HENRY WINKLER

quote: If you want your children to improve, let them overhear the nice things you say about them to others.
author: HAIM GINOTT

quote: We appreciate frankness from those who like us. Frankness from others is called insolence.
author: ANDRÉ MAUROIS

quote: We probably wouldn't worry about what people think of us if we could know how seldom they do.
author: OLIN MILLER

quote: We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing, while others judge us by what we have already done.
author: HENRY WADSWORTH LONGFELLOW

quote: Argue for your limitations and, sure enough, they're yours.
author: RICHARD BACH

quote: Morale is self-esteem in action.
author: AVERY WEISMAN, MD

quote: Lack of something to feel important about is almost the greatest tragedy a man may have.
author: ARTHUR E. MORGAN

quote: Once in a century a man may be ruined or made insufferable by praise. But surely once in a minute something generous dies for want of it.
author: JOHN MASEFIELD

quote: In the depth of winter I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
author: ALBERT CAMUS

quote: Self-respect is the fruit of discipline; the sense of dignity grows with the ability to say no to oneself.
author: ABRAHAM JOSHUA HESCHEL

quote: The better we feel about ourselves, the fewer times we have to knock somebody else down to feel tall.
author: ODETTA

quote: A man can't ride your back unless it's bent.
author: REV. MARTIN LUTHER KING JR.

quote: Never feel self-pity, the most destructive emotion there is. How awful to be caught up in the terrible squirrel cage of self.
author: MILLICENT FENWICK

quote: Self-pity in its early stages is as snug as a feather mattress. Only when it hardens does it become uncomfortable.
author: MAYA ANGELOU

quote: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
author: BENJAMIN SPOCK, MD

quote: Imagination is a good horse to carry you over the ground—not a flying carpet to set you free from probability.
author: ROBERTSON DAVIES

quote: Imagination is the true magic carpet.
author: NORMAN VINCENT PEALE

quote: The man who has no imagination has no wings.
author: MUHAMMAD ALI

quote: Imagination offers people consolation for what they cannot be, and humor for what they actually are.
author: ALBERT CAMUS

quote: There are lots of people who mistake their imagination for their memory.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: You can't depend on your judgment when your imagination is out of focus.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
author: JOSEPH JOUBERT

quote: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it, we go nowhere.
author: CARL SAGAN

quote: Imagination is the highest kite that one can fly.
author: LAUREN BACALL

quote: Imagination is as good as many voyages and much cheaper.
author: GEORGE WILLIAM CURTIS

quote: I believe in the imagination. What I cannot see is infinitely more important than what I can see.
author: DUANE MICHALS

quote: The opportunities of man are limited only by his imagination. But so few have imagination that there are ten thousand fiddlers to one composer.
author: CHARLES F. KETTERING

quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
author: ALBERT EINSTEIN

quote: He turns not back who is bound to a star.
author: LEONARDO DA VINCI

quote: Perhaps imagination is only intelligence having fun.
author: GEORGE SCIALABBA

quote: I doubt that the imagination can be suppressed. If you truly eradicated it in a child, he would grow up to be an eggplant.
author: URSULA K. LE GUIN

quote: One of the virtues of being very young is that you don't let the facts get in the way of your imagination.
author: SAM LEVENSON

quote: If one is lucky, a solitary fantasy can totally transform one million realities.
author: MAYA ANGELOU

quote: The best reason for having dreams is that in dreams no reasons are necessary.
author: ASHLEIGH BRILLIANT

quote: There are no rules of architecture for a castle in the clouds.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: Hold fast to dreams/For if dreams die/Life is a broken-winged bird/That cannot fly.
author: LANGSTON HUGHES

quote: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.
author: WILLIAM BLAKE

quote: The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up.
author: J. M. POWER

quote: Nothing happens unless first a dream.
author: CARL SANDBURG

quote: A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it, bearing within him the image of a cathedral.
author: ANTOINE DE SAINT-EXUPÉRY

quote: To fulfill a dream, to be allowed to sweat over lonely labor, to be given a chance to create, is the meat and potatoes of life. The money is the gravy.
author: BETTE DAVIS

quote: The years forever fashion new dreams when old ones go. God pity a one-dream man!
author: ROBERT GODDARD

quote: A man must have his dreams—memory dreams of the past and eager dreams of the future. I never want to stop reaching for new goals.
author: MAURICE CHEVALIER

quote: Dreams and dedication are a powerful combination.
author: WILLIAM LONGGOOD

quote: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
author: THOMAS JEFFERSON

quote: We all live under the same sky, but we don't have the same horizon.
author: KONRAD ADENAUER

quote: The moment after Christmas every child thinks of his birthday.
author: STEPHEN UYS

quote: Everything starts as somebody's daydream.
author: LARRY NIVEN

quote: Rose-colored glasses are never made in bifocals. Nobody wants to read the small print in dreams.
author: ANN LANDERS

quote: How many of our daydreams would darken into nightmares, were there a danger of their coming true!
author: LOGAN PEARSALL SMITH

quote: Dreaming permits each and every one of us to be safely insane every night of the week.
author: DR. CHARLES FISHER

quote: Establishing goals is all right if you don't let them deprive you of interesting detours.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Discipline is remembering what you want.
author: DAVID CAMPBELL

quote: Goals are dreams with deadlines.
author: DIANA SCHARF HUNT

quote: The trouble with not having a goal is that you can spend your life running up and down the field and never scoring.
author: BILL COPELAND

quote: In the long run men hit only what they aim at.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: Don't bunt. Aim out of the ballpark.
author: DAVID OGILVY

quote: Aim at Heaven and you will get Earth thrown in. Aim at Earth and you get neither.
author: C. S. LEWIS

quote: Keep high aspirations, moderate expectations and small needs.
author: H. STEIN

quote: Goals determine what you're going to be.
author: JULIUS ERVING

quote: The trouble with our age is that it is all signposts and no destination.
author: The War Cry

quote: To live only for some future goal is shallow. It's the sides of the mountain that sustain life, not the top.
author: ROBERT M. PIRSIG

quote: When you aim for perfection, you discover it's a moving target.
author: GEORGE FISHER

quote: Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.
author: C. ARCHIE DANIELSON

quote: Whoever wants to reach a distant goal must take many small steps.
author: HELMUT SCHMIDT

quote: I've always wanted to be somebody, but I see now I should have been more specific.
author: LILY TOMLIN

quote: There is nothing worse than being a doer with nothing to do.
author: ELIZABETH LAYTON

quote: The most important things in life aren't things.
author: Quoted in bulletin of The First Christian Church of Fairfield, Illinois

quote: Origins are of the greatest importance. We are almost reconciled to having a cold when we remember where we caught it.
author: MARIE VON EBNER-ESCHENBACH

quote: To see what is in front of one's nose requires a constant struggle.
author: GEORGE ORWELL

quote: If people concentrated on the really important things in life, there'd be a shortage of fishing poles.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: If you can play golf and bridge as though they were games, you're just about as well adjusted as you are ever going to be.
author: Manitoba Co-Operator

quote: The only person you should ever compete with is yourself. You can't hope for a fairer match.
author: TODD RUTHMAN

quote: The great thing in this world is not so much where we stand as in what direction we are moving.
author: OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES SR.

quote: To have more, desire less.
author: Table Talk

quote: When we have provided against cold, hunger and thirst, all the rest is but vanity and excess.
author: SENECA

quote: A glimpse is not a vision. But to a man on a mountain road by night, a glimpse of the next three feet of road may matter more than a vision of the horizon.
author: C. S. LEWIS

quote: The last thing one knows is what to put first.
author: BLAISE PASCAL

quote: We need to learn to set our course by the stars, not by the lights of every passing ship.
author: GEN. OMAR N. BRADLEY

quote: What was most significant about the lunar voyage was not that men set foot on the moon but that they set eye on the earth.
author: NORMAN COUSINS

quote: The hardest thing to learn in life is which bridge to cross and which to burn.
author: LAURENCE J. PETER

quote: Take your work seriously but yourself lightly.
author: C. W. METCALF

quote: If you treat every situation as a life-and-death matter, you'll die a lot of times.
author: DEAN SMITH

quote: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
author: ELBERT HUBBARD

quote: It's a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.
author: W. SOMERSET MAUGHAM

quote: It is not the man who has too little who is poor, but the one who craves more.
author: SENECA

quote: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
author: H. JACKSON BROWN JR.

quote: To be upset over what you don't have is to waste what you do have.
author: KEN S. KEYES JR.

quote: The pursuit of perfection often impedes improvement.
author: GEORGE WILL

quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach. One can collect only a few, and they are more beautiful if they are few.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: Look at everything as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time. Then your time on earth will be filled with glory.
author: BETTY SMITH

quote: Climb up on some hill at sunrise. Everybody needs perspective once in a while, and you'll find it there.
author: ROBB SAGENDORPH

quote: The man who can't dance thinks the band is no good.
author: POLISH PROVERB

quote: Nothing is so good as it seems beforehand.
author: GEORGE ELIOT

quote: In order to maintain a well-balanced perspective, the person who has a dog to worship him should also have a cat to ignore him.
author: Peterborough Examiner

quote: Conscience is that still, small voice that is sometimes too loud for comfort.
author: BERT MURRAY

quote: Conscience is a small inner voice that doesn't speak your language.
author: Merit Crossword Puzzles Plus

quote: The ultimate test of man's conscience may be his willingness to sacrifice something today for future generations whose words of thanks will not be heard.
author: GAYLORD NELSON

quote: Conscience is God's presence in man.
author: EMANUEL SWEDENBORG

quote: Reason deceives us; conscience, never.
author: JEAN JACQUES ROUSSEAU

quote: Conscience is a mother-in-law whose visit never ends.
author: H. L. MENCKEN

quote: A conscience, like a buzzing bee, can make a fellow uneasy without ever stinging him.
author: American Farm & Home Almanac

quote: The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
author: HARPER LEE

quote: The truth of the matter is that you always know the right thing to do. The hard part is doing it.
author: GEN. H. NORMAN SCHWARZKOPF

quote: To know what is right and not to do it is the worst cowardice.
author: CONFUCIUS

quote: Self-discipline is when your conscience tells you to do something and you don't talk back.
author: W. K. HOPE

quote: In matters of conscience, the law of majority has no place.
author: MOHANDAS K. GANDHI

quote: People who wrestle with their consciences usually go for two falls out of three.
author: Los Angeles Times Syndicate

quote: There is no pillow so soft as a clear conscience.
author: FRENCH PROVERB

quote: A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong gives it a superficial appearance of being right.
author: THOMAS PAINE

quote: A lot of people mistake a short memory for a clear conscience.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Many people feel "guilty" about things they shouldn't feel guilty about, in order to shut out feelings of guilt about things they should feel guilty about.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: A good conscience is a continual Christmas.
author: BENJAMIN FRANKLIN

quote: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
author: SENECA

quote: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom; the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
author: WALTER LIPPMANN

quote: What we do not understand we do not possess.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: One of the functions of intelligence is to take account of the dangers that come from trusting solely to the intelligence.
author: LEWIS MUMFORD

quote: What the heart knows today, the head will understand tomorrow.
author: JAMES STEPHENS

quote: Science at best is not wisdom; it is knowledge. Wisdom is knowledge tempered with judgment.
author: LORD RITCHIE-CALDER

quote: Never mistake knowledge for wisdom. One helps you make a living; the other helps you make a life.
author: SANDRA CAREY

quote: "Next time I will..." "From now on I will..." What makes me think I am wiser today than I will be tomorrow?
author: HUGH PRATHER

quote: There is a great difference between knowing a thing and understanding it.
author: CHARLES KETTERING WITH T. A. BOYD

quote: The day the child realizes that all adults are imperfect he becomes an adolescent; the day he forgives them, he becomes an adult; the day he forgives himself he becomes wise.
author: ALDEN NOWLAN

quote: Everyone is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day. Wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
author: ELBERT HUBBARD

quote: Wisdom too often never comes, and so one ought not to reject it merely because it comes late.
author: FELIX FRANKFURTER

quote: The wise person questions himself, the fool others.
author: HENRI ARNOLD

quote: The most manifest sign of wisdom is continued cheerfulness.
author: MONTAIGNE

quote: The art of living consists in knowing which impulses to obey and which must be made to obey.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
author: NORMAN COUSINS

quote: Wisdom is the quality that keeps you from getting into situations where you need it.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
author: ANTOINE DE SAINT-EXUPÉRY

quote: The more a man knows, the more he forgives.
author: CATHERINE THE GREAT

quote: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
author: KAHLIL GIBRAN

quote: The best-educated human being is the one who understands most about the life in which he is placed.
author: HELEN KELLER

quote: It is easier to be wise for others than for ourselves.
author: ALEKSANDR I. SOLZHENITSYN

quote: People far prefer happiness to wisdom, but that is like wanting to be immortal without getting older.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Learning sleeps and snores in libraries, but wisdom is everywhere, wide awake, on tiptoe.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood.
author: MARIE CURIE

quote: Discretion is knowing how to hide that which we cannot remedy.
author: SPANISH PROVERB

quote: The first sign of maturity is the discovery that the volume knob also turns to the left.
author: "SMILE" ZINGERS

quote: Life begins as a quest of the child for the man and ends as a journey by the man to rediscover the child.
author: LAURENS VAN DER POST

quote: A child becomes an adult when he realizes he has a right not only to be right but also to be wrong.
author: THOMAS SZASZ

quote: Maturity is the ability to do a job whether or not you are supervised, to carry money without spending it and to bear an injustice without wanting to get even.
author: ANN LANDERS

quote: You are not mature until you expect the unexpected.
author: Chicago Tribune

quote: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.
author: OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES SR.

quote: You're never too old to grow up.
author: SHIRLEY CONRAN

quote: You grow up the day you have your first real laugh at yourself.
author: ETHEL BARRYMORE

quote: Age is a high price to pay for maturity.
author: TOM STOPPARD

quote: To exist is to change, to change is to mature, to mature is to go on creating oneself endlessly.
author: HENRI BERGSON

quote: Maturity begins when we're content to feel we're right about something without feeling the necessity to prove someone else wrong.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Maturity is reached the day we don't need to be lied to about anything.
author: FRANK YERBY

quote: Maturity means reacquiring the seriousness one had as a child at play.
author: FRIEDRICH NIETZSCHE

quote: Youth is when you blame all your troubles on your parents; maturity is when you learn that everything is the fault of the younger generation.
author: HAROLD COFFIN

quote: As we grow old, the beauty steals inward.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you was?
author: SATCHEL PAIGE

quote: Whatever a man's age may be, he can reduce it several years by putting a bright-colored flower in his buttonhole.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: When it comes to staying young, a mind-lift beats a face-lift any day.
author: MARTY BUCELLA

quote: It's easier to have the vigor of youth when you're old than the wisdom of age when you're young.
author: RICHARD J. NEEDHAM

quote: Adults are obsolete children.
author: DR. SEUSS

quote: We all wear masks, and the time comes when we cannot remove them without removing some of our own skin.
author: ANDRÉ BERTHIAUME

quote: After a certain number of years, our faces become our biographies.
author: CYNTHIA OZICK

quote: The mask, given time, comes to be the face itself.
author: MARGUERITE YOURCENAR

quote: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly and just not think about your age.
author: LUCILLE BALL

quote: If youth only knew; if age only could.
author: HENRI ESTIENNE

quote: When the problem is not so much resisting temptation as finding it, you may just be getting older.
author: Los Angeles Times

quote: The person who says youth is a state of mind invariably has more state of mind than youth.
author: American Farm and Home Almanac

quote: If you carry your childhood with you, you never become older.
author: ABRAHAM SUTZKEVER

quote: Most people say that as you get old, you have to give up things. I think you get old because you give up things.
author: SEN. THEODORE FRANCIS GREEN

quote: You don't stop laughing because you grow old; you grow old because you stop laughing.
author: MICHAEL PRITCHARD

quote: We are only young once. That is all society can stand.
author: BOB BOWEN

quote: I've always believed in the adage that the secret of eternal youth is arrested development.
author: ALICE ROOSEVELT LONGWORTH

quote: The joy that is felt at the sight of new-fallen snow is inversely proportional to the age of the beholder.
author: PAUL SWEENEY

quote: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.
author: JEANNE MOREAU

quote: Age appears best in four things: old wood to burn, old wine to drink, old friends to trust and old authors to read.
author: FRANCIS BACON

quote: Growing up is usually so painful that people make comedies out of it to soften the memory.
author: JOHN GREENWALD

quote: Old age lives minutes slowly, hours quickly; childhood chews hours and swallows minutes.
author: MALCOLM DE CHAZAL

quote: When I no longer thrill to the first snow of the season, I'll know I'm growing old.
author: LADY BIRD JOHNSON

quote: Just remember, when you're over the hill, you begin to pick up speed.
author: CHARLES SCHULZ

quote: People are living longer than ever before, a phenomenon undoubtedly made necessary by the 30-year mortgage.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: There is always some specific moment when we become aware that our youth is gone; but, years after, we know it was much later.
author: MIGNON MCLAUGHLIN

quote: It takes about ten years to get used to how old you are.
author: RAYMOND A. MICHEL

quote: Middle age is the time when a man is always thinking that in a week or two he will feel just as good as ever.
author: DON MARQUIS

quote: Middle age is the awkward period when Father Time starts catching up with Mother Nature.
author: HAROLD COFFIN

quote: Middle age is when you begin to wonder who put the quicksand into the hourglass of time.
author: The Orben Comedy Letter

quote: Midlife crisis is that moment when you realize your children and your clothes are about the same age.
author: BILL TAMMEUS

quote: Youth is when you're allowed to stay up late on New Year's Eve. Middle age is when you're forced to.
author: BILL VAUGHN

quote: What most persons consider as virtue, after the age of 40 is simply a loss of energy.
author: VOLTAIRE

quote: I don't know what the big deal is about old age. Old people who shine from inside look 10 to 20 years younger.
author: DOLLY PARTON

quote: I have no romantic feelings about age. Either you are interesting at any age or you are not. There is nothing particularly interesting about being old—or being young, for that matter.
author: KATHARINE HEPBURN

quote: Old age is having too much room in the house and not enough in the medicine cabinet.
author: Orben's Current Comedy

quote: When grace is joined with wrinkles, it is adorable. There is an unspeakable dawn in happy old age.
author: VICTOR HUGO

quote: A young boy is a theory; an old man is a fact.
author: ED HOWE

quote: Never lose sight of the fact that old age needs so little but needs that little so much.
author: MARGARET WILLOUR

quote: The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
author: H. L. MENCKEN

quote: Wisdom doesn't necessarily come with age. Sometimes age just shows up all by itself.
author: TOM WILSON

quote: You can judge your age by the amount of pain you feel when you come in contact with a new idea.
author: JOHN NUVEEN

quote: Sometimes the child in one behaves a certain way and the rest of oneself follows behind, slowly shaking its head.
author: JAMES E. SHAPIRO

quote: The best thing about being young is, if you had to do it all over again, you would still have time.
author: SANDRA CLARKE

quote: If life were just, we would be born old and achieve youth about the time we'd saved enough to enjoy it.
author: JIM FIEBIG

quote: Everybody has been young before, but not everybody has been old before.
author: AFRICAN PROVERB

quote: You will stay young as long as you learn, form new habits and don't mind being contradicted.
author: MARIE VON EBNER-ESCHENBACH

quote: You are young at any age if you are planning for tomorrow.
author: The Sword of the Lord

quote: A grownup is a child with layers on.
author: WOODY HARRELSON

quote: When people tell you how young you look, they are also telling you how old you are.
author: CARY GRANT

quote: To age with dignity and with courage cuts close to what it is to be a man.
author: ROGER KAHN

quote: I speak truth, not so much as I would, but as much as I dare; and I dare a little the more, as I grow older.
author: MONTAIGNE

quote: The older you get, the more important it is not to act your age.
author: ASHLEIGH BRILLIANT

quote: The trick is growing up without growing old.
author: CASEY STENGEL

quote: Growing older is not upsetting; being perceived as old is.
author: KENNY ROGERS

quote: The trouble with class reunions is that old flames have become even older.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: A person is always startled when he hears himself seriously called an old man for the first time.
author: OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES SR.

quote: After thirty, a body has a mind of its own.
author: BETTE MIDLER

quote: We grow neither better nor worse as we grow old, but more like ourselves.
author: MAY LAMBERTON BECKER

quote: The best thing about growing older is that it takes such a long time.
author: WALTERS KEMP

quote: One advantage in growing older is that you can stand for more and fall for less.
author: MONTA CRANE

quote: The best birthdays of all are those that haven't arrived yet.
author: ROBERT ORBEN

quote: The older I grow, the more I listen to people who don't talk much.
author: GERMAIN G. GLIDDEN

quote: We've put more effort into helping folks reach old age than into helping them enjoy it.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: Memory is the diary we all carry about with us.
author: OSCAR WILDE

quote: Count reminiscences like money.
author: CARL SANDBURG

quote: It's surprising how much of memory is built around things unnoticed at the time.
author: BARBARA KINGSOLVER

quote: We do not remember days; we remember moments.
author: CESARE PAVESE

quote: The moment may be temporary, but the memory is forever.
author: BUD MEYER

quote: Don't brood on what's past, but never forget it either.
author: THOMAS H. RADDALL

quote: Recall it as often as you wish, a happy memory never wears out.
author: LIBBIE FUDIM

quote: Each of us is the accumulation of our memories.
author: ALAN LOY MCGINNIS

quote: One form of loneliness is to have a memory and no one to share it with.
author: PHYLLIS ROSE

quote: Memories are the key not to the past, but to the future.
author: CORRIE TEN BOOM WITH JOHN AND ELIZABETH SHERRILL

quote: May you look back on the past with as much pleasure as you look forward to the future.
author: PAUL DICKSON

quote: Keep some souvenirs of your past, or how will you ever prove it wasn't all a dream?
author: ASHLEIGH BRILLIANT

quote: To live without a memory is to live alone.
author: GILLES MARCOTTE

quote: There is no fence or hedge round time that has gone. You can go back and have what you like if you remember it well enough.
author: RICHARD LLEWELLYN

quote: Everybody needs his memories. They keep the wolf of insignificance from the door.
author: SAUL BELLOW

quote: Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children.
author: CHARLES R. SWINDOLL

quote: You never know when you're making a memory.
author: RICKIE LEE JONES

quote: Our memories are card indexes consulted, and then put back in disorder, by authorities whom we do not control.
author: CYRIL CONNOLLY

quote: What is memory? Not a storehouse, not a trunk in the attic, but an instrument that constantly refines the past into a narrative, accessible and acceptable to oneself.
author: STANLEY KAUFFMANN

quote: Memory is a child walking along a seashore. You never can tell what small pebble it will pick up and store away among its treasured things.
author: PIERCE HARRIS

quote: I'm always fascinated by the way memory diffuses fact.
author: DIANE SAWYER

quote: When I was younger, I could remember anything, whether it had happened or not.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: You can close your eyes to reality but not to memories.
author: STANISLAW J. LEC

quote: There are times when forgetting can be just as important as remembering—and even more difficult.
author: HARRY AND JOAN MIER

quote: Remembering is a dream that comes in waves.
author: HELGA SANDBUR

quote: Memory is a complicated thing, a relative to truth, but not its twin.
author: BARBARA KINGSOLVER

quote: Recollection is the only paradise from which we cannot be turned out.
author: JEAN PAUL RICHTER

quote: The true tomb of the dead is the heart of the living.
author: JEAN COCTEAU

quote: There is something terrible yet soothing about returning to a place where you once lived. You are one of your own memories.
author: MARY MORRIS

quote: Some folks never exaggerate—they just remember big.
author: AUDREY SNEAD

quote: The older a man gets, the farther he had to walk to school as a boy.
author: Commercial Appeal (Danville, Virginia)

quote: God gave us our memories so that we might have roses in December.
author: JAMES M. BARRIE

quote: No memory is ever alone; it's at the end of a trail of memories, a dozen trails that each have their own associations.
author: LOUIS L'AMOUR

quote: If you're yearning for the good old days, just turn off the air conditioning.
author: GRIFF NIBLACK

quote: We have all got our "good old days" tucked away inside our hearts, and we return to them in dreams like cats to favorite armchairs.
author: BRIAN CARTER

quote: Things ain't what they used to be and probably never was.
author: WILL ROGERS

quote: Nostalgia is a file that removes the rough edges from the good old days.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: In the old days, when things got rough, what you did was without.
author: BILL COPELAND

quote: Nostalgia is like a grammar lesson: you find the present tense and the past perfect.
author: The United Church Observer

quote: The essence of nostalgia is an awareness that what has been will never be again.
author: MILTON S. EISENHOWER

quote: There has never been an age that did not applaud the past and lament the present.
author: LILLIAN EICHLER WATSON

quote: Nothing seems to go as far as it did. Even nostalgia doesn't reach back as far as it used to.
author: Changing Times

quote: You can clutch the past so tightly to your chest that it leaves your arms too full to embrace the present.
author: JAN GLIDEWELL

quote: A trip to nostalgia now and then is good for the spirit, as long as you don't set up housekeeping.
author: DAN BARTOLOVIC

quote: The past should be a springboard, not a hammock.
author: IVERN BALL

quote: The older you get, the greater you were.
author: LEE GROSSCUP

quote: It's the things in common that make relationships enjoyable, but it's the little differences that make them interesting.
author: TODD RUTHMAN

quote: Home is a place you grow up wanting to leave, and grow old wanting to get back to.
author: JOHN ED PEARCE

quote: The fireside is the tulip bed of a winter day.
author: PERSIAN PROVERB

quote: The home is not the one tame place in the world of adventure. It is the one wild place in the world of rules and set tasks.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night.
author: MARGARET MEAD

quote: The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.
author: CONFUCIUS

quote: Where we love is home—home that our feet may leave, but not our hearts.
author: OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES SR.

quote: Where is home? Home is where the heart can laugh without shyness. Home is where the heart's tears can dry at their own pace.
author: VERNON G. BAKER

quote: My home is here. I feel just as at home overseas, but I think my roots are here and my language is here and my rage is here and my hope is here. You know where your home is because you've been there long enough. You know all the peculiarities of the people around you, because you are one of them. And naturally, memories are the most important. Your home is where your favorite memories are.
author: PIETER-DIRK UYS

quote: A child on a farm sees a plane fly overhead and dreams of a faraway place. A traveler on the plane sees the farmhouse and dreams of home.
author: CARL BURNS

quote: When you finally go back to your old hometown, you find it wasn't the old home you missed but your childhood.
author: SAM EWING

quote: The reality of any place is what its people remember of it.
author: CHARLES KURALT

quote: A small town is a place where there is little to see or do, but what you hear makes up for it.
author: IVERN BALL

quote: A small town is a place where everyone knows whose check is good and whose husband is not.
author: SID ASCHER

quote: A place is yours when you know where all the roads go.
author: STEPHEN KING

quote: There's nothing people like better than being asked an easy question. For some reason, we're flattered when a stranger asks us where Maple Street is in our hometown and we can tell him.
author: ANDREW A. ROONEY

quote: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
author: GEORGE MOORE

quote: Visitors should behave in such a way that the host and hostess feel at home.
author: J. S. FARYNSKI

quote: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your successes.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: One does not make friends. One recognizes them.
author: GARTH HENRICHS

quote: In prosperity, our friends know us; in adversity, we know our friends.
author: JOHN CHURTON COLLINS

quote: Strangers are friends that you have yet to meet.
author: ROBERTA LIEBERMAN

quote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
author: OPRAH WINFREY

quote: I value the friend who for me finds time on his calendar, but I cherish the friend who for me does not consult his calendar.
author: ROBERT BRAULT

quote: It may be true that a touch of indifference is the safest foundation on which to build a lasting and delicate friendship.
author: W. ROBERTSON NICOLL

quote: Getting people to like you is only the other side of liking them.
author: NORMAN VINCENT PEALE

quote: It's the things in common that make relationships enjoyable, but it's the little differences that make them interesting.
author: TODD RUTHMAN

quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.
author: BENJAMIN FRANKLIN

quote: Don't make friends who are comfortable to be with. Make friends who will force you to lever yourself up.
author: THOMAS J. WATSON SR.

quote: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.
author: WILLIAM BLAKE

quote: True friendship is a plant of slow growth.
author: GEORGE WASHINGTON

quote: It takes a long time to grow an old friend.
author: JOHN LEONARD

quote: The most called-upon prerequisite of a friend is an accessible ear.
author: MAYA ANGELOU

quote: Men kick friendship around like a football, but it doesn't seem to crack. Women treat it like glass and it goes to pieces.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: Could we see when and where we are to meet again, we would be more tender when we bid our friends good-by.
author: MARIE LOUISE DE LA RAMÉE

quote: Friends are relatives you make for yourself.
author: EUSTACHE DESCHAMPS

quote: The golden rule of friendship is to listen to others as you would have them listen to you.
author: DAVID AUGSBURGER

quote: You can make more friends in a month by being interested in them than in ten years by trying to get them interested in you.
author: CHARLES L. ALLEN

quote: We need old friends to help us grow old and new friends to help us stay young.
author: LETTY COTTIN POGREBIN

quote: If you want an accounting of your worth, count your friends.
author: MERRY BROWNE

quote: My friends are my estate. Forgive me then the avarice to hoard them!
author: EMILY DICKINSON

quote: Friendship is a single soul dwelling in two bodies.
author: ARISTOTLE

quote: In my friend, I find a second self.
author: ISABEL NORTON

quote: No man is the whole of himself; his friends are the rest of him.
author: HARRY EMERSON FOSDICK

quote: Friendships multiply joys and divide griefs.
author: H. G. BOHN

quote: A friend is someone you can do nothing with, and enjoy it.
author: The Optimist Magazine

quote: We cherish our friends not for their ability to amuse us, but for our ability to amuse them.
author: EVELYN WAUGH

quote: A loyal friend laughs at your jokes when they're not so good, and sympathizes with your problems when they're not so bad.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: How rare and wonderful is that flash of a moment when we realize we have discovered a friend.
author: WILLIAM ROTSLER

quote: To a friend's house, the road is never long.
author: ANONYMOUS

quote: A friend hears the song in my heart and sings it to me when my memory fails.
author: Pioneer Girls Leaders' Handbook

quote: True friendship is like phosphorescence—it glows best when the world around you goes dark.
author: DENISE MARTIN

quote: The proper office of a friend is to side with you when you are in the wrong. Nearly anybody will side with you when you are right.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: It is important for our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.
author: MIGNON MCLAUGHLIN

quote: The surest way to lose a friend is to tell him something for his own good.
author: SID ASCHER

quote: If it's painful for you to criticize your friends, you're safe in doing it; if you take the slightest pleasure in it, that's the time to hold your tongue.
author: ALICE DUER MILLER

quote: Only your real friends will tell you when your face is dirty.
author: SICILIAN PROVERB

quote: A friend is a lot of things, but a critic he isn't.
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: A friend is someone who can see through you and still enjoys the show.
author: Farmers Almanac

quote: Friends are those rare people who ask how we are and then wait to hear the answer.
author: ED CUNNINGHAM

quote: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.
author: ELISABETH FOLEY

quote: Some of the most rewarding and beautiful moments of a friendship happen in the unforeseen open spaces between planned activities. It is important that you allow these spaces to exist.
author: CHRISTINE LEEFELDT AND ERNEST CALLENBACH

quote: We love those who know the worst of us and don't turn their faces away.
author: WALKER PERCY

quote: No man can be called friendless when he has God and the companionship of good books.
author: ELIZABETH BARRETT BROWNING

quote: An enemy who tells the truth contributes infinitely more to our improvement than a friend who deludes us.
author: LOUIS-N. FORTIN

quote: It pays to know the enemy—not least because at some time you may have the opportunity to turn him into a friend.
author: MARGARET THATCHER

quote: Pay attention to your enemies, for they are the first to discover your mistakes.
author: ANTISTHENES

quote: A friend is someone who makes me feel totally acceptable.
author: ENE RIISNA

quote: The best mirror is a friend's eye.
author: GAELIC PROVERB

quote: Sometimes the best helping hand you can get is a good, firm push.
author: JOANN THOMAS

quote: What do we live for if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
author: GEORGE ELIOT

quote: Whoever is spared personal pain must feel himself called to help in diminishing the pain of others.
author: ALBERT SCHWEITZER

quote: Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.
author: Hebrews 13:2

quote: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burden of it for anyone else.
author: CHARLES DICKENS

quote: Great opportunities to help others seldom come, but small ones surround us every day.
author: SALLY KOCH

quote: I have always held firmly to the thought that each one of us can do a little to bring some portion of misery to an end.
author: ALBERT SCHWEITZER

quote: We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.
author: MOTHER TERESA OF CALCUTTA

quote: It is well to give when asked, but it is better to give unasked, through understanding.
author: KAHLIL GIBRAN

quote: He who helps early helps twice.
author: TADEUSZ MAZOWIECKI

quote: Expect people to be better than they are; it helps them to become better. But don't be disappointed when they are not; it helps them to keep trying.
author: MERRY BROWNE

quote: You may give gifts without caring—but you can't care without giving.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: Never hesitate to hold out your hand; never hesitate to accept the outstretched hand of another.
author: POPE JOHN XXIII

quote: It is one of the beautiful compensations of this life that no one can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.
author: CHARLES DUDLEY WARNER

quote: We love those people who give with humility, or who accept with ease.
author: FREYA STARK

quote: Basically, the only thing we need is a hand that rests on our own, that wishes it well, that sometimes guides us.
author: HECTOR BIANCIOTTI

quote: Extending your hand is extending yourself.
author: ROD MCKUEN

quote: The miracle is this—the more we share, the more we have.
author: LEONARD NIMOY

quote: To ease another's heartache is to forget one's own.
author: ABRAHAM LINCOLN

quote: The more sympathy you give, the less you need.
author: MALCOLM S. FORBES

quote: He is not an honest man who has burned his tongue and does not tell the company that the soup is hot.
author: YUGOSLAV PROVERB

quote: Honesty is stronger medicine than sympathy, which may console but often conceals.
author: GRETEL EHRLICH

quote: Correction does much, but encouragement does more.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: Money-giving is a good criterion of a person's mental health. Generous people are rarely mentally ill people.
author: DR. KARL MENNINGER

quote: The impersonal hand of government can never replace the helping hand of a neighbor.
author: HUBERT H. HUMPHREY

quote: You can't get rid of poverty by giving people money.
author: P. J. O'ROURKE

quote: We'd all like a reputation for generosity, and we'd all like to buy it cheap.
author: MIGNON MCLAUGHLIN

quote: The greatest pleasure I know is to do a good action by stealth and have it found out by accident.
author: CHARLES LAMB

quote: Real charity doesn't care if it's tax-deductible or not.
author: DAN BENNETT

quote: Criticism, like rain, should be gentle enough to nourish a man's growth without destroying his roots.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: Nobody wants constructive criticism. It's all we can do to put up with constructive praise.
author: MIGNON MCLAUGHLIN

quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
author: BENJAMIN DISRAELI

quote: The pleasure we derive from doing favors is partly in the feeling it gives us that we are not altogether worthless.
author: ERIC HOFFER

quote: Deceiving someone for his own good is a responsibility that should be shouldered only by the gods.
author: HENRY S. HASKINS

quote: Life's unfairness is not irrevocable; we can help balance the scales for others, if not always for ourselves.
author: HUBERT H. HUMPHREY

quote: We ought to be careful not to do for a fellow what we only intended to help him do.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: The more help a person has in his garden, the less it belongs to him.
author: WILLIAM H. DAVIS

quote: The difference between a helping hand and an outstretched palm is a twist of the wrist.
author: LAURENCE LEAMER

quote: Few things help an individual more than to place responsibility upon him and to let him know that you trust him.
author: BOOKER T. WASHINGTON

quote: Do not free a camel of the burden of his hump; you may be freeing him from being a camel.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: No matter what accomplishments you achieve, somebody helps you.
author: ALTHEA GIBSON

quote: Do not commit the error, common among the young, of assuming that if you cannot save the whole of mankind you have failed.
author: JAN DE HARTOG

quote: If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.
author: MOTHER TERESA OF CALCUTTA

quote: From what we get, we can make a living; what we give, however, makes a life.
author: ARTHUR ASHE

quote: No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave.
author: CALVIN COOLIDGE

quote: The dead take to the grave, clutched in their hands, only what they have given away.
author: DEWITT WALLACE

quote: The only things we ever keep are what we give away.
author: LOUIS GINSBERG

quote: The fragrance always stays in the hand that gives the rose.
author: HADA BEJAR

quote: Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone; it has to be made, like bread, remade all the time, made new.
author: URSULA K. LEGUIN

quote: In our life there is a single color, as on an artist's palette, which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
author: MARC CHAGALL

quote: True love begins when nothing is looked for in return.
author: ANTOINE DE SAINT-EXUPÉRY

quote: At the touch of love, everyone becomes a poet.
author: PLATO

quote: This is the true measure of love: when we believe that we alone can love, that no one could ever have loved so before us, and that no one will ever love in the same way after us.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
author: ANTOINE DE SAINT-EXUPÉRY

quote: In the coldest February, as in every other month in every other year, the best thing to hold on to in this world is each other.
author: LINDA ELLERBEE

quote: Only discretion allows intimacy, which depends on shared reticence, on what is not said—unsolvable things that would leave the other person ill at ease.
author: HECTOR BIANCIOTTI

quote: We don't believe in rheumatism and true love until after the first attack.
author: MARIE VON EBNER-ESCHENBACH

quote: As soon go kindle fire with snow, as seek to quench the fire of love with words.
author: WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE

quote: I kissed my first woman and smoked my first cigarette on the same day. I have never had time for tobacco since.
author: ARTURO TOSCANINI

quote: All our loves are first loves.
author: SUSAN FROMBERG

quote: Two things only a man cannot hide: that he is drunk and that he is in love.
author: ANTIPHANES

quote: Is it not strange that love, so fickle, is ranked above friendship, almost always so worthy?
author: GABRIELLE ROY

quote: Love is a game that two can play and both win.
author: EVA GABOR

quote: The giving of love is an education in itself.
author: ELEANOR ROOSEVELT

quote: We English have sex on the brain, which is not the most satisfactory place for it.
author: MALCOLM MUGGERIDGE

quote: So many catastrophes in love are only accidents of egotism.
author: HECTOR BIANCIOTTI

quote: Sometimes I wonder if men and women really suit each other. Perhaps they should live next door and just visit now and then.
author: KATHARINE HEPBURN

quote: You can't put a price tag on love, but you can on all its accessories.
author: MELANIE CLARK

quote: It is possible that blondes also prefer gentlemen.
author: MAMIE VAN DOREN

quote: Love is like quicksilver in the hand. Leave the fingers open, and it stays. Clutch it, and it darts away.
author: DOROTHY PARKER

quote: In true love the smallest distance is too great, and the greatest distance can be bridged.
author: HANS NOUWENS

quote: Love letters are the campaign promises of the heart.
author: ROBERT FRIEDMAN

quote: Only love can be divided endlessly and still not diminish.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: Love and time—those are the only two things in all the world and all of life that cannot be bought, but only spent.
author: GARY JENNINGS

quote: It's easy to halve the potato where there's love.
author: IRISH PROVERB

quote: So long as we love we serve; so long as we are loved by others, I would almost say that we are indispensable.
author: ROBERT LOUIS STEVENSON

quote: The best proof of love is trust.
author: JOYCE BROTHERS

quote: Love is proud of itself. It leaks out of us even with the tightest security.
author: MERRIT MALLOY

quote: Let there be spaces in your togetherness / And let the winds of the heavens dance between you.
author: KAHLIL GIBRAN

quote: Familiarity, truly cultivated, can breed love.
author: JOYCE BROTHERS

quote: Love is what you've been through with somebody.
author: JAMES THURBER

quote: Love is a fruit in season at all times, and within the reach of every hand.
author: MOTHER TERESA OF CALCUTTA

quote: Love is an image of God, and not a lifeless image, but the living essence of the all divine nature which beams full of all goodness.
author: MARTIN LUTHER

quote: Where there is great love, there are always miracles.
author: WILLA CATHER

quote: The Bible tells us to love our neighbors, and also to love our enemies; probably because they are generally the same people.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: No disguise can long conceal love where it is, nor feign it where it is not.
author: FRANÇOIS DE LA ROCHEFOUCAULD

quote: We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: Him that I love, I wish to be free even from me.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: No one worth possessing can be quite possessed.
author: SARA TEASDALE

quote: The ultimate test of a relationship is to disagree but to hold hands.
author: ALEXANDRA PENNEY

quote: The love of our neighbor in all its fullness simply means being able to say to him: "What are you going through?"
author: SIMONE WEIL

quote: The worst prison would be a closed heart.
author: POPE JOHN PAUL II

quote: I love you, not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you.
author: ROY CROFT

quote: Tell me whom you love, and I'll tell you who you are.
author: CREOLE PROVERB

quote: Love at first sight is easy to understand. It's when two people have been looking at each other for years that it becomes a miracle.
author: SAM LEVENSON

quote: Love is not measured by how many times you touch each other but by how many times you reach each other.
author: CATHY MORANCY

quote: Nobody has ever measured, even the poets, how much a heart can hold.
author: ZELDA FITZGERALD

quote: Love is a great beautifier.
author: LOUISA MAY ALCOTT

quote: The purest affection the heart can hold is the honest love of a nine-year-old.
author: HOLMAN F. DAY

quote: If only one could tell true love from false love as one can tell mushrooms from toadstools.
author: KATHERINE MANSFIELD

quote: Four be the things I'd have been better without: love, curiosity, freckles and doubt.
author: DOROTHY PARKER

quote: It is often hard to bear the tears that we ourselves have caused.
author: The Maxims of Marcel Proust

quote: Never close your lips to those to whom you have opened your heart.
author: CHARLES DICKENS

quote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: DAVID VISCOTT, MD

quote: Seek not every quality in one individual.
author: CONFUCIUS

quote: Love doesn't make the world go round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: When one loves somebody, everything is clear—where to go, what to do—it all takes care of itself and one doesn't have to ask anybody about anything.
author: MAXIM GORKY

quote: Love is like a violin. The music may stop now and then, but the strings remain forever.
author: JUNE MASTERS BACHER

quote: Love is an act of faith, and whoever is of little faith is also of little love.
author: ERICH FROMM

quote: Love endures only when the lovers love many things together and not merely each other.
author: WALTER LIPPMANN

quote: When a woman says, "Ah, I could love you if..."—fear not, she already loves you.
author: WALTER PULITZER

quote: A woman can say more in a sigh than a man can say in a sermon.
author: ARNOLD HAULTAIN

quote: We love because it's the only true adventure.
author: NIKKI GIOVANNI

quote: Love can achieve unexpected majesty in the rocky soil of misfortune.
author: TONY SNOW

quote: Love is the magician that pulls man out of his own hat.
author: BEN HECHT

quote: There is no surprise more magical than the surprise of being loved. It is God's finger on man's shoulder.
author: CHARLES MORGAN

quote: To love is to admire with the heart; to admire is to love with the mind.
author: THÉOPHILE GAUTIER

quote: What the world really needs is more love and less paper work.
author: PEARL BAILEY

quote: Never look for a worm in the apple of your eye.
author: LANGSTON HUGHES

quote: Anything will give up its secrets if you love it enough.
author: GEORGE WASHINGTON CARVER

quote: Love talked about can be easily turned aside, but love demonstrated is irresistible.
author: W. STANLEY MOONEYHAM

quote: The whole worth of a kind deed lies in the love that inspires it.
author: THE TALMUD

quote: A baby is born with a need to be loved and never outgrows it.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: I have enjoyed the happiness of the world; I have loved.
author: SCHILLER

quote: A married couple that plays cards together is just a fight that hasn't started yet.
author: GEORGE BURNS

quote: Marriage resembles a pair of shears, so joined that they cannot be separated; often moving in opposite directions, yet always punishing anyone who comes between them.
author: SYDNEY SMITH

quote: It isn't tying himself to one woman that a man dreads when he thinks of marrying; it's separating himself from all the others.
author: HELEN ROWLAND

quote: Marriage should be a duet—when one sings, the other claps.
author: JOE MURRAY

quote: The value of marriage is not that adults produce children, but that children produce adults.
author: PETER DE VRIES

quote: Whoever thinks marriage is a 50-50 proposition doesn't know the half of it.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: A marriage without conflicts is almost as inconceivable as a nation without crises.
author: ANDRÉ MAUROIS

quote: A happy home is one in which each spouse grants the possibility that the other may be right, though neither believes it.
author: DON FRASER

quote: More marriages might survive if the partners realized that sometimes the better comes after the worse.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: One advantage of marriage is that, when you fall out of love with him or he falls out of love with you, it keeps you together until you fall in again.
author: JUDITH VIORST

quote: Marriage is a covered dish.
author: SWISS PROVERB

quote: Love, honor and negotiate.
author: ALAN LOY MCGINNIS

quote: Almost no one is foolish enough to imagine that he automatically deserves great success in any field of activity; yet almost everyone believes that he automatically deserves success in marriage.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Marriage has teeth, and him bite very hot.
author: JAMAICAN PROVERB

quote: Getting married is easy. Staying married is more difficult. Staying happily married for a lifetime should rank among the fine arts.
author: ROBERTA FLACK

quote: Marriage is like vitamins: we supplement each other's minimum daily requirements.
author: KATHY MOHNKE

quote: Never marry for money. Ye'll borrow it cheaper.
author: SCOTTISH PROVERB

quote: A wedding anniversary is the celebration of love, trust, partnership, tolerance and tenacity. The order varies for any given year.
author: PAUL SWEENEY

quote: A good marriage is like an incredible retirement fund. You put everything you have into it during your productive life, and over the years it turns from silver to gold to platinum.
author: WILLARD SCOTT

quote: In every marriage more than a week old, there are grounds for divorce. The trick is to find, and continue to find, grounds for marriage.
author: ROBERT ANDERSON

quote: If you made a list of reasons why any couple got married, and another list of the reasons for their divorce, you'd have a lot of overlapping.
author: MIGNON MCLAUGHLIN

quote: The concept of two people living together for 25 years without a serious dispute suggests a lack of spirit only to be admired in sheep.
author: A. P. HERBERT

quote: Story writers say that love is concerned only with young people, and the excitement and glamour of romance end at the altar. How blind they are. The best romance is inside marriage; the finest love stories come after the wedding, not before.
author: IRVING STONE

quote: It takes a loose rein to keep a marriage tight.
author: JOHN STEVENSON

quote: The great thing about marriage is that it enables one to be alone without feeling loneliness.
author: GERALD BRENAN

quote: A happy marriage is the world's best bargain.
author: O. A. BATTISTA

quote: Marrying for love may be a bit risky, but it is so honest that God can't help but smile on it.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: The particular charm of marriage is the duologue, the permanent conversation between two people who talk over everything and everyone.
author: CYRIL CONNOLLY

quote: In marriage, being the right person is as important as finding the right person.
author: WILBERT DONALD GOUGH

quote: In a successful marriage, there is no such thing as one's way. There is only the way of both, only the bumpy, dusty, difficult, but always mutual path.
author: PHYLLIS MCGINLEY

quote: Chains do not hold a marriage together. It is threads, hundreds of tiny threads, which sew people together through the years.
author: SIMONE SIGNORET

quote: All that a husband or wife really wants is to be pitied a little, praised a little, appreciated a little.
author: OLIVER GOLDSMITH

quote: Marriage should, I think, always be a little hard and new and strange. It should be breaking your shell and going into another world, and a bigger one.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: A happy marriage is a long conversation that always seems too short.
author: ANDRÉ MAUROIS

quote: The difference between courtship and marriage is the difference between the pictures in a seed catalogue and what comes up.
author: JAMES WHARTON

quote: The greatest of all arts is the art of living together.
author: WILLIAM LYON PHELPS

quote: A sound marriage is not based on complete frankness; it is based on a sensible reticence.
author: MORRIS L. ERNST

quote: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.
author: MIGNON MCLAUGHLIN

quote: You don't marry one person; you marry three: the person you think they are, the person they are, and the person they are going to become as the result of being married to you.
author: RICHARD NEEDHAM

quote: Marriage is like twirling a baton, turning handsprings or eating with chopsticks. It looks easy until you try it.
author: HELEN ROWLAND

quote: The goal in marriage is not to think alike, but to think together.
author: ROBERT C. DODDS

quote: Married life teaches one invaluable lesson: to think of things far enough ahead not to say them.
author: JEFFERSON MACHAMER

quote: The marriages we regard as the happiest are those in which each of the partners believes that he or she got the best of it.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Matrimony is the only game of chance the clergy favor.
author: EMILY FERGUSON MURPHY

quote: Nobody will ever win the battle of the sexes. There's too much fraternizing with the enemy.
author: HENRY KISSINGER

quote: The great gift of family life is to be intimately acquainted with people you might never even introduce yourself to, had life not done it for you.
author: KENDALL HAILEY

quote: A family vacation is one where you arrive with five bags, four kids and seven I-thought-you-packed-its.
author: IVERN BALL

quote: Family faces are magic mirrors. Looking at people who belong to us, we see the past, present and future. We make discoveries about ourselves.
author: GAIL LUMET BUCKLEY

quote: Parentage is a very important profession; but no test of fitness for it is ever imposed in the interest of the children.
author: BERNARD SHAW

quote: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
author: JOHN BOWRING

quote: Other things may change us, but we start and end with family.
author: ANTHONY BRANDT

quote: No matter how many communes anybody invents, the family always creeps back.
author: MARGARET MEAD

quote: Heredity is what sets the parents of a teenager wondering about each other.
author: LAURENCE J. PETER

quote: Heredity is a splendid phenomenon that relieves us of responsibility for our shortcomings.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Adolescence is perhaps nature's way of preparing parents to welcome the empty nest.
author: KAREN SAVAGE AND PATRICIA ADAMS

quote: Few things are more satisfying than seeing your children have teenagers of their own.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Even a family tree has to have some sap.
author: Los Angeles Times Syndicate

quote: Oh, to be only half as wonderful as my child thought I was when he was small, and only half as stupid as my teenager now thinks I am.
author: REBECCA RICHARDS

quote: We never know the love of the parent until we become parents ourselves.
author: HENRY WARD BEECHER

quote: He that has no fools, knaves nor beggars in his family was begot by a flash of lightning.
author: THOMAS FULLER

quote: If you don't believe in ghosts, you've never been to a family reunion.
author: ASHLEIGH BRILLIANT

quote: Before most people start boasting about their family tree, they usually do a good pruning job.
author: O. A. BATTISTA

quote: There is no king who has not had a slave among his ancestors, and no slave who has not had a king among his.
author: HELEN KELLER

quote: The family fireside is the best of schools.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Making the decision to have a child—it's momentous. It is to decide forever to have your heart go walking around outside your body.
author: ELIZABETH STONE

quote: When you are a mother, you are never really alone in your thoughts. A mother always has to think twice, once for herself and once for her child.
author: SOPHIA LOREN

quote: Mothers are the most instinctive philosophers.
author: HARRIET BEECHER STOWE

quote: Instant availability without continuous presence is probably the best role a mother can play.
author: LOTTE BAILYN

quote: The three most beautiful sights: a potato garden in bloom, a ship in sail, a woman after the birth of her child.
author: IRISH PROVERB

quote: Every parent is at some time the father of the unreturned prodigal, with nothing to do but keep his house open to hope.
author: JOHN CIARDI

quote: You never get over being a child, long as you have a mother to go to.
author: SARAH ORNE JEWETT

quote: A good father is a little bit of a mother.
author: LEE SALK

quote: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
author: THEODORE HESBURGH

quote: One father is more than a hundred schoolmasters.
author: GEORGE HERBERT

quote: My father didn't tell me how to live; he lived, and let me watch him do it.
author: CLARENCE BUDINGTON KELLAND

quote: You don't raise heroes; you raise sons. And if you treat them like sons, they'll turn out to be heroes, even if it's just in your own eyes.
author: WALTER SCHIRRA SR.

quote: The beauty of "spacing" children many years apart lies in the fact that parents have time to learn the mistakes that were made with the older ones—which permits them to make exactly the opposite mistakes with the younger ones.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: The thorn from the bush one has planted, nourished and pruned, pricks most deeply and draws more blood.
author: MAYA ANGELOU

quote: It doesn't matter who my father was; it matters who I remember he was.
author: ANNE SEXTON

quote: Parenthood remains the greatest single preserve of the amateur.
author: ALVIN TOFFLER

quote: The word no carries a lot more meaning when spoken by a parent who also knows how to say yes.
author: JOYCE MAYNARD

quote: Lucky parents who have fine children usually have lucky children who have fine parents.
author: JAMES A. BREWER

quote: Grandchildren are God's way of compensating us for growing old.
author: MARY H. WALDRIP

quote: Few things are more delightful than grandchildren fighting over your lap.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: A grandmother is a person with too much wisdom to let that stop her from making a fool of herself over her grandchildren.
author: PHIL MOSS

quote: I have often thought what a melancholy world this would be without children—and what an inhuman world, without the aged.
author: SAMUEL TAYLOR COLERIDGE

quote: There's nothing like having grandchildren to restore your faith in heredity.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: The simplest toy, one which even the youngest child can operate, is called a grandparent.
author: SAM LEVENSON

quote: Nobody can do for little children what grandparents do. Grandparents sort of sprinkle stardust over the lives of little children.
author: ALEX HALEY

quote: I don't know who my grandfather was. I am much more concerned to know what his grandson will be.
author: ABRAHAM LINCOLN

quote: Children are the living messages we send to a time we will not see.
author: JOHN W. WHITEHEAD

quote: My best creation is my children.
author: DIANE VON FURSTENBERG

quote: Every child comes with the message that God is not yet discouraged of man.
author: RABINDRANATH TAGORE

quote: Children are the anchors that hold a mother to life.
author: SOPHOCLES

quote: It is not easy to be crafty and winsome at the same time, and few accomplish it after the age of six.
author: JOHN W. GARDNER AND FRANCESCA GARDNER REESE

quote: Perhaps parents would enjoy their children more if they stopped to realize that the film of childhood can never be run through for a second showing.
author: EVELYN NOWN

quote: Cherishing children is the mark of a civilized society.
author: JOAN GANZ COONEY

quote: Human beings are the only creatures on earth that allow their children to come back home.
author: BILL COSBY

quote: Life affords no greater responsibility, no greater privilege, than the raising of the next generation.
author: C. EVERETT KOOP, MD

quote: Children have more need of models than of critics.
author: CAROLYN COATS

quote: The greatest natural resource that any country can have is its children.
author: DANNY KAYE

quote: Although today there are many trial marriages, there is no such thing as a trial child.
author: GARY WILLS

quote: Never worry about the size of your Christmas tree. In the eyes of children, they are all 30 feet tall.
author: LARRY WILDE

quote: In the little world in which children have their existence, whosoever brings them up, there is nothing so finely perceived and so finely felt as injustice.
author: CHARLES DICKENS

quote: Children are innocent and love justice, while most adults are wicked and prefer mercy.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: Children's talent to endure stems from their ignorance of alternatives.
author: MAYA ANGELOU

quote: When I was a child, love to me was what the sea is to a fish: something you swim in while you are going about the important affairs of life.
author: P. L. TRAVERS

quote: I still live in and on the sunshine of my childhood.
author: CHRISTIAN MORGENSTERN

quote: There are no seven wonders of the world in the eyes of a child. There are seven million.
author: WALT STREIGHTIFF

quote: The penalty for censoring what your children may be taught is children who are brighter than you.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: If there is anything we wish to change in the child, we should first examine it and see whether it is not something that could better be changed in ourselves.
author: CARL G. JUNG

quote: Any child can tell you that the sole purpose of a middle name is so he can tell when he's really in trouble.
author: DENNIS FAKES

quote: When I approach a child, he inspires in me two sentiments: tenderness for what he is, and respect for what he may become.
author: LOUIS PASTEUR

quote: We worry about what a child will be tomorrow, yet we forget that he is someone today.
author: STACIA TAUSCHER

quote: If children grew up according to early indications, we should have nothing but geniuses.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: A child is the root of the heart.
author: CAROLINA MARÍA DE JESÚS

quote: There never was a child so lovely but his mother was glad to get him asleep.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Ask your child what he wants for dinner only if he's buying.
author: FRAN LEBOWITZ

quote: Telling a teenager the facts of life is like giving a fish a bath.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Children have never been good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
author: JAMES BALDWIN

quote: Oh, what a tangled web do parents weave when they think that their children are naive.
author: OGDEN NASH

quote: Babies are always more trouble than you thought—and more wonderful.
author: CHARLES OSGOOD

quote: The one thing children wear out faster than shoes is parents.
author: JOHN J. PLOMP

quote: Children aren't happy with nothing to ignore, And that's what parents were created for.
author: OGDEN NASH

quote: Parents are the bones on which children cut their teeth.
author: PETER USTINOV

quote: Play is often talked about as if it were a relief from serious learning. But for children play is serious learning. Play is really the work of childhood.
author: FRED ROGERS

quote: Having a young child explain something exciting he has seen is the finest example of communication you will ever hear or see.
author: BOB TALBERT

quote: There's nothing that can help you understand your beliefs more than trying to explain them to an inquisitive child.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: The greatest aid to adult education is children.
author: CHARLIE T. JONES AND BOB PHILLIPS

quote: Children are like wet cement. Whatever falls on them makes an impression.
author: HAIM GINOTT

quote: Children are not things to be molded, but are people to be unfolded.
author: JESS LAIR

quote: When everything is astonishing, nothing is astonishing; this is how the world is to children.
author: ANTOINE RIVAROLI

quote: You don't really understand human nature unless you know why a child on a merry-go-round will wave at his parents every time around and why his parents will always wave back.
author: WILLIAM D. TAMMEUS

quote: A child is not a vase to be filled, but a fire to be lit.
author: RABELAIS

quote: Kids are always the only future the human race has.
author: WILLIAM SAROYAN

quote: The most important thing that parents can teach their children is how to get along without them.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: We set standards for drugs, because bad drugs cross state lines. Well, badly educated children cross state lines, too.
author: ADM. HYMAN G. RICKOVER

quote: If you want your children to keep their feet on the ground, put some responsibility on their shoulders.
author: ABIGAIL VAN BUREN

quote: Loving a child doesn't mean giving in to all his whims; to love him is to bring out the best in him, to teach him to love what is difficult.
author: NADIA BOULANGER

quote: The best things you can give children, next to good habits, are good memories.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: A child, like your stomach, doesn't need all you can afford to give it.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: The best security blanket a child can have is parents who respect each other.
author: JAN BLAUSTONE

quote: The best inheritance a parent can give his children is a few minutes of his time each day.
author: O. A. BATTISTA

quote: Any kid who has two parents who are interested in him and has a houseful of books isn't poor.
author: SAM LEVENSON

quote: Sometimes the poorest man leaves his children the richest inheritance.
author: RUTH E. RENKEL

quote: The greatest gifts you can give your children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence.
author: DENIS WAITLEY

quote: A truly rich man is one whose children run into his arms when his hands are empty.
author: Spotlight (Boise, Idaho)

quote: I have found that the best way to give advice to your children is to find out what they want, and then advise them to do it.
author: HARRY S. TRUMAN

quote: If a child lives with approval, he learns to like himself.
author: DOROTHY LAW NOLTE
