quote: Parents need to fill a child's bucket of self-esteem so high that the rest of the world can't poke enough holes in it to drain it dry.
author: ALVIN PRICE

quote: Every adult needs a child to teach; it's the way adults learn.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: Children are likely to live up to what you believe of them.
author: LADY BIRD JOHNSON

quote: If you can't hold children in your arms, please hold them in your heart.
author: MOTHER CLARA HALE

quote: You cannot train a horse with shouts and expect it to obey a whisper.
author: DAGOBERT D. RUNES

quote: What's done to children, they will do to society.
author: DR. KARL MENNINGER

quote: What a father says to his children is not heard by the world; but it will be heard by posterity.
author: JEAN PAUL RICHTER

quote: Never fear spoiling children by making them too happy. Happiness is the atmosphere in which all good affections grow.
author: THOMAS BRAY

quote: The only thing worth stealing is a kiss from a sleeping child.
author: JOE HOULDSWORTH

quote: Manners are the happy way of doing things.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Manners are a sensitive awareness of the feelings of others. If you have that awareness, you have good manners, no matter what fork you use.
author: EMILY POST

quote: Most arts require long study and application, but the most useful of all, that of pleasing, requires only the desire.
author: LORD CHESTERFIELD

quote: Life is not so short but that there is always time for courtesy.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Politeness is the art of selecting among one's real thoughts.
author: MADAME DE STAËL

quote: To have a respect for ourselves guides our morals; to have a deference for others governs our manners.
author: LAURENCE STERNE

quote: Manners are like the zero in arithmetic; they may not be much in themselves, but they are capable of adding a great deal to the value of everything else.
author: FREYA STARK

quote: Etiquette is getting sleepy in company and not showing it.
author: HYMAN MAXWELL BERSTON

quote: You can get through life with bad manners, but it's easier with good manners.
author: LILLIAN GISH

quote: Diplomacy gets you out of what tact would have kept you out of.
author: BRIAN BOWLING

quote: The point of tact is not sharp.
author: COLLEEN CARNEY

quote: People with tact have less to retract.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Tact consists in knowing how far we may go too far.
author: JEAN COCTEAU

quote: Tact is the knack of making a point without making an enemy.
author: HOWARD W. NEWTON

quote: Tact is the art of making guests feel at home when that's really where you wish they were.
author: GEORGE E. BERGMAN

quote: Tact is rubbing out another's mistake instead of rubbing it in.
author: Farmers Almanac

quote: Tact is the art of recognizing when to be big and when not to belittle.
author: BILL COPELAND

quote: Tact is the ability to stay in the middle without getting caught there.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: Tact is the art of convincing people that they know more than you do.
author: RAYMOND MORTIMER

quote: Tact is the art of building a fire under people without making their blood boil.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: Never insult an alligator until after you have crossed the river.
author: CORDELL HULL

quote: The truly free man is he who knows how to decline a dinner invitation without giving an excuse.
author: JULES RENARD

quote: Every generation is convinced there has been a deplorable breakdown of manners.
author: BYRON DOBELL

quote: To be agreeable in society, you must consent to be taught many things which you already know.
author: TALLEYRAND

quote: It takes a lot of thought and effort and downright determination to be agreeable.
author: RAY D. EVERSON

quote: Praise is like champagne; it should be served while it is still bubbling.
author: Robins Reader

quote: Charm is the quality in others that makes us more satisfied with ourselves.
author: HENRI FRÉDÉRIC AMIEL

quote: A gentleman is a man who uses a butter knife when dining alone.
author: W. F. DETTLE

quote: Nothing prevents us from being natural so much as the desire to appear so.
author: FRANÇOIS DE LA ROCHEFOUCAULD

quote: It is a great mistake for men to give up paying compliments, for when they give up saying what is charming, they give up thinking what is charming.
author: OSCAR WILDE

quote: Politeness is to human nature what warmth is to wax.
author: ARTHUR SCHOPENHAUER

quote: He who says what he likes, hears what he does not like.
author: LEONARD LOUIS LEVINSON

quote: The manner in which it is given is worth more than the gift.
author: PIERRE CORNEILLE

quote: To receive a present handsomely and in a right spirit, even when you have none to give in return, is to give one in return.
author: LEIGH HUNT

quote: It is much easier to be a hero than a gentleman.
author: LUIGI PIRANDELLO

quote: Never claim as a right what you can ask as a favor.
author: JOHN CHURTON COLLINS

quote: To err is human; to refrain from laughing, humane.
author: LANE OLINGHOUSE

quote: Some people strengthen the society just by being the kind of people they are.
author: JOHN W. GARDNER

quote: Every one of us has in him a continent of undiscovered character. Blessed is he who acts the Columbus to his own soul.
author: Charles L. Wallis

quote: Character is a strange blending of flinty strength and pliable warmth.
author: ROBERT SHAFFER

quote: No man knows his true character until he has run out of gas, purchased something on the installment plan, and raised an adolescent.
author: EDNA MCCANN

quote: Character may be manifested in the great moments, but it is made in the small ones.
author: PHILLIPS BROOKS

quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
author: ABRAHAM LINCOLN

quote: Everyone journeys through character as well as through time. The person one becomes depends on the person one has been.
author: DICK FRANCIS

quote: Character consists of what you do on the third and fourth tries.
author: JAMES MICHENER

quote: You can measure a man by the opposition it takes to discourage him.
author: ROBERT C. SAVAGE

quote: We know what a person thinks not when he tells us what he thinks, but by his actions.
author: ISAAC BASHEVIS SINGER

quote: Another flaw in the human character is that everybody wants to build and nobody wants to do maintenance.
author: KURT VONNEGUT

quote: Men are men before they are lawyers, or physicians, or merchants, or manufacturers; and if you make them capable and sensible men, they will make themselves capable and sensible lawyers or physicians.
author: JOHN STUART MILL

quote: The severest test of character is not so much the ability to keep a secret as it is, when the secret is finally out, to refrain from disclosing that you knew it all along.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Show me the man you honor, and I will know what kind of man you are.
author: THOMAS CARLYLE

quote: People need responsibility. They resist assuming it, but they cannot get along without it.
author: JOHN STEINBECK

quote: If anyone thinks he has no responsibilities, it is because he has not sought them out.
author: MARY LYON

quote: Duty is a very personal thing. It is what comes from knowing the need to take action and not just a need to urge others to do something.
author: MOTHER TERESA OF CALCUTTA

quote: Our concern is not how to worship in the catacombs, but rather how to remain human in the skyscrapers.
author: RABBI ABRAHAM JOSHUA HESCHEL

quote: The treacherous, unexplored areas of the world are not in continents or the seas; they are in the minds and hearts of men.
author: ALLEN E. CLAXTON

quote: The truth about a man is, first of all, what it is that he keeps hidden.
author: ANDRÉ MALRAUX

quote: Men show their character in nothing more clearly than by what they think laughable.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.
author: PLATO

quote: There are two insults no human being will endure: that he has no sense of humor, and that he has never known trouble.
author: SINCLAIR LEWIS

quote: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
author: HEYWOOD HALE BROUN

quote: How a man plays the game shows something of his character; how he loses shows all of it.
author: Tribune (Camden County, Georgia)

quote: In our play we reveal what kind of people we are.
author: OVID

quote: You can tell more about a person by what he says about others than you can by what others say about him.
author: LEO AIKMAN

quote: Character is what you know you are, not what others think you are.
author: MARVA COLLINS AND CIVIA TAMARKIN

quote: You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him.
author: JAMES D. MILES

quote: Character is much easier kept than recovered.
author: THOMAS PAINE

quote: The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what you desire to appear.
author: SOCRATES

quote: A good reputation is better than fame.
author: LOUIS DUDEK

quote: Reputation is character minus what you've been caught doing.
author: MICHAEL IAPOCE

quote: Life is for one generation; a good name is forever.
author: JAPANESE PROVERB

quote: To have lost your reputation is to be dead among the living.
author: S. H. SIMMONS

quote: Modesty is to merit what shade is to figures in a picture; it gives it strength and makes it stand out.
author: JEAN DE LA BRUYÈRE

quote: Modesty is the clothing of talent.
author: PIERRE VERON

quote: He who is slowest in making a promise is most faithful in its performance.
author: JEAN JACQUES ROUSSEAU

quote: The only way to make a man trustworthy is to trust him.
author: HENRY L. STIMSON

quote: Willpower is being able to eat just one salted peanut.
author: PAT ELPHINSTONE

quote: The best discipline, maybe the only discipline that really works, is self-discipline.
author: WALTER KIECHEL III

quote: You can find on the outside only what you possess on the inside.
author: ADOLFO MONTIEL BALLESTEROS

quote: In great matters men show themselves as they wish to be seen; in small matters, as they are.
author: GAMALIEL BRADFORD

quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are small matters compared to what lies within us.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: I see God in every human being.
author: MOTHER TERESA OF CALCUTTA

quote: Men may be divided almost any way we please, but I have found the most useful distinction to be made between those who devote their lives to conjugating the verb "to be," and those who spend their lives conjugating the verb "to have."
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: There is more simplicity in the man who eats caviar on impulse than in the man who eats Grape Nuts on principle.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: One of the best ways to measure people is to watch the way they behave when something free is offered.
author: ANN LANDERS

quote: Say not you know a man entirely till you have divided an inheritance with him.
author: JOHANN KASPAR LAVATER

quote: Not what I have but what I do is my kingdom.
author: THOMAS CARLYLE

quote: The reputation of a thousand years may be determined by the conduct of one hour.
author: JAPANESE PROVERB

quote: Fame is the perfume of heroic deeds.
author: SOCRATES

quote: Dollars have never been known to produce character, and character will never be produced by money.
author: W. K. KELLOGG

quote: One isn't born one's self. One is born with a mass of expectations, a mass of other people's ideas—and you have to work through it all.
author: V. S. NAIPAUL

quote: Don't laugh at a youth for his affectations; he is only trying on one face after another to find a face of his own.
author: LOGAN PEARSALL SMITH

quote: It has amazed me that the most incongruous traits should exist in the same person and, for all that, yield a plausible harmony.
author: W. SOMERSET MAUGHAM

quote: We spend our time searching for security and hate it when we get it.
author: JOHN STEINBECK

quote: Without heroes, we are all plain people and don't know how far we can go.
author: BERNARD MALAMUD

quote: The great man is he who does not lose his child-heart.
author: MENCIUS

quote: No great scoundrel is ever uninteresting.
author: MURRAY KEMPTON

quote: Characters live to be noticed. People with character notice how they live.
author: NANCY MOSER

quote: Man is harder than iron, stronger than stone and more fragile than a rose.
author: TURKISH PROVERB

quote: He is ill clothed that is bare of virtue.
author: BENJAMIN FRANKLIN

quote: All of us are experts at practicing virtue at a distance.
author: THEODORE M. HESBURGH

quote: To err is human; to blame it on the other guy is even more human.
author: BOB GODDARD

quote: Man is the only kind of varmint sets his own trap, baits it, then steps in it.
author: JOHN STEINBECK

quote: There's man all over for you, blaming on his boots the faults of his feet.
author: SAMUEL BECKETT

quote: An optimist stays up until midnight to see the new year in. A pessimist stays up to make sure the old year leaves.
author: BILL VAUGHAN

quote: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
author: COLIN POWELL

quote: I will say this about being an optimist—even when things don't turn out well, you are certain they will get better.
author: FRANK HUGHES

quote: An optimist thinks this is the best of all worlds. A pessimist fears the same may be true.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Things will probably come out all right, but sometimes it takes strong nerves just to watch.
author: HEDLEY DONOVAN

quote: The optimist already sees the scar over the wound; the pessimist still sees the wound underneath the scar.
author: ERNST SCHRODER

quote: The point of living, and of being an optimist, is to be foolish enough to believe the best is yet to come.
author: PETER USTINOV

quote: It doesn't hurt to be optimistic. You can always cry later.
author: LUCIMAR SANTOS DE LIMA

quote: Cheerfulness, like spring, opens all the blossoms of the inward man.
author: JEAN PAUL RICHTER

quote: An optimist is the human personification of spring.
author: SUSAN J. BISSONETTE

quote: I always prefer to believe the best of everybody—it saves so much trouble.
author: RUDYARD KIPLING

quote: A positive attitude may not solve all your problems, but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effort.
author: HERM ALBRIGHT

quote: Optimism is an intellectual choice.
author: DIANA SCHNEIDER

quote: Optimism is a cheerful frame of mind that enables a teakettle to sing though in hot water up to its nose.
author: HAROLD HELFER

quote: An optimist is a person who starts a new diet on Thanksgiving Day.
author: IRV KUPCINET

quote: The average pencil is seven inches long, with just a half-inch eraser—in case you thought optimism was dead.
author: ROBERT BRAULT

quote: Both optimists and pessimists contribute to our society. The optimist invents the airplane and the pessimist the parachute.
author: GIL STERN

quote: A pessimist? That's a person who has been intimately acquainted with an optimist.
author: ELBERT HUBBARD

quote: Pessimism never won any battle.
author: DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER

quote: The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised.
author: GEORGE F. WILL

quote: I don't believe in pessimism. If something doesn't come up the way you want, forge ahead. If you think it's going to rain, it will.
author: CLINT EASTWOOD

quote: No one really knows enough to be a pessimist.
author: NORMAN COUSINS

quote: The optimist is the kind of person who believes a housefly is looking for a way out.
author: GEORGE JEAN NATHAN

quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
author: WILLIAM ARTHUR WARD

quote: A pessimist sees only the dark side of the clouds, and mopes; a philosopher sees both sides, and shrugs; an optimist doesn't see the clouds at all—he's walking on them.
author: LEONARD LOUIS LEVINSON

quote: An idealist believes the short run doesn't count. A cynic believes the long run doesn't matter. A realist believes that what is done or left undone in the short run determines the long run.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Morality is its own advocate; it is never necessary to apologize for it.
author: EDITH L. HARRELL

quote: The three hardest tasks in the world are neither physical feats nor intellectual achievements, but moral acts: to return love for hate, to include the excluded, and to say, "I was wrong."
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Moral excellence comes about as a result of habit. We become just by doing just acts, temperate by doing temperate acts, brave by doing brave acts.
author: ARISTOTLE

quote: It is much easier to repent of sins that we have committed than to repent of those we intend to commit.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: The biggest threat to our well-being is the absence of moral clarity and purpose.
author: RICK SHUMAN

quote: We laugh at honor and are shocked to find traitors in our midst.
author: C. S. LEWIS

quote: It's discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.
author: NOËL COWARD

quote: A good example is like a bell that calls many to church.
author: DANISH PROVERB

quote: One man practicing sportsmanship is far better than 50 preaching it.
author: KNUTE K. ROCKNE

quote: The time is always right to do what is right.
author: REV. MARTIN LUTHER KING JR.

quote: Count no day lost in which you waited your turn, took only your share and sought advantage over no one.
author: ROBERT BRAULT

quote: The glory of great men should always be measured by the means they have used to acquire it.
author: FRANÇOIS DE LA ROCHEFOUCAULD

quote: To have a right to do a thing is not at all the same as to be right in doing it.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: If you're going to do something tonight that you'll be sorry for tomorrow morning, sleep late.
author: HENNY YOUNGMAN

quote: Be on guard against excess. Zeal that is too ardent burns more than it reheats.
author: ALEC PELLETIER

quote: What is right is often forgotten by what is convenient.
author: BODIE THOENE

quote: The arm of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.
author: REV. MARTIN LUTHER KING JR.

quote: If you don't want anyone to know, don't do it.
author: CHINESE PROVERB

quote: No virtue can be great if it is not constant.
author: ALFONSO MILAGRO

quote: Live so that your friends can defend you but never have to.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Always put off until tomorrow what you shouldn't do at all.
author: MORRIS MANDEL

quote: You can't run a society or cope with its problems if people are not held accountable for what they do.
author: JOHN LEO

quote: Stigmas are the corollaries of values. If work, independence, responsibility, respectability are valued, then their converse must be devalued, seen as disreputable.
author: GERTRUDE HIMMELFARB

quote: The essence of immorality is the tendency to make an exception of myself.
author: JANE ADDAMS

quote: He who does not prevent a crime when he can, encourages it.
author: SENECA

quote: A sense of shame is not a bad moral compass.
author: GEN. COLIN POWELL

quote: One of the misfortunes of our time is that in getting rid of false shame we have killed off so much real shame as well.
author: LOUIS KRONENBERGER

quote: If moral behavior were simply following rules, we could program a computer to be moral.
author: SAMUEL P. GINDER

quote: It is unwise to do unto others as you would that they do unto you. Their tastes may not be the same.
author: BERNARD SHAW

quote: What you dislike for yourself do not like for me.
author: SPANISH PROVERB

quote: Boredom is a vital problem for the moralist, since at least half the sins of mankind are caused by the fear of it.
author: BERTRAND RUSSELL

quote: The principal mark of genius is not perfection but originality, the opening of new frontiers.
author: ARTHUR KOESTLER

quote: Originality is unexplored territory. You get there by carrying a canoe—you can't take a taxi.
author: ALAN ALDA

quote: The only real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.
author: MARCEL PROUST

quote: You don't get harmony when everybody sings the same note.
author: DOUG FLOYD

quote: Since God made us to be originals, why stoop to be a copy?
author: REV. BILLY GRAHAM

quote: While an original is always hard to find, he is easy to recognize.
author: JOHN L. MASON

quote: The courage to imagine the otherwise is our greatest resource, adding color and suspense to all our life.
author: DANIEL J. BOORSTIN

quote: Discoveries are often made by not following instructions, by going off the main road, by trying the untried.
author: FRANK TYGER

quote: It is by logic that we prove, but by intuition that we discover.
author: HENRI POINCARÉ

quote: Don't expect anything original from an echo.
author: The 365 Great Quotes-a-Year Calendar

quote: Truth always originates in a minority of one, and every custom begins as a broken precedent.
author: WILL DURANT

quote: Eventually it comes to you: the thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.
author: LORRAINE HANSBERRY

quote: If you're strong enough, there are no precedents.
author: F. SCOTT FITZGERALD

quote: The more original a discovery, the more obvious it seems afterward.
author: ARTHUR KOESTLER

quote: To go against the dominant thinking of your friends, of most of the people you see every day, is perhaps the most difficult act of heroism you can perform.
author: THEODORE H. WHITE

quote: Every society honors its live conformists and its dead troublemakers.
author: MIGNON MCLAUGHLIN

quote: Everyone has talent; what is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark place where it leads.
author: ERICA JONG

quote: To do what others cannot do is talent. To do what talent cannot do is genius.
author: WILL HENRY

quote: When there is an original sound in the world, it wakens a hundred echoes.
author: JOHN A. SHEDD

quote: The cynic says, “One man can’t do anything.” I say, “Only one man can do anything.” One man interacting creatively with others can move the world.
author: JOHN W. GARDNER

quote: Everything has been thought of before, but the difficulty is to think of it again.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: Inspiration is never genuine if it is known as inspiration at the time. True inspiration always steals on a person, its importance not being fully recognized for some time.
author: SAMUEL BUTLER

quote: The work of the individual still remains the spark that moves mankind forward.
author: IGOR SIKORSKY

quote: The most powerful weapon on earth is the human soul on fire.
author: FERDINAND FOCH

quote: Whatever comes from the heart carries the heat and color of its birthplace.
author: OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES SR.

quote: We might define an eccentric as a man who is a law unto himself, and a crank as one who, having determined what the law is, insists on laying it down to others.
author: LOUIS KRONENBERGER

quote: No two men are alike, and both of them are happy for it.
author: MORRIS MANDEL

quote: Some people march to a different drummer—and some people polka.
author: Los Angeles Times Syndicate

quote: The real secret of patience is to find something else to do in the meantime.
author: Dell Pencil Puzzles and Word Games

quote: I endeavor to be wise when I cannot be merry, easy when I cannot be glad, content with what cannot be mended and patient when there be no redress.
author: ELIZABETH MONTAGU

quote: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
author: CHINESE EPIGRAM

quote: He that can have patience can have what he will.
author: BENJAMIN FRANKLIN

quote: The key to everything is patience. You get the chicken by hatching the egg, not by smashing it.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Patience! The windmill never strays in search of the wind.
author: ANDY J. SKLIVIS

quote: Nothing valuable can be lost by taking time.
author: ABRAHAM LINCOLN

quote: In any contest between power and patience, bet on patience.
author: W. B. PRESCOTT

quote: Beware the fury of a patient man.
author: JOHN DRYDEN

quote: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
author: JEAN JACQUES ROUSSEAU

quote: Patience is the art of hoping.
author: VAUVENARGUES

quote: Be patient with everyone, but above all with yourself.
author: ST. FRANCIS DE SALES

quote: Patience is the ability to put up with people you’d like to put down.
author: ULRIKE RUFFERT

quote: There is a limit at which forbearance ceases to be a virtue.
author: EDMUND BURKE

quote: Patience is something you admire in the driver behind you and scorn in the one ahead.
author: MAC MCCLEARY

quote: Waiting is worse than knowing. Grief rends the heart cleanly, that it may begin to heal; waiting shreds the spirit.
author: MORGAN LLYWELYN

quote: There’s a fine line between fishing and standing on the shore like an idiot.
author: STEVEN WRIGHT

quote: Regardless of how much patience we have, we would prefer never to use any of it.
author: JAMES T. O’BRIEN

quote: A man without patience is a lamp without oil.
author: ANDRÉS SEGOVIA

quote: Impatience can be a virtue, if you practice it on yourself.
author: ROD MCKUEN

quote: He who is impatient waits twice.
author: MACK MCGINNIS

quote: One of the great disadvantages of hurry is that it takes such a long time.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: We may be willing to tell a story twice but we are never willing to hear it more than once.
author: WILLIAM HAZLITT

quote: How can a society that exists on instant mashed potatoes, packaged cake mixes, frozen dinners, and instant cameras teach patience to its young?
author: PAUL SWEENEY

quote: Patience often gets the credit that belongs to fatigue.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: The difference between a hero and a coward is one step sideways.
author: GENE HACKMAN

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.
author: The Diary of Anaïs Nin

quote: Real courage is when you know you’re licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.
author: HARPER LEE

quote: Courage is being scared to death—and saddling up anyway.
author: JOHN WAYNE

quote: It is often easier to fight for principles than to live up to them.
author: ADLAI E. STEVENSON

quote: Courage is the art of being the only one who knows you’re scared to death.
author: EARL WILSON

quote: Facing it—always facing it—that’s the way to get through. Face it!
author: JOSEPH CONRAD

quote: Pain nourishes courage. You can’t be brave if you’ve only had wonderful things happen to you.
author: MARY TYLER MOORE

quote: Success is never final and failure never total. It’s courage that counts.
author: Success Unlimited

quote: Courage is the ladder on which all the other virtues mount.
author: CLARE BOOTHE LUCE

quote: It’s when you run away that you’re most liable to stumble.
author: CASEY ROBINSON

quote: Curiosity will conquer fear even more than bravery will.
author: JAMES STEPHENS

quote: Courage is often lack of insight, whereas cowardice in many cases is based on good information.
author: PETER USTINOV

quote: Bravery never goes out of fashion.
author: WILLIAM MAKEPEACE THACKERAY

quote: There is a time to take counsel of your fears, and there is a time to never listen to any fear.
author: GEN. GEORGE S. PATTON

quote: Keep your fears to yourself, but share your courage.
author: ROBERT LOUIS STEVENSON

quote: You can’t test courage cautiously.
author: ANNIE DILLARD

quote: Courage is not the towering oak that sees storms come and go; it is the fragile blossom that opens in the snow.
author: ALICE MACKENZIE SWAIM

quote: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are stiffened.
author: REV. BILLY GRAHAM

quote: The way you overcome shyness is to become so wrapped up in something that you forget to be afraid.
author: LADY BIRD JOHNSON

quote: A little kindness from person to person is better than a vast love for all humankind.
author: RICHARD DEHMEL

quote: The everyday kindness of the back roads more than makes up for the acts of greed in the headlines.
author: CHARLES KURALT

quote: A profusion of pink roses bending ragged in the rain speaks to me of all gentleness and its enduring.
author: The Collected Later Poems of William Carlos Williams

quote: Resolve to be tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving, and tolerant with the weak and the wrong. Sometime in life you will have been all of these.
author: BOB GODDARD

quote: The heart is the toughest part of the body. Tenderness is in the hands.
author: CAROLYN FORCHÉ

quote: You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Life is short and we never have enough time for gladdening the hearts of those who travel the way with us. Oh, be swift to love! Make haste to be kind.
author: HENRI FRÉDÉRIC AMIEL

quote: There is nothing stronger in the world than gentleness.
author: HAN SUYIN

quote: How sweet it is when the strong are also gentle!
author: LIBBIE FUDIM

quote: Kindness consists in loving people more than they deserve.
author: JOSEPH JOUBERT

quote: Kindness is never wasted. If it has no effect on the recipient, at least it benefits the bestower.
author: S. H. SIMMONS

quote: Write injuries in sand, kindnesses in marble.
author: FRENCH PROVERB

quote: Ask any decent person what he thinks matters most in human conduct: five to one his answer will be “kindness.”
author: KENNETH CLARK

quote: Two important things are to have a genuine interest in people and to be kind to them. Kindness, I’ve discovered, is everything in life.
author: ISAAC BASHEVIS SINGER

quote: Always try to be a little kinder than is necessary.
author: JAMES M. BARRIE

quote: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
author: THEODORE ISAAC RUBIN, MD

quote: When I was young, I admired clever people. Now that I am old, I admire kind people.
author: ABRAHAM JOSHUA HESCHEL

quote: Praise can give criticism a lead around the first turn and still win the race.
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: How beautiful a day can be when kindness touches it.
author: GEORGE ELLISTON

quote: One kind word can warm three winter months.
author: JAPANESE PROVERB

quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
author: MOTHER TERESA OF CALCUTTA

quote: Tenderness is passion in repose.
author: JOSEPH JOUBERT

quote: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can read.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: Kindness can become its own motive. We are made kind by being kind.
author: ERIC HOFFER

quote: A pat on the back, though only a few vertebrae removed from a kick in the pants, is miles ahead in results.
author: BENNETT CERF

quote: A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.
author: WILLIAM ARTHUR WARD

quote: When we put ourselves in the other person’s place, we’re less likely to want to put him in his place.
author: Farmer’s Digest

quote: He best can pity who has felt the woe.
author: JOHN GAY

quote: Could a greater miracle take place than for us to look through each other’s eyes for an instant?
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view.
author: HARPER LEE

quote: Feelings are everywhere—be gentle.
author: J. MASAI

quote: Never does the human soul appear so strong and noble as when it forgoes revenge and dares to forgive an injury.
author: E. H. CHAPIN

quote: One of the most lasting pleasures you can experience is the feeling that comes over you when you genuinely forgive an enemy—whether he knows it or not.
author: O. A. BATTISTA

quote: A forgiveness ought to be like a canceled note, torn in two and burned up, so that it can never be shown against the man.
author: HENRY WARD BEECHER

quote: Forgiving and being forgiven are two names for the same thing. The important thing is that a discord has been resolved.
author: C. S. LEWIS

quote: He who cannot forgive others destroys the bridge over which he himself must pass.
author: GEORGE HERBERT

quote: When a deep injury is done us, we never recover until we forgive.
author: ALAN PATON

quote: Forgiveness is a gift of high value. Yet its cost is nothing.
author: BETTY SMITH

quote: One of the secrets of a long and fruitful life is to forgive everybody everything every night before you go to bed.
author: ANN LANDERS

quote: Forgiveness is a funny thing. It warms the heart and cools the sting.
author: WILLIAM ARTHUR WARD

quote: Forgive your enemies—if you can’t get back at them any other way.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: Goodness is the only investment that never fails.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: On the whole, human beings want to be good, but not too good, and not quite all the time.
author: GEORGE ORWELL

quote: All that is worth cherishing in this world begins in the heart, not the head.
author: SUZANNE CHAZIN

quote: Ten thousand bad traits cannot make a single good one any the less good.
author: ROBERT LOUIS STEVENSON

quote: The line separating good and evil passes not through states, nor between political parties either—but right through every human heart.
author: ALEKSANDR I. SOLZHENITSYN

quote: Those who bring sunshine to the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
author: JAMES MATTHEW BARRIE

quote: It’s not true that nice guys finish last. Nice guys are winners before the game even starts.
author: ADDISON WALKER

quote: Sincerity resembles a spice. Too much repels you and too little leaves you wanting.
author: BILL COPELAND

quote: If you haven’t any charity in your heart, you have the worst kind of heart trouble.
author: BOB HOPE

quote: The work of an unknown good man is like a vein of water flowing hidden underground, secretly making the ground greener.
author: THOMAS CARLYLE

quote: Generosity always wins favor, particularly when accompanied by modesty.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: People want to know how much you care before they care how much you know.
author: JAMES F. HIND

quote: Goodwill is earned by many acts; it can be lost by one.
author: DUNCAN STUART

quote: Gratitude is a sometime thing in this world. Just because you’ve been feeding them all winter, don’t expect the birds to take it easy on your grass seed.
author: BILL VAUGHAN

quote: Gratitude is the memory of the heart.
author: J. B. MASSIEU

quote: Swift gratitude is the sweetest.
author: GREEK PROVERB

quote: The hardest arithmetic to master is that which enables us to count our blessings.
author: ERIC HOFFER

quote: Silent gratitude isn’t very much use to anyone.
author: G. B. STERN

quote: Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.
author: WILLIAM ARTHUR WARD

quote: One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.
author: GEORGE ELIOT

quote: To know the value of generosity, it is necessary to have suffered from the cold indifference of others.
author: EUGENE CLOUTIER

quote: Sometimes we need to remind ourselves that thankfulness is indeed a virtue.
author: WILLIAM J. BENNETT

quote: Appreciation is like an insurance policy. It has to be renewed every now and then.
author: DAVE MCINTYRE

quote: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after another.
author: WALTER ELLIOTT

quote: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: JAPANESE PROVERB

quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal. My strength lies solely in my tenacity.
author: LOUIS PASTEUR

quote: Great works are performed, not by strength, but by perseverance.
author: SAMUEL JOHNSON

quote: Vitality shows not only in the ability to persist but in the ability to start over.
author: F. SCOTT FITZGERALD

quote: By perseverance the snail reached the ark.
author: CHARLES HADDON SPURGEON

quote: In the confrontation between the stream and the rock, the stream always wins—not through strength but by perseverance.
author: H. JACKSON BROWN

quote: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight—it’s the size of the fight in the dog.
author: DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER

quote: A professional is someone who can do his best work when he doesn’t feel like it.
author: ALISTAIR COOKE

quote: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: CHINESE PROVERB

quote: If you can find a path with no obstacles, it probably doesn’t lead anywhere.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: Perseverance is the hard work you do after you get tired of doing the hard work you already did.
author: NEWT GINGRICH

quote: Go the extra mile. It’s never crowded.
author: Executive Speechwriter Newsletter

quote: Lord, give me the determination and tenacity of a weed.
author: MRS. LEON R. WALTERS

quote: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
author: ABRAHAM LINCOLN

quote: We all know a fool when we see one—but not when we are one.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: It is wise to remember that you are one of those who can be fooled some of the time.
author: LAURENCE J. PETER

quote: There is a foolish corner in the brain of the wisest man.
author: ARISTOTLE

quote: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.
author: COLETTE

quote: April 1 is the day upon which we are reminded what we are on the other 364.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: Only a fool tests the depth of the water with both feet.
author: AFRICAN PROVERB

quote: Anyone can make a mistake. A fool insists on repeating it.
author: ROBERTINE MAYNARD

quote: A fool judges people by the presents they give him.
author: CHINESE SAYING

quote: Astrology proves one scientific fact, and one only; there’s one born every minute.
author: PATRICK MOORE

quote: Only a fool argues with a skunk, a mule or the cook.
author: HARRY OLIVER

quote: The ultimate result of shielding men from the effects of folly is to fill the world with fools.
author: HERBERT SPENCER

quote: The surprising thing about young fools is how many survive to become old fools.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Self-delusion is pulling in your stomach when you step on the scales.
author: PAUL SWEENEY

quote: Any fool can criticize, condemn and complain—and most do.
author: DALE CARNEGIE

quote: Anybody with money to burn will easily find someone to tend the fire.
author: Pocket Crossword Puzzles

quote: Follies change their type but foolishness remains.
author: ERICH KASTNER

quote: I’m not denyin’ the women are foolish: God Almighty made ’em to match the men.
author: GEORGE ELIOT

quote: Let us be thankful for the fools. But for them the rest of us could not succeed.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: Everybody has the right to express what he thinks. That, of course, lets the crackpots in. But if you cannot tell a crackpot when you see one, then you ought to be taken in.
author: HARRY S. TRUMAN

quote: Some people get lost in thought because it’s such unfamiliar territory.
author: G. BEHN

quote: A fanatic is someone who can’t change his mind and won’t change the subject.
author: WINSTON CHURCHILL

quote: While intelligent people can often simplify the complex, a fool is more likely to complicate the simple.
author: GERALD W. GRUMET, MD

quote: There are 40 kinds of lunacy, but only one kind of common sense.
author: AFRICAN PROVERB

quote: A bore is someone who persists in holding his own views after we have enlightened him with ours.
author: MALCOLM S. FORBES

quote: Bores bore each other, too, but it never seems to teach them anything.
author: DON MARQUIS

quote: Some people can stay longer in an hour than others can in a week.
author: WILLIAM DEAN HOWELLS

quote: A healthy male adult bore consumes each year one-and-a-half times his own weight in other people’s patience.
author: JOHN UPDIKE

quote: Everyone is a bore to someone. That is unimportant. The thing to avoid is being a bore to oneself.
author: GERALD BRENAN

quote: A bore is a fellow talker who can change the subject to his topic of conversation faster than you can change it back to yours.
author: LAURENCE J. PETER

quote: People who insist on telling their dreams are among the terrors of the breakfast table.
author: MAX BEERBOHM

quote: Don’t approach a goat from the front, a horse from the back or a fool from any side.
author: YIDDISH PROVERB

quote: Human reason is like a drunken man on horseback; set it up on one side, and it tumbles over on the other.
author: MARTIN LUTHER

quote: More good things in life are lost by indifference than ever were lost by active hostility.
author: ROBERT GORDON MENZIES

quote: Apathy is the glove into which evil slips its hand.
author: BODIE THOENE

quote: Love me or hate me, but spare me your indifference.
author: LIBBIE FUDIM

quote: I have a very strong feeling that the opposite of love is not hate—it’s apathy.
author: LEO BUSCAGLIA

quote: It is a perplexing and unpleasant truth that when men have something worth fighting for, they do not feel like fighting.
author: ERIC HOFFER

quote: There is nothing harder than the softness of indifference.
author: JUAN MONTALVO

quote: The tragedy of modern man is not that he knows less and less about the meaning of his own life but that it bothers him less and less.
author: VACLAV HAVEL

quote: Crime expands according to our willingness to put up with it.
author: BARRY FARBER

quote: Grow angry slowly—there’s plenty of time.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
author: ROBERT G. INGERSOLL

quote: Anger is not only inevitable, it is necessary. Its absence means indifference, the most disastrous of all human failings.
author: ARTHUR PONSONBY

quote: Anger is a symptom, a way of cloaking and expressing feelings too awful to experience directly—hurt, bitterness, grief and, most of all, fear.
author: JOAN RIVERS

quote: Getting angry can sometimes be like leaping into a wonderfully responsive sports car, gunning the motor, taking off at high speed and then discovering the brakes are out of order.
author: MAGGIE SCARF

quote: Anyone can become angry. That is easy. But to be angry with the right person, to the right degree, at the right time, for the right purpose and in the right way—that is not easy.
author: ARISTOTLE

quote: Anger is a bad counselor.
author: FRENCH PROVERB

quote: Resentment is an extremely bitter diet, and eventually poisonous. I have no desire to make my own toxins.
author: NEIL KINNOCK

quote: There’s a bit of ancient wisdom that appeals to us: it’s a saying that a fight starts only with the second blow.
author: HUGH ALLEN

quote: I will permit no man to narrow and degrade my soul by making me hate him.
author: BOOKER T. WASHINGTON

quote: My life is in the hands of any fool who makes me lose my temper.
author: JOSEPH HUNTER

quote: It is only our bad temper that we put down to being tired or worried or hungry; we put our good temper down to ourselves.
author: C. S. LEWIS

quote: Temper, if ungoverned, governs the whole man.
author: ANTHONY SHAFTESBURY

quote: Temper is a quality that at a critical moment brings out the best in steel and the worst in people.
author: WILLIAM P. GROHSE

quote: Revenge has no more quenching effect on emotions than salt water has on thirst.
author: WALTER WECKLER

quote: Violence is the last refuge of the incompetent.
author: ISAAC ASIMOV

quote: A man that studieth revenge keeps his own wounds green.
author: FRANCIS BACON

quote: Getting even throws everything out of balance.
author: JOE BROWNE

quote: If a small thing has the power to make you angry, does that not indicate something about your size?
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain.
author: JAMES BALDWIN

quote: To carry a grudge is like being stung to death by one bee.
author: WILLIAM H. WALTON

quote: Nothing lowers the level of conversation more than raising the voice.
author: STANLEY HOROWITZ

quote: Not the fastest horse can catch a word spoken in anger.
author: CHINESE PROVERB

quote: Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.
author: AMBROSE BIERCE

quote: Hot words make a real cool friendship.
author: FLO ASHWORTH

quote: The best remedy for a short temper is a long walk.
author: JACQUELINE SCHIFF

quote: Gossip needn’t be false to be evil—there’s a lot of truth that shouldn’t be passed around.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: There is nothing busier than an idle rumor.
author: HERBERT V. PROCHNOW

quote: In our appetite for gossip, we tend to gobble down everything before us, only to find, too late, that it is our ideals we have consumed, and we have not been enlarged by the feasts but only diminished.
author: PICO IYER

quote: Knowledge is power, if you know it about the right person.
author: ETHEL WATTS

quote: A gossip is a person who creates the smoke in which other people assume there’s fire.
author: DAN BENNETT

quote: Gossip is that which no one claims to like—but everybody enjoys.
author: JOSEPH CONRAD

quote: Bad news goes about in clogs, good news in stockinged feet.
author: WELSH PROVERB

quote: The gossip of the future may not be a backbiting, nosy, tongue-wagging two-face but a super-megabyte, random-access, digital interface.
author: RONALD B. ZEH

quote: Some people will believe anything if it is whispered to them.
author: PIERRE DE MARIVAUX

quote: Men gossip less than women, but mean it.
author: MIGNON MCLAUGHLIN

quote: Scandal is the coin of contemporary celebrity. It keeps the public interested.
author: RICHARD CORLISS

quote: He who is caught in a lie is not believed when he tells the truth.
author: SPANISH PROVERB

quote: Gossip, unlike river water, flows both ways.
author: MICHAEL KORDA

quote: Trying to squash a rumor is like trying to unring a bell.
author: SHANA ALEXANDER

quote: A rumor without a leg to stand on will get around some other way.
author: JOHN TUDOR

quote: Just because a rumor is idle doesn’t mean it isn’t working.
author: MAURICE SEITTER

quote: To speak ill of others is a dishonest way of praising ourselves.
author: WILL DURANT

quote: When flatterers meet, the devil goes to dinner.
author: ENGLISH PROVERB

quote: Of all music, that which most pleases the ear is applause. But it has no score. It ends and is carried off by the wind. Nothing remains.
author: ENRIQUE SOLARI

quote: Flattery is counterfeit money which, but for vanity, would have no circulation.
author: FRANÇOIS DE LA ROCHEFOUCAULD

quote: Beware the flatterer: he feeds you with an empty spoon.
author: COSINO DEGREGRIO

quote: A detour is a straight road which turns on the charm.
author: ALBERT BRIE

quote: Flatterers look like friends, as wolves like dogs.
author: GEORGE CHAPMAN

quote: The punishment for vanity is flattery.
author: WILHELM RAABE

quote: We protest against unjust criticism, but we accept unearned applause.
author: JOSÉ NAROSKY

quote: I have yet to be bored by someone paying me a compliment.
author: OTTO VAN ISCH

quote: Flattery is all right—if you don’t inhale.
author: ADLAI E. STEVENSON

quote: Praise, if you don’t swallow it, can’t hurt you.
author: MORT WALKER

quote: Praise can be your most valuable asset as long as you don’t aim it at yourself.
author: O. A. BATTISTA

quote: Fish for no compliments; they are generally caught in shallow water.
author: D. SMITH

quote: Praise is warming and desirable. But it is an earned thing. It has to be deserved, like a hug from a child.
author: PHYLLIS MCGINLEY

quote: Sometimes we deny being worthy of praise, hoping to generate an argument we would be pleased to lose.
author: CULLEN HIGHTOWER

quote: He who praises everybody praises nobody.
author: SAMUEL JOHNSON

quote: While forbidden fruit is said to taste sweeter, it usually spoils faster.
author: ABIGAIL VAN BUREN

quote: A compulsion is a highbrow term for a temptation we’re not trying too hard to resist.
author: HUGH ALLEN

quote: Most people want to be delivered from temptation but would like it to keep in touch.
author: ROBERT ORBEN

quote: Those who flee temptation generally leave a forwarding address.
author: LANE OLINGHOUSE

quote: Temptation usually comes in through a door that has deliberately been left open.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Temptations, unlike opportunities, will always give you many second chances.
author: O. A. BATTISTA

quote: There is no original sin; it has all been done before.
author: LOUIS DUDEK

quote: Be cautious. Opportunity does the knocking for temptation too.
author: AL BATT

quote: Being virtuous is no feat once temptation ceases.
author: DANISH PROVERB

quote: Nothing makes it easier to resist temptation than a proper bringing-up, a sound set of values—and witnesses.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: In this era of rapid change, one thing remains constant: it’s easier to pray for forgiveness than to resist temptation.
author: SOL KENDON

quote: About the only time losing is more fun than winning is when you’re fighting temptation.
author: TOM WILSON

quote: Come good times or bad, there is always a market for things nobody needs.
author: KIN HUBBARD

quote: When there’s a lot of it around, you never want it very much.
author: PEG BRACKEN

quote: Laziness has many disguises. Soon “winter doldrums” will become “spring fever.”
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: He who is carried on another’s back does not appreciate how far off the town is.
author: AFRICAN PROVERB

quote: If you get a reputation as an early riser, you can sleep till noon.
author: IRISH PROVERB

quote: Cultivate the habit of early rising. It is unwise to keep the head long on a level with the feet.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.
author: ANNE FRANK

quote: The safest road to hell is the gradual one—the gentle slope, soft underfoot, without sudden turnings, without milestones, without signposts.
author: C. S. LEWIS

quote: Laziness is nothing more than resting before you get tired.
author: JULES RENARD

quote: A lot of what passes for depression these days is nothing more than a body saying that it needs work.
author: GEOFFREY NORMAN

quote: Beware of the man who won’t be bothered with details.
author: WILLIAM FEATHER SR.

quote: It is better to have loafed and lost than never to have loafed at all.
author: JAMES THURBER

quote: The day will happen whether or not you get up.
author: JOHN CIARDI

quote: I’m lazy. But it’s the lazy people who invented the wheel and the bicycle because they didn’t like walking or carrying things.
author: LECH WALESA

quote: About the only thing that comes to us without effort is old age.
author: GLORIA PITZER

quote: I can do only one thing at a time, but I can avoid doing many things simultaneously.
author: ASHLEIGH BRILLIANT

quote: What a fearful object a long-neglected duty gets to be!
author: CHAUNCEY WRIGHT

quote: A life of ease is a difficult pursuit.
author: WILLIAM COWPER

quote: Most of our so-called reasoning consists in finding arguments for going on believing as we already do.
author: JAMES HARVEY ROBINSON

quote: No one ever excused his way to success.
author: DAVE DEL DOTTO

quote: Excuses are the nails used to build a house of failure.
author: DON WILDER AND BILL RECHIN

quote: Whoever wants to be a judge of human nature should study people’s excuses.
author: FRIEDRICH HEBBEL

quote: Don’t tell me how hard you work. Tell me how much you get done.
author: JAMES LING

quote: To be idle requires a strong sense of personal identity.
author: ROBERT LOUIS STEVENSON

quote: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: BEVERLY SILLS

quote: The older generation thought nothing of getting up at five every morning—and the younger generation doesn’t think much of it either.
author: JOHN J. WELSH

quote: Rare is the person who can weigh the faults of others without putting his thumb on the scales.
author: BYRON J. LANGENFIELD

quote: Only God is in a position to look down on anyone.
author: SARAH BROWN

quote: The unforgiving man assumes a judgment that not even the theologians has [sic] given to God.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: I have never for one instant seen clearly within myself. How then would you have me judge the deeds of others?
author: MAURICE MAETERLINCK

quote: Moral indignation is jealousy with a halo.
author: H. G. WELLS

quote: Other people’s faults are like bees — if we don’t see them, they don’t harm us.
author: LUIS VIGIL

quote: Make no judgments where you have no compassion.
author: ANNE MCCAFFREY

quote: How much easier it is to be critical than to be correct.
author: BENJAMIN DISRAELI

quote: What we all tend to complain about most in other people are those things we don’t like about ourselves.
author: WILLIAM WHARTON

quote: I don’t like a man to be efficient. He’s likely to be not human enough.
author: FELIX FRANKFRUTER

quote: When a man points a finger at someone else, he should remember that three of his fingers are pointing at himself.
author: ANONYMOUS

quote: Ought is not a word we use to other people. It is a word we should reserve for ourselves.
author: SISTER WENDY BECKETT

quote: Perhaps no phenomenon contains so much destructive feeling as “moral indignation,” which permits envy or hate to be acted out under the guise of virtue.
author: ERICH FROMM

quote: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
author: MOTHER TERESA OF CALCUTTA

quote: Speak not against anyone whose burden you have not weighed yourself.
author: MARION BRADLEY

quote: Puritanism is the haunting fear that someone, somewhere, may be happy.
author: H. L. MENCKEN

quote: This is a do-it-yourself test for paranoia: you know you’ve got it when you can’t think of anything that’s your fault.
author: ROBERT M. HUTCHINS

quote: That which we call sin in others is experiment for us.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: We all have weaknesses. But I have figured that others have put up with mine so tolerantly that I would be less than fair not to make a reasonable discount for theirs.
author: WILLIAM ALLEN WHITE

quote: We are all inclined to judge ourselves by our ideals; others, by their acts.
author: HAROLD NICOLSON

quote: Distrust all in whom the impulse to punish is powerful.
author: FRIEDRICH NIETZSCHE

quote: Nothing so needs reforming as other people’s habits.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: Our faults irritate us most when we see them in others.
author: PENNSYLVANIA DUTCH PROVERB

quote: The enthusiastic, to those who are not, are always something of a trial.
author: ALBAN GOODIER

quote: There is little room left for wisdom when one is full of judgment.
author: MALCOLM HEIN

quote: Nothing in the world is so rare as a person one can always put up with.
author: GIACOMO LEOPARDI

quote: When nobody around you seems to measure up, it’s time to check your yardstick.
author: BILL LEMLEY

quote: There are certain small faults that offset great virtues. There are certain great faults that are forgotten in small virtues.
author: GRANTLAND RICE WATTS

quote: Accept me as I am—only then will we discover each other.
author: FEDERICO FELLINI

quote: The less secure a man is, the more likely he is to have extreme prejudices.
author: CLINT EASTWOOD

quote: Nothing dies so hard, or rallies so often, as intolerance.
author: HENRY WARD BEECHER

quote: Prejudices are the chains forged by ignorance to keep men apart.
author: COUNTESS OF BLESSINGTON

quote: Prejudice is a disease characterized by hardening of the categories.
author: WILLIAM ARTHUR

quote: A prejudice is a vagrant opinion without visible means of support.
author: AMBROSE BIERCE

quote: It is never too late to give up our prejudices.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: Every bigot was once a child free of prejudice.
author: SISTER MARY DE LOURDES

quote: Too many of our prejudices are like pyramids upside down. They rest on tiny, trivial incidents, but they spread upward and outward until they fill our minds.
author: WILLIAM MCCHESNEY MARTIN

quote: Stupidity won’t kill you, but it can make you sweat.
author: ENGLISH PROVERB

quote: Ignorance is not bliss—it is oblivion.
author: PHILIP WYLIE

quote: I am patient with stupidity but not with those who are proud of it.
author: EDITH SITWELL

quote: The greatest obstacle to discovering the shape of the earth, the continents and the ocean was not ignorance but the illusion of knowledge.
author: DANIEL J. BOORSTIN

quote: Ignorance is bold, and knowledge reserved.
author: THUCYDIDES

quote: The trouble with most folks isn’t so much their ignorance, as knowing so many things that ain’t so.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: Sometimes the best way to convince someone he is wrong is to let him have his way.
author: RED O’DONNELL

quote: Everybody is ignorant, only on different subjects.
author: WILL ROGERS

quote: Nothing will divide this nation more than ignorance, and nothing can bring us together better than an educated population.
author: JOHN SCULLEY

quote: Preconceived notions are the locks on the door to wisdom.
author: MERRY BROWNE

quote: Fears are educated into us and can, if we wish, be educated out.
author: KARL A. MENNINGER, MD

quote: The intelligent man who is proud of his intelligence is like the condemned man who is proud of his large cell.
author: SIMONE WEIL

quote: It is never wise to seek or wish for another’s misfortune. If malice or envy were tangible and had a shape, it would be the shape of a boomerang.
author: CHARLEY REESE

quote: Spite is never lonely; envy always tags along.
author: MIGNON MCLAUGHLIN

quote: Envy is the art of counting the other fellow’s blessings instead of your own.
author: HAROLD COFFIN

quote: Do not believe those persons who say they have never been jealous. What they mean is that they have never been in love.
author: GERALD BRENAN

quote: Love looks through a telescope; envy, through a microscope.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: Jealousy is all the fun you think they had.
author: ERICA JONG

quote: I’d never try to learn from someone I didn’t envy at least a little. If I never envied, I’d never learn.
author: BETSY COHEN

quote: The chains of habit are generally too small to be felt until they are too strong to be broken.
author: SAMUEL JOHNSON

quote: Good habits are as easy to form as bad ones.
author: TIM MCCARVER

quote: Habits are first cobwebs, then cables.
author: SPANISH PROVERB

quote: Comfort comes as a guest, lingers to become a host and stays to enslave us.
author: LEE S. BICKMORE

quote: Habit is habit, and not to be flung out of the window by any man, but coaxed downstairs a step at a time.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: A habit is a shirt made of iron.
author: HAROLD HELFER

quote: Habits are like supervisors that you don’t notice.
author: HANNES MESSEMER

quote: We can often endure an extra pound of pain far more easily than we can suffer the withdrawal of an ounce of accustomed pleasure.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity.
author: ST. AUGUSTINE

quote: It is easy to assume a habit; but when you try to cast it off, it will take skin and all.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: A habit is something you can do without thinking—which is why most of us have so many of them.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: The best way to break a habit is to drop it.
author: LEO AIKMAN

quote: A bad habit never disappears miraculously; it’s an undo-it-yourself project.
author: ABIGAIL VAN BUREN

quote: Never be haughty to the humble. Never be humble to the haughty.
author: JEFFERSON DAVIS

quote: None are so empty as those who are full of themselves.
author: BENJAMIN WHICHCOTE

quote: The louder he talked of his honor, the faster we counted our spoons.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: He who truly knows has no occasion to shout.
author: LEONARDO DA VINCI

quote: The question we do not see when we are young is whether we own pride or are owned by it.
author: JOSEPHINE JOHNSON

quote: If you are all wrapped up in yourself, you are overdressed.
author: The Wedded Unmother

quote: A man wrapped up in himself makes a very small parcel.
author: BBC Radio

quote: When someone sings his own praises, he always gets the tune too high.
author: MARY H. WALDRIP

quote: Vanity is the result of a delusion that someone is paying attention.
author: PAUL E. SWEENEY

quote: Oh, for a pin that would puncture pretension!
author: ISAAC ASIMOV

quote: Men often mistake notoriety for fame, and would rather be remarked for their vices and follies than not be noticed at all.
author: HARRY S. TRUMAN

quote: It is far more impressive when others discover your good qualities without your help.
author: JUDITH S. MARTIN

quote: A modest man is usually admired—if people ever hear of him.
author: ED HOWE

quote: Lord, where we are wrong, make us willing to change; where we are right, make us easy to live with.
author: REV. PETER MARSHALL

quote: The nice thing about egotists is that they don’t talk about other people.
author: LUCILLE S. HARPER

quote: The egotist always hurts the one he loves—himself.
author: BERNICE PEERS

quote: The only cure for vanity is laughter. And the only fault that’s laughable is vanity.
author: HENRI BERGSON

quote: Pride makes some men ridiculous but prevents others from becoming so.
author: CHARLES CALEB COLTON

quote: Too great a sense of identity makes a man feel he can do no wrong. And too little does the same.
author: DJUNA BARNES

quote: The very essence of leadership is that you have to have a vision. You can’t blow an uncertain trumpet.
author: THEODORE HESBURGH

quote: High sentiments always win in the end. The leaders who offer blood, toil, tears and sweat always get more out of their followers than those who offer safety and a good time. When it comes to the pinch, human beings are heroic.
author: GEORGE ORWELL

quote: Consensus is the negation of leadership.
author: MARGARET THATCHER

quote: You do not lead by hitting people over the head. That’s assault, not leadership.
author: DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER

quote: Lots of folks confuse bad management with destiny.
author: KIN HUBBARD

quote: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
author: GEN. GEORGE S. PATTON JR.

quote: Rules are made for people who aren’t willing to make up their own.
author: CHUCK YEAGER AND CHARLES LEERHSEN

quote: A leader knows what’s best to do; a manager knows merely how best to do it.
author: KEN ADELMAN

quote: Leadership is a potent combination of strategy and character. But if you must be without one, be without the strategy.
author: GEN. H. NORMAN SCHWARZKOPF

quote: A leader who keeps his ear to the ground allows his rear end to become a target.
author: ANGIE PAPADAKIS

quote: One measure of leadership is the caliber of people who choose to follow you.
author: DENNIS A. PEER

quote: The person who knows how will always have a job. But the person who knows why will be his boss.
author: CARL C. WOOD

quote: Anyone can hold the helm when the sea is calm.
author: PUBLILIUS SYRUS

quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Knowledge cannot make us all leaders, but it can help us decide which leader to follow.
author: Management Digest

quote: Wise are those who learn that the bottom line doesn’t always have to be their top priority.
author: WILLIAM ARTHUR WARD

quote: The mark of a true professional is giving more than you get.
author: ROBERT KIRBY

quote: Rank does not confer privilege or give power. It imposes responsibility.
author: PETER DRUCKER

quote: A man who enjoys responsibility usually gets it. A man who merely likes exercising authority usually loses it.
author: MALCOLM S. FORBES

quote: Few things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: He that would be a leader must be a bridge.
author: WELSH PROVERB

quote: Life is like a dog-sled team. If you ain’t the lead dog, the scenery never changes.
author: LEWIS GRIZZARD

quote: The speed of the leader determines the rate of the pack.
author: WAYNE LUKAS

quote: If you want truly to understand something, try to change it.
author: KURT LEWIN

quote: We still think of a powerful man as a born leader and a powerful woman as an anomaly.
author: MARGARET ATWOOD

quote: Asking “Who ought to be boss?” is like asking “Who ought to be the tenor in the quartet?” Obviously, the man who can sing tenor.
author: HENRY FORD

quote: A great leader is the one who can show people that their self-interest is different from that which they perceived.
author: BARNEY FRANK

quote: No person can be a great leader unless he takes genuine joy in the successes of those under him.
author: W. A. NANCE

quote: First-rate men hire first-rate men; second-rate men hire third-rate men.
author: LEO ROSTEN

quote: It’s easy to make a buck. It’s a lot tougher to make a difference.
author: TOM BROKAW

quote: The things we fear most in organizations—fluctuations, disturbances, imbalances—are the primary sources of creativity.
author: MARGARET J. WHEATLEY

quote: Change starts when someone sees the next step.
author: WILLIAM DRAYTON

quote: I am more afraid of an army of 100 sheep led by a lion than an army of 100 lions led by a sheep.
author: TALLEYRAND

quote: It’s better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
author: SISTER KENNY

quote: What great thing would you attempt if you knew you could not fail?
author: ROBERT H. SCHULLER

quote: Why not upset the apple cart? If you don’t, the apples will rot anyway.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: Determine that the thing can and shall be done, and then we shall find the way.
author: ABRAHAM LINCOLN

quote: When a man’s willing and eager, the gods join in.
author: AESCHYLUS

quote: Trust in God and do something.
author: MARY LYON

quote: Action may not always be happiness, but there is no happiness without action.
author: BENJAMIN DISRAELI

quote: There is a close correlation between getting up in the morning and getting up in the world.
author: RON DENTINGER

quote: Noble deeds and hot baths are the best cures for depression.
author: DODIE SMITH

quote: My view is that to sit back and let fate play its hand out and never influence it is not the way man was meant to operate.
author: JOHN GLENN

quote: People judge you by your actions, not your intentions. You may have a heart of gold, but so has a hard-boiled egg.
author: Good Reading

quote: Let him that would move the world, first move himself.
author: SOCRATES

quote: All glory comes from daring to begin.
author: EUGENE F. WARE

quote: Everything comes to he who hustles while he waits.
author: THOMAS A. EDISON

quote: Well done is better than well said.
author: BENJAMIN FRANKLIN

quote: You can’t build a reputation on what you are going to do.
author: HENRY FORD

quote: In life, as in a football game, the principle to follow is: hit the line hard.
author: THEODORE ROOSEVELT

quote: If you never budge, don’t expect a push.
author: MALCOLM S. FORBES

quote: You must get involved to have an impact. No one is impressed with the won-lost record of the referee.
author: JOHN H. HOLCOMB

quote: Swing hard, in case they throw the ball where you’re swinging.
author: DUKE SNIDER

quote: Life is a great big canvas, and you should throw all the paint on it you can.
author: DANNY KAYE

quote: Success is a ladder that cannot be climbed with your hands in your pockets.
author: AMERICAN PROVERB

quote: Few wishes come true by themselves.
author: JUNE SMITH

quote: Dig the well before you are thirsty.
author: CHINESE PROVERB

quote: Have you considered that if you “don’t make waves,” nobody, including yourself, will know that you are alive?
author: THEODORE ISAAC RUBIN, MD

quote: Many a man with no family tree has succeeded because he branched out for himself.
author: LEO AIKMAN

quote: God gives every bird his worm, but he does not throw it into the nest.
author: SWEDISH PROVERB

quote: Ask God’s blessing on your work, but don’t ask him to do it for you.
author: DAME FLORA ROBSON

quote: It is easy to sit up and take notice. What is difficult is getting up and taking action.
author: AL BATT

quote: Not everything that is faced can be changed. But nothing can be changed until it is faced.
author: JAMES BALDWIN

quote: Our dilemma is that we hate change and love it at the same time; what we really want is for things to remain the same but get better.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Just as iron rusts from disuse, even so does inaction spoil the intellect.
author: LEONARDO DA VINCI

quote: Men may doubt what you say, but they will believe what you do.
author: LEWIS CASS

quote: If your ship doesn’t come in, swim out to it!
author: JONATHAN WINTERS

quote: Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit, and you reap a character. Sow a character, and you reap a destiny.
author: CHARLES READE

quote: Be bold in what you stand for and careful what you fall for.
author: RUTH BOORSTIN

quote: Don’t believe that winning is really everything. It’s more important to stand for something. If you don’t stand for something, what do you win?
author: LANE KIRKLAND

quote: Never give in—in nothing, great or small, large or petty—except to convictions of honor and good sense.
author: WINSTON CHURCHILL

quote: The quality of a man’s life is in direct proportion to his commitment to excellence, regardless of his chosen field of endeavor.
author: VINCE LOMBARDI

quote: A good resolution is like an old horse which is often saddled but rarely ridden.
author: MEXICAN PROVERB

quote: Compromise makes a good umbrella, but a poor roof.
author: JAMES RUSSELL LOWELL

quote: A thing moderately good is not so good as it ought to be. Moderation in temper is always a virtue; but moderation in principle is always a vice.
author: THOMAS PAINE

quote: He that always gives way to others will end in having no principles of his own.
author: AESOP

quote: Middleness is the very enemy of the bold.
author: CHARLES KRAUTHAMMER

quote: You’ve got to stand for somethin’ or you’re gonna fall for anything.
author: JOHN COUGAR MELLENCAMP

quote: Learn to say no. It will be of more use to you than to be able to read Latin.
author: CHARLES HADDON SPURGEON

quote: One-half the troubles of this life can be traced to saying yes too quickly and not saying no soon enough.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: It’s important that people should know what you stand for. It’s equally important that they know what you won’t stand for.
author: MARY H. WALDRIP

quote: Standing in the middle of the road is very dangerous; you get knocked down by the traffic from both sides.
author: MARGARET THATCHER

quote: The main discomfort in being a middle-of-the-roader is that you get sideswiped by partisans going in both directions.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: The most prominent place in hell is reserved for those who are neutral on the great issues of life.
author: REV. BILLY GRAHAM

quote: Never “for the sake of peace and quiet” deny your own experience or convictions.
author: DAG HAMMARSKJOLD

quote: When something important is going on, silence is a lie.
author: A. M. ROSENTHAL

quote: Please all and you please none.
author: AESOP

quote: He who turns the other cheek too far gets it in the neck.
author: H. HERT

quote: You can lean over backward so far that you fall flat on your face.
author: BEN H. BAGDIKIAN

quote: In the end it will not matter to us whether we fought with flails or reeds. It will matter to us greatly on what side we fought.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: A man’s judgment is best when he can forget himself and any reputation he may have acquired and can concentrate wholly on making the right decisions.
author: ADM. RAYMOND A. SPRUANCE

quote: Opportunities are never lost. The other fellow takes those you miss.
author: ANONYMOUS

quote: Not many sounds in life, and I include all urban and all rural sounds, exceed in interest a knock at the door.
author: CHARLES LAMB

quote: The world is before you, and you need not take it or leave it as it was when you came in.
author: JAMES BALDWIN

quote: Opportunity is often difficult to recognize; we usually expect it to beckon us with beepers and billboards.
author: WILLIAM ARTHUR WARD

quote: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
author: MILTON BERLE

quote: It is often hard to distinguish between the hard knocks in life and those of opportunity.
author: FREDERICK PHILLIPS

quote: Life is always walking up to us and saying, “Come on in, the living’s fine,” and what do we do? Back off and take its picture.
author: RUSSELL BAKER

quote: Opportunity is sometimes hard to recognize if you’re only looking for a lucky break.
author: MONTA CRANE

quote: Opportunity’s favorite disguise is trouble.
author: FRANK TYGER

quote: Opportunities are often things you haven’t noticed the first time around.
author: CATHERINE DENEUVE

quote: Wherever we look upon this earth, the opportunities take shape within the problems.
author: NELSON A. ROCKEFELLER

quote: If a window of opportunity appears, don’t pull down the shade.
author: TOM PETERS

quote: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
author: DUKE ELLINGTON

quote: Jumping at several small opportunities may get us there more quickly than waiting for one big one to come along.
author: HUGH ALLEN

quote: Problems are only opportunities with thorns on them.
author: HUGH MILLER

quote: Opportunity is a bird that never perches.
author: CLAUDE MCDONALD

quote: One of the secrets of life is to make stepping stones out of stumbling blocks.
author: JACK PENN

quote: Today’s opportunities erase yesterday’s failures.
author: GENE BROWN

quote: I make the most of all that comes and the least of all that goes.
author: SARA TEASDALE

quote: Why not go out on a limb? Isn’t that where the fruit is?
author: FRANK SCULLY

quote: All growth, including political growth, is the result of risk-taking.
author: JUDE WANNISKI

quote: What isn’t tried won’t work.
author: CLAUDE MCDONALD

quote: What is more mortifying than to feel that you have missed the plum for want of courage to shake the tree?
author: LOGAN PEARSALL SMITH

quote: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
author: SENECA

quote: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?
author: VINCENT VAN GOGH

quote: A coward meets his fate in his own hideout.
author: JORGE SALVADOR LARA

quote: All serious daring starts from within.
author: EUDORA WELTY

quote: If you risk nothing, then you risk everything.
author: GEENA DAVIS

quote: Worry is like a rocking chair. It will give you something to do, but it won’t get you anywhere.
author: The United Church Observer

quote: Progress always involves risks. You can’t steal second base and keep your foot on first.
author: FREDERICK B. WILCOX

quote: Yes, risk-taking is inherently failure-prone. Otherwise, it would be called sure-thing-taking.
author: TIM MCMAHON

quote: Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes furthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare.
author: Dale Carnegie’s Scrapbook

quote: People wish to learn to swim and at the same time to keep one foot on the ground.
author: MARCEL PROUST

quote: High expectations are the key to everything.
author: SAM WALTON

quote: If you’re never scared or embarrassed or hurt, it means you never take any chances.
author: JULIA SOREL

quote: When you’re skating on thin ice, you may as well tap-dance.
author: BRYCE COURTENAY

quote: It’s better to plunge into the unknown than to try to make sure of everything.
author: GERALD LESCARBEAULT

quote: Take calculated risks. That is quite different from being rash.
author: GEN. GEORGE S. PATTON JR.

quote: We cannot become what we need to be by remaining what we are.
author: MAX DE PREE

quote: When you reach for the stars, you may not quite get one, but you won’t come up with a handful of mud either.
author: LEO BURNETT

quote: In skating over thin ice, our safety is in our speed.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: You are permitted in time of great danger to walk with the devil until you have crossed the bridge.
author: BULGARIAN PROVERB

quote: If you don’t place your foot on the rope, you’ll never cross the chasm.
author: LIZ SMITH

quote: Necessity is the mother of taking chances.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: If necessity is the mother of invention, discontent is the father of progress.
author: DAVID ROCKEFELLER

quote: Sometimes the fool who rushes in gets the job done.
author: AL BERNSTEIN

quote: A man sits as many risks as he runs.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: A ship in harbor is safe—but that is not what ships are for.
author: JOHN A. SHEDD

quote: A road twice traveled is never as long.
author: ROSALIE GRAHAM

quote: The meaning of life cannot be told; it has to happen to a person.
author: IRA PROGOFF

quote: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
author: EDWARD GIBBON

quote: The person who has had a bull by the tail once has learned 60 or 70 times as much as a person who hasn’t.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: The work will teach you how to do it.
author: ESTONIAN PROVERB

quote: Sometimes you earn more doing the jobs that pay nothing.
author: TODD RUTHMAN

quote: When you fall in a river, you’re no longer a fisherman; you’re a swimmer.
author: GENE HILL

quote: Believe one who has tried it.
author: VIRGIL

quote: Information’s pretty thin stuff unless mixed with experience.
author: CLARENCE DAY

quote: Only the wearer knows where the shoe pinches.
author: PROVERB

quote: A man begins cutting his wisdom teeth the first time he bites off more than he can chew.
author: HERB CAEN

quote: The value of experience is not in seeing much, but in seeing wisely.
author: SIR WILLIAM OSLER

quote: One thing about experience is that when you don’t have very much you’re apt to get a lot.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: Experience is a wonderful thing; it enables you to recognize a mistake every time you repeat it.
author: The Associated Press

quote: We learn to walk by stumbling.
author: BULGARIAN PROVERB

quote: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: People learn something every day, and a lot of times it’s that what they learned the day before was wrong.
author: BILL VAUGHAN

quote: Just when you think you’ve graduated from the school of experience, someone thinks up a new course.
author: MARY H. WALDRIP

quote: Experience is what you get when you don’t get what you want.
author: DAN STANFORD

quote: Anybody who profits from the experience of others probably writes biographies.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: If we could sell our experiences for what they cost us, we’d all be millionaires.
author: ABIGAIL VAN BUREN

quote: Half, maybe more, of the delight of experiencing is to know what you are experiencing.
author: JESSAMYN WEST

quote: Perhaps the angels who fear to tread where fools rush in used to be fools who rushed in.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: He who hesitates is last.
author: Mae West

quote: He who hesitates is sometimes saved.
author: JAMES THURBER

quote: These things are good in little measure and evil in large: yeast, salt and hesitation.
author: The Talmud

quote: The man who insists upon seeing with perfect clearness before he decides, never decides.
author: HENRI FRÉDÉRIC AMIEL

quote: A man would do nothing if he waited until he could do it so well that no one could find fault.
author: JOHN HENRY CARDINAL NEWMAN

quote: It’s better to be boldly decisive and risk being wrong than to agonize at length and be right too late.
author: MARILYN MOATS KENNEDY

quote: If all difficulties were known at the outset of a long journey, most of us would never start out at all.
author: DAN RATHER WITH PETER WYDEN
