quote: Decision is a sharp knife that cuts clean and straight. Indecision is a dull one that hacks and tears and leaves ragged edges behind.
author: JAN MCKEITHEN

quote: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.
author: ALFRED ADLER

quote: You have to be careful about being too careful.
author: BERYL PFIZER

quote: If you wait, all that happens is that you get older.
author: LARRY MCMURTRY

quote: If you take too long in deciding what to do with your life, you’ll find you’ve done it.
author: PAM SHAW

quote: To think too long about doing a thing often becomes its undoing.
author: EVA YOUNG

quote: When you have to make a choice and don’t make it, that is in itself a choice.
author: WILLIAM JAMES

quote: Half the failures in life arise from pulling in one’s horse as he is leaping.
author: JULIUS CHARLES HARE AND AUGUSTUS WILLIAM HARE

quote: Give me the benefit of your convictions, if you have any; but keep your doubts to yourself, for I have enough of my own.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: Throughout history, the most common debilitating human ailment has been cold feet.
author: Country

quote: Calculation never made a hero.
author: JOHN HENRY CARDINAL NEWMAN

quote: He who hesitates is interrupted.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: If you can’t make a mistake, you can’t make anything.
author: MARVA N. COLLINS

quote: Never let the fear of striking out get in your way.
author: BABE RUTH

quote: The greatest mistake you can make in life is continually to be fearing you will make one.
author: ELBERT HUBBARD

quote: A stumble may prevent a fall.
author: ENGLISH PROVERB

quote: He who never made a mistake never made a discovery.
author: SAMUEL SMILES

quote: A mistake proves that someone stopped talking long enough to do something.
author: PHOENIX FLAME

quote: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
author: PHYLLIS THEROUX

quote: Better to ask twice than to lose your way once.
author: DANISH PROVERB

quote: We’re all proud of making little mistakes. It gives us the feeling we don’t make any big ones.
author: ANDREW A. ROONEY

quote: To err is human; to admit it, superhuman.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Admit your errors before someone else exaggerates them.
author: ANDREW V. MASON, MD

quote: There is no saint without a past—no sinner without a future.
author: ANCIENT PERSIAN MASS

quote: Once we realize that imperfect understanding is the human condition, there is no shame in being wrong, only in failing to correct our mistakes.
author: GEORGE SOROS

quote: One of the most dangerous forms of human error is forgetting what one is trying to achieve.
author: PAUL NITZE

quote: It is very easy to forgive others their mistakes; it takes more grit and gumption to forgive them for having witnessed your own.
author: JESSAMYN WEST

quote: The worst part is not in making a mistake but in trying to justify it, instead of using it as a heaven-sent warning of our mindlessness or our ignorance.
author: SANTIAGO RAMÓN Y CAJAL

quote: Always acknowledge a fault frankly. This will throw those in authority off their guard and give you opportunity to commit more.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: To obtain maximum attention, it’s hard to beat a good, big mistake.
author: DAVID D. HEWITT

quote: Justifying a fault doubles it.
author: FRENCH PROVERB

quote: Your worst humiliation is only someone else’s momentary entertainment.
author: KAREN CROCKETT

quote: He who is afraid to ask is ashamed of learning.
author: DANISH PROVERB

quote: The only nice thing about being imperfect is the joy it brings to others.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Nine times out of ten, the first thing a man’s companion knows of his shortcomings is from his apology.
author: OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES SR.

quote: If all else fails, immortality can always be assured by spectacular error.
author: JOHN KENNETH GALBRAITH

quote: I’d rather be a failure at something I enjoy than be a success at something I hate.
author: GEORGE BURNS

quote: You never conquer a mountain. You stand on the summit a few moments; then the wind blows your footprints away.
author: ARLENE BLUM

quote: Victory is in the quality of competition, not the final score.
author: MIKE MARSHALL

quote: Laurels don’t make much of a cushion.
author: DOROTHY RABINOWITZ

quote: Success covers a multitude of blunders.
author: BERNARD SHAW

quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
author: TRUMAN CAPOTE

quote: Success and failure. We think of them as opposites, but they’re really not. They’re companions—the hero and the sidekick.
author: LAURENCE SHAMES

quote: Don’t confuse fame with success. Madonna is one; Helen Keller is the other.
author: ERMA BOMBECK

quote: The hero reveals the possibilities of human nature; the celebrity reveals the possibilities of the media.
author: DANIEL J. BOORSTIN

quote: Oh, the difference between nearly right and exactly right.
author: HORACE J. BROWN

quote: Success is never final, but failure can be.
author: BILL PARCELLS

quote: I couldn’t wait for success . . . so I went ahead without it.
author: JONATHAN WINTERS

quote: There is no comparison between that which is lost by not succeeding and that which is lost by not trying.
author: FRANCIS BACON

quote: You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don’t try.
author: BEVERLY SILLS

quote: Use what talents you possess: the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
author: HENRY VAN DYKE

quote: Ability is what you’re capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
author: LOU HOLTZ

quote: True success is overcoming the fear of being unsuccessful.
author: PAUL SWEENEY

quote: If at first you do succeed—try to hide your astonishment.
author: Los Angeles Times Syndicate

quote: If you’re not failing now and again, it’s a sign you’re playing it safe.
author: WOODY ALLEN

quote: You’re never as good as everyone tells you when you win, and you’re never as bad as they say when you lose.
author: LOU HOLTZ WITH JOHN HEISLER

quote: It takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeeded.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: It isn’t failing that spells one’s downfall; it’s running away, giving up.
author: MICHEL GRECO

quote: If at first you don’t succeed, try, try again. Then give up. There’s no use in being a damn fool about it.
author: W. C. FIELDS

quote: Being defeated is often a temporary condition. Giving up is what makes it permanent.
author: MARILYN VOS SAVANT

quote: On this earth, in the final analysis, each of us gets exactly what he deserves. But only the successful recognize this.
author: GEORGES SIMENON

quote: If at first you don’t succeed, you are running about average.
author: M. H. ALDERSON

quote: Success is not forever, and failure’s not fatal.
author: DON SHULA WITH KEN BLANCHARD

quote: Failure is an event, never a person.
author: WILLIAM D. BROWN

quote: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
author: JOHN WOODEN

quote: Defeat may serve as well as victory to shake the soul and let the glory out.
author: EDWIN MARKHAM

quote: The reward for work well done is the opportunity to do more.
author: JONAS SALK, MD

quote: The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Work is something you can count on, a trusted, lifelong friend who never deserts you.
author: MARGARET BOURKE-WHITE

quote: The biggest mistake you can make is to believe that you are working for someone else.
author: Bits & Pieces

quote: The work praises the man.
author: IRISH PROVERB

quote: One of the greatest sources of energy is pride in what you are doing.
author: Spokes

quote: Do the best you can in every task, no matter how unimportant it may seem at the time. No one learns more about a problem than the person at the bottom.
author: SANDRA DAY O’CONNOR

quote: Manual labor to my father was not only good and decent for its own sake but, as he was given to saying, it straightened out one’s thoughts.
author: MARY ELLEN CHASE

quote: There’s no labor a man can do that’s undignified—if he does it right.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Happiness, I have discovered, is nearly always a rebound from hard work.
author: DAVID GRAYSON

quote: There are no menial jobs, only menial attitudes.
author: WILLIAM J. BENNETT

quote: Just as there are no little people or unimportant lives, there is no insignificant work.
author: Elena Bonner

quote: There is a kind of victory in good work, no matter how humble.
author: JACK KEMP

quote: Thinking is the hardest work there is, which is probably the reason so few engage in it.
author: HENRY FORD

quote: Accomplishments have no color.
author: LEONTYNE PRICE

quote: The best preparation for work is not thinking about work, talking about work, or studying for work: it is work.
author: WILLIAM WELD

quote: Look at a day when you are supremely satisfied at the end. It’s not a day when you lounge around doing nothing. It’s when you’ve had everything to do, and you’ve done it.
author: MARGARET THATCHER

quote: The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.
author: RICHARD BACH

quote: Nothing is work unless you’d rather be doing something else.
author: GEORGE HALAS

quote: My father always told me, “Find a job you love and you’ll never have to work a day in your life.”
author: JIM FOX

quote: When we do the best that we can, we never know what miracle is wrought in our life or in the life of another.
author: HELEN KELLER

quote: Ability will never catch up with the demand for it.
author: MALCOLM S. FORBES

quote: What you have inherited from your fathers, earn over again for yourselves, or it will not be yours.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: Not only is woman’s work never done, the definition keeps changing.
author: BILL COPELAND

quote: We work to become, not to acquire.
author: ELBERT HUBBARD

quote: Blessed is the person who is too busy to worry in the daytime and too sleepy to worry at night.
author: LEO AIKMAN

quote: Perfection is finally attained, not when there is no longer anything to add, but when there is no longer anything to take away.
author: ANTOINE DE SAINT-EXUPÉRY

quote: If you have a job without any aggravations, you don’t have a job.
author: MALCOLM S. FORBES

quote: Work keeps us from three evils: boredom, vice and need.
author: VOLTAIRE

quote: It’s strange how unimportant your job is when you’re asking for a raise, but how important it can be when you want to take a day off.
author: EARL A. MATHES

quote: I don’t know what liberation can do about it, but even when the man helps, woman’s work is never done.
author: BERYL PFIZER

quote: The man who didn’t want his wife to work has been succeeded by the man who asks about her chances of getting a raise.
author: EARL WILSON

quote: There is no such thing as a nonworking mother.
author: HESTER MUNDIS

quote: Work consists of whatever a body is obliged to do, and play consists of whatever a body is not obliged to do.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: Retirement, we understand, is great if you are busy, rich and healthy. But then, under those conditions, work is great too.
author: BILL VAUGHAN

quote: Retirement should be based on the tread, not the mileage.
author: ALLEN LUDDEN

quote: I don’t want to achieve immortality through my work. I want to achieve immortality through not dying.
author: WOODY ALLEN

quote: It proves, on close examination, that work is less boring than amusing oneself.
author: CHARLES BAUDELAIRE

quote: Everywhere is walking distance if you have the time.
author: STEVEN WRIGHT

quote: The perfect journey is circular—the joy of departure and the joy of return.
author: DINO BASILI

quote: What is traveling? Changing your place? By no means! Traveling is changing your opinions and your prejudices.
author: ANATOLE FRANCE

quote: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: ST. AUGUSTINE

quote: There ain’t no surer way to find out whether you like people or hate them than to travel with them.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: The rule for traveling abroad is to take our common sense with us, and leave our prejudices behind.
author: WILLIAM HAZLITT

quote: A good traveler is one who does not know where he is going. A perfect traveler does not know where he came from.
author: LIN YUTANG

quote: Be careful going in search of adventure—it’s ridiculously easy to find.
author: WILLIAM LEAST HEAT MOON

quote: Most travel is best of all in the anticipation or the remembering; the reality has more to do with losing your luggage.
author: REGINA NADELSON

quote: Thanks to the Interstate Highway System, it is now possible to travel across the country from coast to coast without seeing anything.
author: CHARLES KURALT

quote: The average tourist wants to go to places where there are no tourists.
author: SAM EWING

quote: Men travel faster now, but I do not know if they go to better things.
author: WILLA CATHER

quote: Each year it seems to take less time to fly across the ocean and longer to drive to work.
author: The Globe and Mail (Totonto, Ontario)

quote: For travel to be delightful, one must have a good place to leave and return to.
author: FREDERICK B. WILCOX

quote: Traveling is like falling in love; the world is made new.
author: JAN MYRDAL

quote: Words can sometimes, in moments of grace, attain the quality of deeds.
author: ELIE WIESEL

quote: It’s a strange world of language in which skating on thin ice can get you into hot water.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: If the English language made any sense, lackadaisical would have something to do with a shortage of flowers.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Words are vehicles that can transport us from the drab sands to the dazzling stars.
author: M. ROBERT SYME

quote: Words are like diamonds. Polish them too much, and all you get are pebbles.
author: BRYCE COURTENAY

quote: All words are pegs to hang ideas on.
author: HENRY WARD BEECHER

quote: Words without ideas are like sails without wind.
author: Courier-Record (Blackstone, Virginia)

quote: A cliché is only something well said in the first place.
author: BILL GRANGER

quote: To “coin a phrase” is to place some value upon it.
author: E. H. EVENSON

quote: A different language is a different vision of life.
author: FEDERICO FELLINI

quote: Learn a new language and get a new soul.
author: CZECH PROVERB

quote: He who does not know foreign languages does not know anything about his own.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: It is often wonderful how putting down on paper a clear statement of a case helps one to see, not perhaps the way out, but the way in.
author: A. C. BENSON

quote: In certain trying circumstances, urgent circumstances, desperate circumstances, profanity furnishes a relief denied even to prayer.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: Words, like eyeglasses, blur everything that they do not make more clear.
author: JOSEPH JOUBERT

quote: The two words “information” and “communication” are often used interchangeably, but they signify quite different things. Information is giving out; communication is getting through.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: Mincing your words makes it easier if you have to eat them later.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: Man does not live by words alone, despite the fact that sometimes he has to eat them.
author: ADLAI STEVENSON

quote: When a man eats his words, that’s recyling.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: By inflection you can say much more than your words do.
author: MALCOLM S. FORBES

quote: Brevity may be the soul of wit, but not when someone’s saying, “I love you.”
author: JUDITH VIORST

quote: Words of comfort, skillfully administered, are the oldest therapy known to man.
author: LOUIS NIZER

quote: Be careful of your thoughts; they may become words at any moment.
author: IARA GASSEN

quote: Words, once they’re printed, have a life of their own.
author: CAROL BURNETT

quote: Everything becomes a little different as soon as it is spoken out loud.
author: HERMANN HESSE

quote: If you wouldn’t write it and sign it, don’t say it.
author: EARL WILSON

quote: Among my most prized possessions are words that I have never spoken.
author: ORSON REGA CARD

quote: Words are as beautiful as wild horses, and sometimes as difficult to corral.
author: TED BERKMAN

quote: Look out how you use proud words. When you let proud words go, it is not easy to call them back.
author: CARL SANDBURG

quote: North Americans communicate through buttons, T-shirts and bumper stickers the way some cultures use drums.
author: TIM MCCARTHY

quote: A spoken word is not a sparrow. Once it flies out, you cannot catch it.
author: RUSSIAN PROVERB

quote: If you would be pungent, be brief; for it is with words as with sunbeams. The more they are condensed, the deeper they burn.
author: ROBERT SOUTHEY

quote: You can suffocate a thought by expressing it with too many words.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: If it takes a lot of words to say what you have in mind, give it more thought.
author: DENNIS ROTH

quote: Say what you have to say, not what you ought.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: Why doesn’t the fellow who says “I’m no speechmaker” let it go at that instead of giving a demonstration?
author: KIN HUBBARD

quote: The reason we make a long story short is so that we can tell another.
author: SHARON SHOEMAKER

quote: The most valuable of all talents is that of never using two words when one will do.
author: THOMAS JEFFERSON

quote: It’s all right to hold a conversation, but you should let go of it now and then.
author: RICHARD ARMOUR

quote: To base thought only on speech is to try nailing whispers to the wall. Writing freezes thought and offers it up for inspection.
author: JACK ROSENTHAL

quote: When the mouth stumbles, it is worse than the foot.
author: WEST AFRICAN PROVERB

quote: One way to prevent conversation from being boring is to say the wrong thing.
author: FRANK SHEED

quote: The first requirement of good conversation is that nobody should know what is coming next.
author: HAVILAH BABCOCK

quote: Conversation means being able to disagree and still continue the discussion.
author: DWIGHT MACDONALD

quote: Candor is a compliment; it implies equality. It’s how true friends talk.
author: Peggy Noonan

quote: The genius of communication is the ability to be both totally honest and totally kind at the same time.
author: JOHN POWELL

quote: Fine words butter no parsnips.
author: ENGLISH PROVERB

quote: To speak of “mere words” is much like speaking of “mere dynamite.”
author: C. J. DUCASSE

quote: Words must surely be counted among the most powerful drugs man ever invented.
author: LEO ROSTEN

quote: Sticks and stones may break our bones, but words will break our hearts.
author: ROBERT FULGHUM

quote: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
author: HARRIET BEECHER STOWE

quote: Do not the most moving moments of our lives find us all without words?
author: MARCEL MARCEAU

quote: In prayer it is better to have a heart without words than words without a heart.
author: JOHN BUNYAN

quote: Sometimes good intentions and feelings are of greater moment than the awkwardness of their expression.
author: JONATHAN YARDLEY

quote: Too much agreement kills a chat.
author: ELDRIDGE CLEAVER

quote: To touch a child’s face, a dog’s smooth coat, a petaled flower, the rough surface of a rock is to set up new orders of brain motion. To touch is to communicate.
author: JAMES W. ANGELL

quote: What a wonderful thing is the mail, capable of conveying across continents a warm human handclasp.
author: Ranjan Bakshi

quote: A letter is a soliloquy, but a letter with a postscript is a conversation.
author: LIN YUTANG

quote: There is nothing like sealing a letter to inspire a fresh thought.
author: AL BERNSTEIN

quote: It is a damned poor mind indeed that can’t think of at least two ways of spelling any word.
author: ANDREW JACKSON

quote: Parents can plant magic in a child’s mind through certain words spoken with some thrilling quality of voice, some uplift of the heart and spirit.
author: ROBERT MACNEIL

quote: A pun is a pistol let off at the ear; not a feather to tickle the intellect.
author: CHARLES LAMB

quote: Skillful listening is the best remedy for loneliness, loquaciousness and laryngitis.
author: WILLIAM ARTHUR WARD

quote: The greatest gift you can give another is the purity of your attention.
author: RICHARD MOSS, MD

quote: Listening, not imitation, may be the sincerest form of flattery.
author: JOYCE BROTHERS

quote: There is no greater loan than a sympathetic ear.
author: FRANK TYGER

quote: In order that all men may be taught to speak truth, it is necessary that all likewise should learn to hear it.
author: SAMUEL JOHNSON

quote: The less you talk, the more you’re listened to.
author: ABIGAIL VAN BUREN

quote: Talk to a man about himself and he will listen for hours.
author: BENJAMIN DISRAELI

quote: Give every man thy ear but few thy voice.
author: WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE

quote: The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn’t being said.
author: Peter F. Drucker

quote: Good communication is as stimulating as black coffee, and just as hard to sleep after.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: There is always hope when people are forced to listen to both sides.
author: JOHN STUART MILL

quote: A good listener is not only popular everywhere, but after a while he knows something.
author: WILSON MIZNER

quote: Listen, or thy tongue will keep thee deaf.
author: NATIVE AMERICAN PROVERB

quote: No one really listens to anyone else. Try it for a while, and you’ll see why.
author: MIGNON MCLAUGHLIN

quote: Listening to both sides of a story will convince you that there is more to a story than both sides.
author: FRANK TYGER

quote: Sainthood emerges when you can listen to someone’s tale of woe and not respond with a description of your own.
author: ANDREW V. MASON, MD

quote: Most people would rather defend to the death your right to say it than listen to it.
author: ROBERT BRAULT

quote: To entertain some people all you have to do is listen.
author: BERNARD EDINGER

quote: Two great talkers will not travel far together.
author: SPANISH PROVERB

quote: Silences make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying but the never needing to say is what counts.
author: MARGARET LEE RUNBECK

quote: Hospitality consists in a little fire, a little food and an immense quiet.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: In quiet places, reason abounds.
author: ADLAI E. STEVENSON

quote: Well-timed silence is the most commanding expression.
author: MARK HELPRIN

quote: There are times when silence has the loudest voice.
author: LEROY BROWNLOW

quote: The time to stop talking is when the other person nods his head affirmatively but says nothing.
author: HENRY S. HASKINS

quote: The right word may be effective, but no word was ever as effective as a rightly timed pause.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: He approaches nearest to the gods who knows how to be silent, even though he is in the right.
author: CATO

quote: Silence is the unbearable repartee.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: Silence is one of the hardest arguments to refute.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: Silence, along with modesty, is a great aid to conversation.
author: MONTAIGNE

quote: Silence is the safety zone of conversation.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Silence is still a marvelous language that has few initiates.
author: Roger Duhamel

quote: The most difficult thing in the world is to know how to do a thing and to watch someone else doing it wrong, without comment.
author: THEODORE H. WHITE

quote: Tact is the rare ability to keep silent while two friends are arguing, and you know both of them are wrong.
author: HUGH ALLEN

quote: Fools live to regret their words, wise men to regret their silence.
author: WILL HENRY

quote: Some people talk because they think sound is more manageable than silence.
author: MARGARET HALSEY

quote: Blessed are they who have nothing to say and who cannot be persuaded to say it.
author: JAMES RUSSELL LOWELL

quote: If you really want to keep a secret you don’t need any help.
author: O. A. CARPING

quote: Isn’t it strange that we talk least about the things we think about most!
author: CHARLES A. LINDBERGH

quote: A secret is what you tell someone else not to tell because you can’t keep it to yourself.
author: LEONARD LOUIS LEVINSON

quote: The vanity of being known to be entrusted with a secret is generally one of the chief motives to disclose it.
author: SAMUEL JOHNSON

quote: None are so fond of secrets as those who do not mean to keep them.
author: C. C. COLTON

quote: The knowledge that a secret exists is half of the secret.
author: JOSHUA MEYROWITZ

quote: He who has a secret should not only hide it, but hide that he has it to hide.
author: THOMAS CARLYLE

quote: If you reveal your secrets to the wind, you should not blame the wind for revealing them to the trees.
author: KAHLIL GIBRAN

quote: No one keeps a secret better than he who ignores it.
author: LOUIS-N. FORTIN

quote: Another person’s secret is like another person’s money: you are not as careful with it as you are with your own.
author: E. W. HOWE

quote: Have you noticed that these days even a moment of silence has to be accompanied by background music?
author: Funny Funny World

quote: My personal hobbies are reading, listening to music and silence.
author: EDITH SITWELL

quote: I like the silent church before the service begins better than any preaching.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: You can’t always go by expert opinion. A turkey, if you ask a turkey, should be stuffed with grasshoppers, grit and worms.
author: Changing Times

quote: The man who never alters his opinion is like standing water, and breeds reptiles of the mind.
author: WILLIAM BLAKE

quote: Opinions should be formed with great caution—and changed with greater.
author: JOSH BILLINGS

quote: A leading authority is anyone who has guessed right more than once.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: It is only about things that do not interest one that one can give a really unbiased opinion, which is no doubt the reason why an unbiased opinion is always valueless.
author: OSCAR WILDE

quote: We tolerate differences of opinion in people who are familiar to us. But differences of opinion in people we do not know sound like heresy or plots.
author: BROOKS ATKINSON

quote: The function of the expert is not to be more right than other people, but to be wrong for more sophisticated reasons.
author: DAVID BUTLER

quote: An expert is someone called in at the last minute to share the blame.
author: SAM EWING

quote: Even when the experts all agree, they may well be mistaken.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Every man has a right to be wrong in his opinions. But no man has a right to be wrong in his facts.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: It is easy enough to hold an opinion, but hard work to actually know what one is talking about.
author: PAUL F. FORD

quote: Too often we enjoy the comfort of opinion without the discomfort of thought.
author: JOHN F. KENNEDY

quote: The fewer the facts, the stronger the opinion.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: The only thing worse than an expert is someone who thinks he’s an expert.
author: ALY A. COLON

quote: A public-opinion poll is no substitute for thought.
author: WARREN BUFFETT

quote: Public opinion is like the castle ghost; no one has ever seen it, but everyone is scared of it.
author: SIGMUND GRAFF

quote: Every conviction was a whim at birth.
author: HEYWOOD BROUN

quote: Refusing to have an opinion is a way of having one, isn’t it?
author: LUIGI PIRANDELLO

quote: Saying what we think gives a wider range of conversation than saying what we know.
author: CULLEN HIGHTOWER

quote: To disagree, one doesn’t have to be disagreeable.
author: BARRY M. GOLDWATER WITH JACK CASSERLY

quote: There’s a difference between opinion and conviction. My opinion is something that is true for me personally; my conviction is something that is true for everybody—in my opinion.
author: SYLVIA CORDWOOD

quote: Every new opinion, at its starting, is precisely in a minority of one.
author: THOMAS CARLYLE

quote: I sometimes give myself admirable advice, but I am incapable of taking it.
author: MARY WORTLEY MONTAGU

quote: To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.
author: JOHN CHURTON COLLINS

quote: You don’t need to take a person’s advice to make him feel good—just ask for it.
author: LAURENCE J. PETER

quote: A knife of the keenest steel requires the whetstone, and the wisest man needs advice.
author: ZOROASTER

quote: Advice is an uncertain gift.
author: WHITNEY JEFFERY

quote: Expert advice is a great comfort, even when it’s wrong.
author: ELLEN CURRIE

quote: When we ask for advice, we are usually looking for an accomplice.
author: MARQUIS DE LA GRANGE

quote: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn’t.
author: ERICA JONG

quote: Most of us ask for advice when we know the answer but want a different one.
author: IVERN BALL

quote: Express an opinion, but send advice by freight.
author: CHARLES CLARK MUNN

quote: Good advice usually works best when preceded by a bad scare.
author: AL BATT

quote: Of the few innocent pleasures left to men past middle life, the jamming of common sense down the throats of fools is perhaps the keenest.
author: T. H. HUXLEY

quote: When we are well, we all have good advice for those who are ill.
author: TERENCE

quote: We are never so generous as when giving advice.
author: FRANÇOIS DE LA ROCHEFOUCAULD

quote: People who have what they want are fond of telling people who haven’t what they want that they really don’t want it.
author: OGDEN NASH

quote: We give advice by the bucket but take it by the grain.
author: WILLIAM ALGER

quote: The thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never any good to oneself.
author: OSCAR WILDE

quote: Advice should always be consumed between two thick slices of doubt.
author: WALT SCHMIDT

quote: The best advice yet given is that you don’t have to take it.
author: LIBBIE FUDIM

quote: Don’t be troubled if the temptation to give advice is irresistible; the ability to ignore it is universal.
author: Planned Security

quote: Use soft words and hard arguments.
author: ENGLISH PROVERB

quote: A good indignation makes an excellent speech.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: There is nothing in the world like a persuasive speech to fuddle the mental apparatus.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: If you have an important point to make, don’t try to be subtle or clever. Use a pile driver. Hit the point once. Then come back and hit it again. Then hit it a third time a tremendous whack.
author: WINSTON CHURCHILL

quote: Charm is a way of getting the answer yes without asking a clear question.
author: ALBERT CAMUS

quote: Praise, like gold and diamonds, owes its value only to its scarcity.
author: SAMUEL JOHNSON

quote: Sandwich every bit of criticism between two layers of praise.
author: MARY KAY ASH

quote: One thought driven home is better than three left on base.
author: JAMES LITER

quote: Example is not the main thing in influencing others. It is the only thing.
author: ALBERT SCHWEITZER

quote: The great charm in argument is really finding one’s own opinions, not other people’s.
author: EVELYN WAUGH

quote: It is better to debate a question without settling it than to settle a question without debating it.
author: JOSEPH JOUBERT

quote: Nothing can keep an argument going like two persons who aren’t sure what they’re arguing about.
author: O. A. BATTISTA

quote: A single fact will often spoil an interesting argument.
author: Selected Cryptograms III

quote: You have not converted a man because you have silenced him.
author: JOHN MORLEY

quote: It is impossible to defeat an ignorant man in an argument.
author: WILLIAM G. MCADOO

quote: In quarreling, the truth is always lost.
author: PUBLILIUS SYRUS

quote: Never answer an angry word with an angry word. It’s the second one that makes the quarrel.
author: W. A. NANCE

quote: People generally quarrel because they cannot argue.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: The difficult part in an argument is not to defend one’s opinion but rather to know it.
author: ANDRÉ MAUROIS

quote: Quarrels would not last long if the fault were on one side only.
author: FRANÇOIS DE LA ROCHEFOUCAULD

quote: Violence in the voice is often only the death rattle of reason in the throat.
author: JOHN F. BOYES

quote: Whether on the road or in an argument, when you see red it’s time to stop.
author: JAN MCKEITHEN

quote: Anybody who thinks there aren’t two sides to every argument is probably in one.
author: The Cockle Bur

quote: An apology is the superglue of life. It can repair just about anything.
author: LYNN JOHNSTON

quote: The man who offers an insult writes it in sand, but for the man who receives it, it’s chiseled in bronze.
author: GIOVANNI GUARESCHI

quote: An ounce of apology is worth a pound of loneliness.
author: JOSEPH JOUBERT

quote: An apology is a good way to have the last word.
author: Dell Crossword Puzzles

quote: Prayer is when you talk to God; meditation is when you listen to God.
author: DIANA ROBINSON

quote: Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.
author: MOHANDAS K. GANDHI

quote: The greatest prayer is patience.
author: GAUTAMA BUDDHA

quote: What we usually pray to God is not that His will be done, but that He approve ours.
author: HELGA BERGOLD GROSS

quote: The object of most prayers is to wangle an advance on good intentions.
author: ROBERT BRAULT

quote: Certain thoughts are prayers. There are moments when, whatever be the attitude of the body, the soul is on its knees.
author: VICTOR HUGO

quote: If you begin to live life looking for the God that is all around you, every moment becomes a prayer.
author: FRANK BIANCO

quote: Our prayers are answered not when we are given what we ask but when we are challenged to be what we can be.
author: MORRIS ADLER

quote: Any concern too small to be turned into a prayer is too small to be made into a burden.
author: CORRIE TEN BOOM

quote: If we could all hear one another’s prayers, God might be relieved of some of his burden.
author: ASHLEIGH BRILLIANT

quote: Serving God is doing good to man. But praying is thought an easier service and is therefore more generally chosen.
author: BENJAMIN FRANKLIN

quote: God is like a mirror. The mirror never changes but everybody who looks at it sees something different.
author: RABBI HAROLD KUSHNER

quote: Prayer is less about changing the world than it is about changing ourselves.
author: DAVID J. WOLPE

quote: Get down on your knees and thank God you are on your feet.
author: IRISH SAYING

quote: Never trust someone who has to change his tone to ask something of the Lord.
author: ROBERTA A. EVERETT

quote: Call on God, but row away from the rocks.
author: ROBERT M. YOUNG

quote: Trust in God—but tie your camel tight.
author: PERSIAN PROVERB

quote: Civilization is a movement and not a condition, a voyage and not a harbor.
author: ARNOLD TOYNBEE

quote: Great ideas need landing gear as well as wings.
author: C. D. JACKSON

quote: The history of mankind is the history of ideas.
author: LUDWIG VON MISES

quote: A man is but a product of his thoughts; what he thinks, that he becomes.
author: MOHANDAS K. GANDHI

quote: An invasion of armies can be resisted, but not an idea whose time has come.
author: VICTOR HUGO

quote: It is useless to send armies against ideas.
author: GEORG BRANDES

quote: Good ideas are not adopted automatically. They must be driven into practice with courageous impatience.
author: ADM. HYMAN G. RICKOVER

quote: A cup is useful only when it is empty; and a mind that is filled with beliefs, with dogmas, with assertions, with quotations is really an uncreative mind.
author: J. KRISHNAMURTI

quote: The man with a new idea is a crank until the idea succeeds.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitude.
author: WILLIAM JAMES

quote: Thought is action in rehearsal.
author: SIGMUND FREUD

quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
author: REV. NORMAN VINCENT PEALE

quote: He who cannot change the very fabric of his thought will never be able to change reality.
author: ANWAR EL-SADAT

quote: The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven.
author: JOHN MILTON

quote: If most of us are ashamed of shabby clothes and shoddy furniture, let us be more ashamed of shabby ideas and shoddy philosophies.
author: ALBERT EINSTEIN

quote: Good thoughts bear good fruit, bad thoughts bear bad fruit—and man is his own gardener.
author: JAMES ALLEN

quote: Bring ideas in and entertain them royally, for one of them may be the king.
author: MARK VAN DOREN

quote: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to function.
author: F. SCOTT FITZGERALD

quote: I like to have a man’s knowledge comprehend more than one class of topics, one row of shelves. I like a man who likes to see a fine barn as well as a good tragedy.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Learning is not attained by chance. It must be sought for with ardor and attended to with diligence.
author: ABIGAIL ADAMS

quote: What we learn with pleasure we never forget.
author: ALFRED MERCIER

quote: Most people are willing to pay more to be amused than to be educated.
author: ROBERT C. SAVAGE

quote: Education is not training but rather the process that equips you to entertain yourself, a friend and an idea.
author: WALLACE STERLING

quote: Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire.
author: WILLIAM BUTLER YEATS

quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
author: EDITH WHARTON

quote: An education is like a crumbling building that needs constant upkeep with repairs and additions.
author: LOUIS DUDEK

quote: A master can tell you what he expects of you. A teacher, though, awakens your own expectations.
author: PATRICIA NEAL WITH RICHARD DENEUT

quote: A great teacher never strives to explain his vision—he simply invites you to stand beside him and see for yourself.
author: REV. R. INMAN

quote: If you would thoroughly know anything, teach it to others.
author: TRYON EDWARDS

quote: To teach is to learn twice.
author: JOSEPH JOUBERT

quote: Good education is the essential foundation of a strong democracy.
author: BARBARA BUSH

quote: Education is more than a luxury; it is a responsibility that society owes to itself.
author: ROBIN COOK

quote: Education is learning what you didn’t even know you didn’t know.
author: DANIEL J. BOORSTIN

quote: Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: It is not the business of science to inherit the earth, but to inherit the moral imagination; because without that, man and beliefs and science will perish together.
author: JACOB BRONOWSKI

quote: Science has made us gods even before we are worthy of being men.
author: JEAN ROSTAND

quote: An age is called Dark, not because the light fails to shine, but because people refuse to see it.
author: JAMES A. MICHENER

quote: In every work of genius, we recognize our own rejected thoughts; they come back to us with a certain alienated majesty.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: If you are seeking creative ideas, go out walking. Angels whisper to a man when he goes for a walk.
author: RAYMOND INMAN

quote: An idea can turn to dust or magic, depending on the talent that rubs against it.
author: WILLIAM BERNBACH

quote: Be curious always! For knowledge will not acquire you; you must acquire it.
author: SUDIE BACK

quote: Curiosity is the wick in the candle of learning.
author: WILLIAM A. WARD

quote: The little I know, I owe to my ignorance.
author: SACHA GUITRY

quote: Curiosity is a willing, a proud, an eager confession of ignorance.
author: S. LEONARD RUBINSTEIN

quote: A sense of curiosity is nature’s original school of education.
author: SMILEY BLANTON, MD

quote: The human mind is as driven to understand as the body is driven to survive.
author: HUGH GILMORE

quote: If a man had as many ideas during the day as he does when he has insomnia, he’d make a fortune.
author: GRIFF NIBLACK

quote: Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen.
author: JOHN STEINBECK

quote: All my best thoughts were stolen by the ancients.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: A new idea is delicate. It can be killed by a sneer or a yawn; it can be stabbed to death by a quip, and worried to death by a frown on the right man’s brow.
author: CHARLIE BROWER

quote: Man’s mind stretched to a new idea never goes back to its original dimensions.
author: OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES

quote: One should never spoil a good theory by explaining it.
author: PETER MCARTHUR

quote: Once a new idea springs into existence, it cannot be unthought. There is a sense of immortality in a new idea.
author: EDWARD DE BONO

quote: An open mind collects more riches than an open purse.
author: WILL HENRY

quote: A cold in the head causes less suffering than an idea.
author: JULES RENARD

quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
author: JOHN LOCKE

quote: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.
author: JOSEPH ADDISON

quote: Books may well be the only true magic.
author: ALICE HOFFMAN

quote: Books are not made for furniture, but there is nothing else that so beautifully furnishes a house.
author: HENRY WARD BEECHER

quote: Reading makes immigrants of us all—it takes us away from home, but more important, it finds homes for us everywhere.
author: HAZEL ROCHMAN

quote: There are perhaps no days of our childhood we lived so fully as those we believe we left without having lived them: those we spent with a favorite book.
author: MARCEL PROUST

quote: From your parents you learn love and laughter and how to put one foot before the other. But when books are opened you discover that you have wings.
author: HELEN HAYES WITH SANDFORD DODY

quote: Books are the carriers of civilization. Without books, history is silent, literature dumb, science crippled, thought and speculation at a standstill.
author: BARBARA W. TUCHMAN

quote: Books had instant replay long before televised sports.
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: If you would understand your own age, read the works of fiction produced in it. People in disguise speak freely.
author: ARTHUR HELPS

quote: Books are more than books. They are the life, the very heart and core of ages past, the reason why men lived and worked and died, the essence and quintessence of their lives.
author: AMY LOWELL

quote: There are no faster or firmer friendships than those between people who love the same books.
author: IRVING STONE

quote: Every man who knows how to read has it in his power to magnify, to multiply the ways in which he exists, to make his life full, significant and interesting.
author: ALDOUS HUXLEY

quote: Fiction reveals truths that reality obscures.
author: JESSAMYN WEST

quote: Reading without reflecting is like eating without digesting.
author: EDMUND BURKE

quote: No one ever really paid the price of a book—only the price of printing it.
author: LOUIS I. KAHN

quote: A truly good book is something as wildly natural and primitive, mysterious and marvelous, ambrosial and fertile as a fungus or a lichen.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: I would rather be a poor man in a garret with plenty of books than a king who did not love reading.
author: THOMAS BABINGTON MACAULAY

quote: My test of a good novel is dreading to begin the last chapter.
author: THOMAS HELM

quote: A book is a success when people who haven’t read it pretend they have.
author: LOS ANGELES TIMES SYNDICATE

quote: If you would know what nobody knows, read what everybody reads, just one year afterward.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: I divide all readers into two classes: those who read to remember and those who read to forget.
author: WILLIAM LYON PHELPS

quote: The wise man reads both books and life itself.
author: LIN YUTANG

quote: The library is the temple of learning, and learning has liberated more people than all the wars in history.
author: CARL ROWAN

quote: The real purpose of books is to trap the mind into doing its own thinking.
author: CHRISTOPHER MORLEY

quote: Without libraries what have we? We have no past and no future.
author: RAY BRADBURY

quote: Perhaps no place in any community is so totally democratic as the town library. The only entrance requirement is interest.
author: LADY BIRD JOHNSON

quote: A book should serve as the ax for the frozen sea within us.
author: FRANZ KAFKA

quote: A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.
author: CAROLINE GORDON

quote: You know you’ve read a good book when you turn the last page and feel a little as if you have lost a friend.
author: PAUL SWEENEY

quote: Books support us in our solitude and keep us from being a burden to ourselves.
author: JEREMY COLLIER

quote: There is a wonder in reading braille that the sighted will never know: to touch words and have them touch you back.
author: JIM FIEBIG

quote: A book, tight shut, is but a block of paper.
author: CHINESE PROVERB

quote: A great book should leave you with many experiences and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading it.
author: WILLIAM STYRON

quote: A truly great book should be read in youth, again in maturity and once more in old age, as a fine building should be seen by morning light, at noon and by moonlight.
author: ROBERTSON DAVIES

quote: “Tell me what you read and I’ll tell you who you are” is true enough, but I’d know you better if you told me what you reread.
author: FRANÇOIS MAURIAC

quote: When something can be read without effort, great effort has gone into its writing.
author: ENRIQUE JARDIEL PONCELA

quote: Wherever they burn books they will also, in the end, burn human beings.
author: HEINRICH HEINE

quote: You don’t have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them.
author: RAY BRADBURY

quote: An author retains the singular distinction of being the only person who can remain a bore long after he is dead.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: For a man to become a poet he must be in love, or miserable.
author: GEORGE GORDON, LORD BYRON

quote: You don’t have to suffer to be a poet. Adolescence is enough suffering for anyone.
author: JOHN CIARDI

quote: In the end, the poem is not a thing we see; it is, rather, a light by which we may see—and what we see is life.
author: ROBERT PENN WARREN

quote: Poetry is language at its most distilled and most powerful.
author: RITA DOVE

quote: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.
author: ROBERT FROST

quote: Poetry is an echo, asking a shadow to dance.
author: CARL SANDBURG

quote: The difference between reality and fiction? Fiction has to make sense.
author: TOM CLANCY

quote: Choose an author as you choose a friend.
author: WENTWORTH DILLON

quote: Fable is more historical than fact, because fact tells us about one man and fable tells us about a million men.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: Let us read and let us dance—two amusements that will never do any harm to the world.
author: VOLTAIRE

quote: I cannot conceive how a novelist could fail to pity or love the smallest creation of his imagination; incomplete as these characters may be, they are the writer’s bond with the real world, its suffering and heartbreak.
author: GABRIELLE ROY

quote: When you take stuff from one writer, it’s plagiarism; but when you take it from many writers it’s research.
author: WILSON MIZNER

quote: October is crisp days and cool nights, a time to curl up around the dancing flames and sink into a good book.
author: JOHN SINOR

quote: There’s nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and open a vein.
author: RED SMITH

quote: When I want to read a novel, I write one.
author: BENJAMIN DISRAELI

quote: Art is a staple, like bread or wine or a warm coat in winter. Man’s spirit grows hungry for art in the same way his stomach growls for food.
author: IRVING STONE

quote: Art is the signature of civilization.
author: BEVERLY SILLS

quote: Art extends each man’s short time on earth by carrying from man to man the whole complexity of other men’s lifelong experience, with all its burdens, colors and flavor.
author: ALEKSANDR SOLZHENITSYN

quote: Every fragment of song holds a mirror to a past moment for someone.
author: FANNY CRADOCK

quote: A room hung with pictures is a room hung with thoughts.
author: SIR JOSHUA REYNOLDS

quote: Anyone who says you can’t see a thought simply doesn’t know art.
author: WYNETKA ANN REYNOLDS

quote: No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
author: OSCAR WILDE

quote: Art is the demonstration that the ordinary is extraordinary.
author: AMÉDÉE OZENFANT

quote: Art doesn’t reproduce the visible but rather makes it visible.
author: PAUL KLEE

quote: It has been said that art is a tryst; for the joy of it maker and beholder meet.
author: KOJIRO TOMITA

quote: Art is the only way to run away without leaving home.
author: TWYLA THARP

quote: Half of art is knowing when to stop.
author: ARTHUR WILLIAM RADFORD

quote: The other arts persuade us, but music takes us by surprise.
author: EDUARD HANSLICK

quote: Without music, life is a journey through a desert.
author: PAT CONROY

quote: Country music is three chords and the truth.
author: HARLAN HOWARD

quote: Music is the way our memories sing to us across time.
author: LANCE MORROW

quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
author: ALDOUS HUXLEY

quote: Music washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
author: BERTHOLD AUERBACH

quote: Music is the shorthand of emotion.
author: LEO TOLSTOY

quote: Where words fail, music speaks.
author: HANS CHRISTIAN ANDERSEN

quote: Music is a higher revelation than philosophy.
author: LUDWIG VAN BEETHOVEN

quote: People who make music together cannot be enemies, at least not while the music lasts.
author: PAUL HINDEMITH

quote: He who sings frightens away his ills.
author: MIGUEL DE CERVANTES SAAVEDRA

quote: God respects me when I work, but he loves me when I sing.
author: RABINDRANATH TAGORE

quote: If I may venture my own definition of a folk song, I should call it “an individual flowering on a common stem.”
author: RALPH VAUGHN WILLIAMS

quote: Learning music by reading about it is like making love by mail.
author: LUCIANO PAVAROTTI

quote: No one should be allowed to play the violin until he has mastered it.
author: JIM FIEBIG

quote: Those move easiest who have learned to dance.
author: ALEXANDER POPE

quote: The truest expression of a people is in its dances and its music. Bodies never lie.
author: AGNES DE MILLE

quote: Inside every man there is a poet who died young.
author: STEPHAN KANFER

quote: There is no abstract art. You must always start with something. Afterward you can remove all traces of reality.
author: PABLO PICASSO

quote: Every artist was first an amateur.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: The greatest artist was once a beginner.
author: Farmer’s Digest

quote: All art, like all love, is rooted in heartache.
author: ALFRED STIEGLITZ

quote: What art offers is space—a certain breathing room for the spirit.
author: JOHN UPDIKE

quote: More important than a work of art itself is what it will sow. Art can die, a painting can disappear. What counts is the seed.
author: JOAN MIRÓ

quote: Art is the triumph over chaos.
author: JOHN CHEEVER

quote: What is art but a way of seeing?
author: THOMAS BERGER

quote: A great artist is never poor.
author: ISAK DINESEN

quote: Talent is a flame. Genius is a fire.
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: No one can arrive from being talented alone. God gives talent; work transforms talent into genius.
author: ANNA PAVLOVA

quote: Discipline is the refining fire by which talent becomes ability.
author: ROY L. SMITH

quote: Perfectionism is the enemy of creation, as extreme self-solicitude is the enemy of well-being.
author: JOHN UPDIKE

quote: When love and skill work together, expect a masterpiece.
author: JOHN RUSKIN

quote: I created nothing; I invented nothing; I imagined nothing; I perverted nothing; I simply discovered drama in real life.
author: BERNARD SHAW

quote: There’s no need to believe what an artist says. Believe what he does; that’s what counts.
author: DAVID HOCKNEY

quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
author: PABLO PICASSO

quote: Really we create nothing. We merely plagiarize nature.
author: JEAN BAITAILLON

quote: A great city is one that handles its garbage and art equally well.
author: BOB TALBERT

quote: A good snapshot stops a moment from running away.
author: EUDORA WELTY

quote: The cinema has no boundary; it is a ribbon of dream.
author: ORSON WELLES

quote: Of course, there must be subtleties. Just make sure you make them obvious.
author: BILLY WILDER

quote: It pays to be obvious, especially if you have a reputation for subtlety.
author: ISAAC ASIMOV

quote: Simplicity, carried to an extreme, becomes elegance.
author: JON FRANKLIN

quote: It is only by introducing the young to great literature, drama and music, and to the excitement of great science that we open to them the possibilities that lie within the human spirit — enable them to see visions and dream dreams.
author: ERIC ANDERSON

quote: Man creates culture and through culture creates himself.
author: POPE JOHN PAUL II

quote: The way I see it, if you want a rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain.
author: DOLLY PARTON

quote: It is easier to accept the message of the stars than the message of the salt desert. The stars speak of man’s insignificance in the long eternity of time; the deserts speak of his insignificance right now.
author: EDWIN WAY TEALE

quote: Eternity is a terrible thought. I mean, where’s it going to end?
author: TOM STOPPARD

quote: Forever is a long time, but not as long as it was yesterday.
author: DENNIS H’ORGNIES

quote: Time is but the stream I go a-fishing in.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: Time neither subtracts nor divides, but adds at such a pace it seems like multiplication.
author: BOB TALBERT

quote: The future is the past returning through another gate.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Snatching the eternal out of the desperately fleeting is the great magic trick of human existence.
author: TENNESSEE WILLIAMS

quote: Time is a versatile performer. It flies, marches on, heals all wounds, runs out and will tell.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: Time goes, you say? Ah, no! Alas, Time stays, we go.
author: AUSTIN DOBSON

quote: Time marks us while we are marking time.
author: THEODORE ROETHKE

quote: Time wastes our bodies and our wits, but we waste time, so we are quits.
author: Verse and Worse

quote: In rivers, the water that you touch is the last of what has passed and the first of that which comes: so with present time.
author: LEONARDO DA VINCI

quote: You don’t get to choose how you’re going to die. Or when. You can only decide how you’re going to live. Now.
author: JOAN BAEZ

quote: The feeling of being hurried is not usually the result of living a full life and having no time. It is, rather, born of a vague fear that we are wasting our life.
author: ERIC HOFFER

quote: Yesterday is a canceled check; tomorrow is a promissory note; today is ready cash—use it.
author: KAY LYONS

quote: How you spend your time is more important than how you spend your money. Money mistakes can be corrected, but time is gone forever.
author: DAVID B. NORRIS

quote: Those who make the worst use of their time are the first to complain of its shortness.
author: JEAN DE LA BRUYÈRE

quote: Half our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
author: WILL ROGERS

quote: Today’s greatest labor-saving device is tomorrow.
author: TOM WILSON

quote: Mañana is often the busiest day of the week.
author: SPANISH PROVERB

quote: One of these days is none of these days.
author: HENRI TUBACH

quote: By the streets of “by and by” one arrives at the house of “never.”
author: SPANISH PROVERB

quote: Don’t put off for tomorrow what you can do today, because if you enjoy it today you can do it again tomorrow.
author: JAMES A. MICHENER

quote: Nothing adds to a person’s leisure time like doing things when they are supposed to be done.
author: O. A. BATTISTA

quote: For disappearing acts, it’s hard to beat what happens to the eight hours supposedly left after eight of sleep and eight of work.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: When we don’t waste time, we always have enough.
author: JEAN DRAPEAU

quote: As if we could kill time without injuring eternity!
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: A man who has to be punctually at a certain place at five o’clock has the whole afternoon ruined for him already.
author: LIN YUTANG

quote: The surest way to be late is to have plenty of time.
author: LEO KENNEDY

quote: Normal day, let me be aware of the treasure you are.
author: MARY JEAN IRION

quote: Butterflies count not months but moments, and yet have time enough.
author: RABINDRANATH TAGORE

quote: Time, for all its smuggling in of new problems, conspicuously cancels others.
author: CLARA WINSTON

quote: Time has a wonderful way of weeding out the trivial.
author: RICHARD BEN SAPIR

quote: I still find each day too short for all the thoughts I want to think, all the walks I want to take, all the books I want to read and all the friends I want to see.
author: JOHN BURROUGHS

quote: Yesterday is experience. Tomorrow is hope. Today is getting from one to the other as best we can.
author: JOHN M. HENRY

quote: You must have been warned against letting the golden hours slip by; but some of them are golden only because we let them slip by.
author: JAMES M. BARRIE

quote: We are tomorrow’s past.
author: MARY WEBB

quote: The present is the point at which time touches eternity.
author: C. S. LEWIS

quote: Life is uncharted territory. It reveals its story one moment at a time.
author: LEO BUSCAGLIA

quote: I never think of the future. It comes soon enough.
author: ALBERT EINSTEIN

quote: There is no distance on this earth as far away as yesterday.
author: ROBERT NATHAN

quote: The past is really almost as much a work of the imagination as the future.
author: JESSAMYN WEST

quote: He who believes that the past cannot be changed has not yet written his memoirs.
author: TORVALD GAHLIN

quote: There is a time to let things happen and a time to make things happen.
author: HUGH PRATHER

quote: Every man regards his own life as the New Year’s Eve of time.
author: JEAN PAUL RICHTER

quote: The best thing about the future is that it comes only one day at a time.
author: DEAN ACHESON

quote: I love best to have each thing in its season, doing without it at all other times.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: Life is not dated merely by years. Events are sometimes the best calendars.
author: BENJAMIN DISRAELI

quote: Time has no divisions to mark its passage; there is never a thunderstorm to announce the beginning of a new year. It is only we mortals who ring bells and fire off pistols.
author: THOMAS MANN

quote: Life is not a “brief candle.” It is a splendid torch that I want to make burn as brightly as possible before handing it on to future generations.
author: BERNARD SHAW

quote: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.
author: HAVELOCK ELLIS

quote: God asks no man whether he will accept life. That is not the choice. One must take it. The only choice is how.
author: HENRY WARD BEECHER

quote: If we live good lives, the times are also good. As we are, such are the times.
author: ST. AUGUSTINE

quote: We are here to add what we can to, not to get what we can from, life.
author: SIR WILLIAM OSLER

quote: Presence is more than just being there.
author: MALCOLM S. FORBES

quote: There are three things that if a man does not know, he cannot live long in this world: what is too much for him, what is too little for him and what is just right for him.
author: SWAHILI PROVERB

quote: You only live once. But if you work it right, once is enough.
author: FRED ALLEN

quote: Besides the noble art of getting things done, there is the noble art of leaving things undone. The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of non essentials.
author: LIN YUTANG

quote: There is more to life than increasing its speed.
author: MOHANDAS K. GANDHI

quote: Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler.
author: ALBERT EINSTEIN

quote: I believe the art of living consists not so much in complicating simple things as in simplifying things that are not.
author: FRANÇOIS HERTEL

quote: Simplicity is making the journey of this life with just baggage enough.
author: CHARLES DUDLEY WARNER

quote: Seize from every moment its unique novelty, and do not prepare your joys.
author: ANDRÉ GIDE

quote: Excess on occasion is exhilarating. It prevents moderation from acquiring the deadening effect of a habit.
author: W. SOMERSET MAUGHAM

quote: If you can spend a perfectly useless afternoon in a perfectly useless manner, you have learned how to live.
author: LIN YUTANG

quote: He does not seem to me to be a free man who does not sometimes do nothing.
author: CICERO

quote: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
author: ANNIE DILLARD

quote: A holiday gives one a chance to look backward and forward, to reset oneself by an inner compass.
author: MAY SARTON

quote: The time to relax is when you don’t have time for it.
author: SYDNEY J. HARRIS

quote: A vacation is having nothing to do and all day to do it in.
author: ROBERT ORBEN

quote: The discovery of a new dish does more for human happiness than the discovery of a star.
author: ANTHELME BRILLAT-SAVARIN

quote: A good cook is like a sorceress who dispenses happiness.
author: ELSA SCHIAPARELLI

quote: There is no love sincerer than the love of food.
author: BERNARD SHAW

quote: We never repent of having eaten too little.
author: THOMAS JEFFERSON

quote: One of the very nicest things about life is the way we must regularly stop whatever it is we are doing and devote our attention to eating.
author: LUCIANO PAVAROTTI WITH WILLIAM WRIGHT

quote: There is a sufficiency in the world for man’s need but not for man’s greed.
author: MOHANDAS K. GANDHI

quote: Whatever will satisfy hunger is good food.
author: CHINESE PROVERB

quote: ’Tis an ill cook that cannot lick his own fingers.
author: WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE

quote: One must ask children and birds how cherries and strawberries taste.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: Never eat more than you can lift.
author: Miss Piggy’s Guide to Life

quote: There is only one difference between a long life and a good dinner: that, in the dinner, the sweets come last.
author: ROBERT LOUIS STEVENSON

quote: We are all mortal until the first kiss and the second glass of wine.
author: EDUARDO GALEANO

quote: Be glad of life because it gives you the chance to love and to work and to play and to look up at the stars.
author: HENRY VAN DYKE

quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
author: MARCUS AURELIUS

quote: Part of the art of living is knowing how to compare yourself with the right people. Dissatisfaction is often the result of unsuitable comparison.
author: DR. HEINRICH SOBOTKA

quote: Is not life a hundred times too short for us to bore ourselves?
author: FRIEDRICH NIETZSCHE

quote: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
author: ROBERT BRAULT

quote: Yes, there is a nirvana; it is in leading your sheep to a green pasture, and in putting your child to sleep, and in writing the last line of your poem.
author: KAHLIL GIBRAN

quote: When things start going your way, it’s usually because you stopped going the wrong way down a one-way street.
author: Los Angeles Times Syndicate

quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture and, if possible, speak a few reasonable words.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: Ideals are like the stars. We never reach them but, like the mariners on the sea, we chart our course by them.
author: CARL SCHURZ

quote: The ideals which have lighted my way, and time after time have given me new courage to face life cheerfully, have been kindness, beauty and truth.
author: ALBERT EINSTEIN

quote: When you teach your son, you teach your son’s son.
author: THE TALMUD

quote: The true idealist pursues what his heart says is right in a way that his head says will work.
author: RICHARD M. NIXON

quote: If things were really as we wanted them to be, people would still complain that they were no longer what they used to be.
author: PIERRE DAC

quote: I am an idealist. I don’t know where I’m going, but I’m on my way.
author: CARL SANDBURG

quote: Some things have to be believed to be seen.
author: RALPH HODGSON

quote: One person with a belief is a social power equal to 99 who have only interests.
author: JOHN STUART MILL

quote: To believe with certainty, we must begin with doubting.
author: STANISLAUS I

quote: Faith is building on what you know is here, so you can reach what you know is there.
author: CULLEN HIGHTOWER

quote: Strike from mankind the principle of faith and men would have no more history than a flock of sheep.
author: MARK BELTAIRE

quote: Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.
author: CARL SAGAN

quote: If we were logical, the future would be bleak indeed. But we are more than logical. We are human beings, and we have faith, and we have hope, and we can work.
author: JACQUES COUSTEAU

quote: We couldn’t conceive of a miracle if none had ever happened.
author: LIBBIE FUDIM

quote: In faith there is enough light for those who want to believe and enough shadows to blind those who don’t.
author: BLAISE PASCAL

quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Faith is knowing there is an ocean because you have seen a brook.
author: WILLIAM ARTHUR WARD

quote: Faith is like radar that sees through the fog—the reality of things at a distance that the human eye cannot see.
author: CORRIE TEN BOOM

quote: Faith is the bird that sings when the dawn is still dark.
author: RABINDRANATH TAGORE

quote: What I admire in Columbus is not his having discovered a world but his having gone to search for it on the faith of an opinion.
author: A. ROBERT TURGOT

quote: If the stars should appear just one night in a thousand years, how would men believe and adore!
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Many of us look at the Ten Commandments as an exam paper: eight only to be attempted.
author: MALCOLM MUGGERIDGE

quote: The finest fruit of serious learning should be the ability to speak the word God without reserve or embarrassment.
author: NATHAN M. PUSEY

quote: Our rabbi once said, “God always answers our prayers, it’s just that sometimes the answer is no.”
author: BARBARA FEINSTEIN

quote: If you are not as close to God as you used to be, who moved?
author: St. Mathias’ Church Bulletin

quote: Sorrow looks back, worry looks around, faith looks up.
author: Guideposts Magazine

quote: It is good enough to talk of God while we are sitting here after a nice breakfast and looking forward to a nicer luncheon, but how am I to talk of God to the millions who have to go without two meals a day? To them God can only appear as bread and butter.
author: MOHANDAS K. GANDHI

quote: Real religion is a way of life, not a white cloak to be wrapped around us on the Sabbath and then cast aside into the six-day closet of unconcern.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul.
author: EMILY DICKINSON

quote: Hope smiles on the threshold of the year to come, whispering that it will be happier.
author: ALFRED, LORD TENNYSON

quote: He who has health has hope, and he who has hope has everything.
author: ARAB PROVERB

quote: The natural flights of the human mind are not from pleasure to pleasure but from hope to hope.
author: SAMUEL JOHNSON

quote: Hope is not the conviction that something will turn out well but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out.
author: VACLAV HAVEL

quote: There is one thing which gives radiance to everything. It is the idea of something around the corner.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: Waiting is still an occupation. It is not having anything to wait for that is terrible.
author: CESARE PAVESE

quote: We must learn to reawaken and keep ourselves awake, not by mechanical aids, but by an infinite expectation of the dawn.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: In every winter’s heart there is a quivering spring, and behind the veil of each night there is a smiling dawn.
author: KAHLIL GIBRAN

quote: Sometimes our fate resembles a fruit tree in winter. Who would think that those branches would turn green again and blossom, but we hope it, we know it.
author: JOHANN WOLFGANG VON GOETHE

quote: A ship should not ride on a single anchor, nor life on a single hope.
author: EPICTETUS

quote: We must accept finite disappointment, but we must never lose infinite hope.
author: REV. MARTIN LUTHER KING JR.

quote: There are no hopeless situations; there are only people who have grown hopeless about them.
author: CLARE BOOTHE LUCE

quote: I have always been delighted at the prospect of a new day, a fresh try, one more start, with perhaps a bit of magic waiting somewhere behind the morning.
author: J. B. PRIESTLEY

quote: In the face of uncertainty, there is nothing wrong with hope.
author: Bernie Siegel

quote: When you say a situation or a person is hopeless, you are slamming the door in the face of God.
author: REV. CHARLES L. ALLEN

quote: There is no better or more blessed bondage than to be a prisoner of hope.
author: ROY Z. KEMP

quote: The kind of beauty I want most is the hard-to-get kind that comes from within—strength, courage, dignity.
author: RUBY DEE

quote: Some people, no matter how old they get, never lose their beauty—they merely move it from their faces into their hearts.
author: MARTIN BUXBAUM

quote: Love beauty; it is the shadow of God on the universe.
author: GABRIELA MISTRAL

quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us or we find it not.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Taking joy in living is a woman’s best cosmetic.
author: ROSALIND RUSSELL

quote: Tell a girl she’s beautiful, and she wouldn’t believe you really mean it. Tell her she’s more beautiful than another girl, and she would delightfully believe you’re being true.
author: HASNA HASSAN SIRAJEDDINE

quote: People have the strength to overcome their bodies. Their beauty is in their minds.
author: PETER GABRIEL CLARK-BROWN

quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
author: LEO TOLSTOY

quote: I’m tired of all this nonsense about beauty being only skin-deep. That’s deep enough. What do you want—an adorable pancreas?
author: JEAN KERR

quote: Nothing makes a woman more beautiful than the belief that she is beautiful.
author: SOPHIA LOREN

quote: Fashions fade; style is eternal.
author: YVES SAINT LAURENT

quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.
author: ALBERT EINSTEIN

quote: Speak the truth, but leave immediately after.
author: SLOVENIAN PROVERB

quote: Never assume the obvious is true.
author: WILLIAM SAFIRE

quote: I have one request: may I never use my reason against truth.
author: ELIE WIESEL

quote: Truth isn’t always beauty, but the hunger for it is.
author: NADINE GORDIMER

quote: The truth is not always dressed for the evening.
author: MARGARET LEWERTH

quote: Truth has no special time of its own. Its hour is now—always.
author: ALBERT SCHWEITZER

quote: Only the truth can still astonish people.
author: JEAN-MARIE POUPART

quote: Some people so treasure the truth that they use it with great economy.
author: H. RAY GOLENOR

quote: A half truth is a whole lie.
author: YIDDISH PROVERB

quote: A half-truth is usually less than half of that.
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: A truth that’s told with bad intent beats all the lies you can invent.
author: WILLIAM BLAKE

quote: The most dangerous untruths are truths moderately distorted.
author: GEORG CHRISTOPH LICHTENBERG

quote: Add one small bit to the truth and you inevitably subtract from it.
author: Dell Crossword Puzzles

quote: Many people today don’t want honest answers insofar as honest means unpleasant or disturbing. They want a soft answer that turneth away anxiety.
author: LOUIS KRONENBERGER

quote: The man who is brutally honest enjoys the brutality quite as much as the honesty. Possibly more.
author: RICHARD J. NEEDHAM

quote: We have to live today by what truth we can get today and be ready tomorrow to call it falsehood.
author: WILLIAM JAMES

quote: Truth is tough. It will not break, like a bubble, at a touch. Nay, you may kick it about all day, and it will be round and full at evening.
author: OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES SR.

quote: Most of the change we think we see in life is due to truths being in and out of favor.
author: ROBERT FROST

quote: Truth hurts—not the searching after; the running from!
author: JOHN EYBERG

quote: The truth will ouch.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Of course, it’s the same old story. Truth usually is the same old story.
author: MARGARET THATCHER

quote: The color of truth is gray.
author: ANDRÉ GIDE

quote: One of the most striking differences between a cat and a lie is that a cat has only nine lives.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: A lie has speed, but truth has endurance.
author: EDGAR J. MOHN

quote: Every time you try to smother a truth, two others get their breath.
author: BILL COPELAND

quote: What upsets me is not that you lied to me, but that from now on I can no longer believe you.
author: FRIEDRICH NIETZSCHE

quote: He who mistrusts most should be trusted least.
author: THEOGNIS

quote: I seem to have been like a child playing on the sea shore, finding now and then a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay undiscovered before me.
author: ISAAC NEWTON

quote: A paradox is a truth that bites its own tale.
author: American Farm & Home Almanac

quote: We always weaken whatever we exaggerate.
author: JEAN-FRANÇOISE DE LA HARPE

quote: Nothing lays itself open to the charge of exaggeration more than the language of naked truth.
author: JOSEPH CONRAD

quote: Always tell the truth. You may make a hole in one when you’re alone on the golf course someday.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: It takes two to speak truth—one to speak and another to hear.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: We do not err because truth is difficult to see. It is visible at a glance. We err because this is more comfortable.
author: ALEXANDER SOLZHENITSYN

quote: We lie loudest when we lie to ourselves.
author: ERIC HOFFER

quote: Men hate those to whom they have to lie.
author: VICTOR HUGO

quote: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: When you stretch the truth, watch out for the snapback.
author: BILL COPELAND

quote: Happiness lies in wait; it comes upon suddenly, like a midnight thief at a turn up in the street, or in the midst of a dream, because a ray of light, a strain of music, a face, or a gesture has overcome the despair of living.
author: HECTOR BIANCIOTTI

quote: Happiness walks on busy feet.
author: KITTE TURMELL

quote: If only we’d stop trying to be happy, we could have a pretty good time.
author: WILLARD R. ESPY

quote: Man must search for what is right, and let happiness come on its own.
author: JOHANN PESTALOZZI

quote: Now and then it’s good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.
author: The Cockle Bur

quote: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.
author: BERTRAND RUSSELL

quote: Before strongly desiring anything, we should look carefully into the happiness of its present owner.
author: FRANÇOIS DE LA ROCHEFOUCAULD

quote: It is an illusion to think that more comfort means more happiness. Happiness comes of the capacity to feel deeply, to enjoy simply, to think freely, to be needed.
author: STORM JAMESON

quote: Happiness is a way station between too little and too much.
author: CHANNING POLLOCK

quote: Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can be felt only if you don’t set any conditions.
author: ARTHUR RUBINSTEIN

quote: Most men pursue pleasure with such breathless haste that they hurry past it.
author: SOREN KIERKEGAARD

quote: The foolish person seeks happiness in the distance; the wise person grows it under his feet.
author: JAMES OPPENHEIM

quote: Fortify yourself with contentment, for this is an impregnable fortress.
author: EPICTETUS

quote: The discontented man finds no easy chair.
author: BENJAMIN FRANKLIN

quote: Real elation is when you feel you could touch a star without standing on tiptoe.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: The more the heart is nourished with happiness, the more it is insatiable.
author: GABRIELLE ROY

quote: Joy seems to me a step beyond happiness—happiness is a sort of atmosphere you can live in sometimes when you’re lucky. Joy is a light that fills you with hope and faith and love.
author: ADELA ROGERS ST. JOHNS

quote: Happiness is good health and a bad memory.
author: INGRID BERGMAN

quote: The summit of happiness is reached when a person is ready to be what he is.
author: ERASMUS

quote: Don’t wait around for other people to be happy for you. Any happiness you get you’ve got to make yourself.
author: ALICE WALKER

quote: Happiness is a thing to be practiced, like the violin.
author: JOHN LUBBOCK

quote: One filled with joy preaches without preaching.
author: MOTHER TERESA OF CALCUTTA

quote: Happiness is a conscious choice, not an automatic response.
author: MILDRED BARTHEL

quote: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn’t know you left open.
author: JOHN BARRYMORE

quote: To show a child what once delighted you, to find the child’s delight added to your own—this is happiness.
author: J. B. PRIESTLEY

quote: There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do.
author: FREYA STARK

quote: Shared joy is double joy and shared sorrow is half-sorrow.
author: SWEDISH PROVERB

quote: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is liking what you get.
author: H. JACKSON BROWN

quote: An ecstasy is a thing that will not go into words; it feels like music.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: Great joys, like griefs, are silent.
author: SHACKERLEY MARMION

quote: For happiness one needs security, but joy can spring like a flower even from the cliffs of despair.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
author: DALAI LAMA

quote: Unhappiness is the ultimate form of self-indulgence.
author: TOM ROBBINS

quote: Humor is not a trick, not jokes. Humor is a presence in the world—like grace—and shines on everybody.
author: GARRISON KEILLOR

quote: Time spent laughing is time spent with the gods.
author: JAPANESE PROVERB
