quote: Laughter is the shortest distance between two people.
author: VICTOR BORGE

quote: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
author: VICTOR HUGO

quote: Laughter is a tranquilizer with no side effects.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Like a welcome summer rain, humor may suddenly cleanse and cool the earth, the air and you.
author: LANGSTON HUGHES

quote: Laughter is the brush that sweeps away the cobwebs of the heart.
author: MORT WALKER

quote: Laughter can be heard farther than weeping.
author: YIDDISH PROVERB

quote: Laughter translates into any language.
author: Graffiti

quote: The kind of humor I like is the thing that makes me laugh for five seconds and think for ten minutes.
author: WILLIAM DAVIS

quote: Good humor may be said to be one of the very best articles of dress one can wear in society.
author: WILLIAM MAKEPEACE THACKERAY

quote: Among those whom I like, I can find no common denominator; but among those whom I love, I can: all of them make me laugh.
author: W. H. AUDEN

quote: After God created the world, He made man and woman. Then, to keep the whole thing from collapsing, He invented humor.
author: GUILLERMO MORDILLO

quote: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not; a sense of humor, to console him for what he is.
author: The Wall Street Journal

quote: So many tangles in life are ultimately hopeless that we have no appropriate sword other than laughter.
author: GORDON W. ALLPORT

quote: Wit surprises, humor illuminates.
author: ELI SCHLEIFER

quote: It always hurts a bit when you strike your funny bone. That’s the essence of humor.
author: JIM FIEBIG

quote: Someone who makes you laugh is a comedian. Someone who makes you think and then laugh is a humorist.
author: GEORGE BURNS

quote: We do have a zeal for laughter in most situations, give or take a dentist.
author: JOSEPH HELLER

quote: Nothing makes your sense of humor disappear faster than having somebody ask where it is.
author: IVERN BALL

quote: If you’re going to be able to look back on something and laugh about it, you might as well laugh about it now.
author: MARIE OSMOND

quote: Anyone without a sense of humor is at the mercy of everyone else.
author: WILLIAM ROTSLER

quote: Beware of those who laugh at nothing or at everything.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Next to power without honor, the most dangerous thing in the world is power without humor.
author: ERIC SEVAREID

quote: The love of truth lies at the root of much humor.
author: ROBERTSON DAVIES

quote: I think the next best thing to solving a problem is finding some humor in it.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: Humor is a hole that lets the sawdust out of a stuffed shirt.
author: JAN MCKEITHEN

quote: Humor is laughing at what you haven’t got when you ought to have it.
author: LANGSTON HUGHES

quote: A humorist is a fellow who realizes, first, that he is no better than anybody else, and, second, that nobody else is either.
author: HOMER MCLIN

quote: Comedy has to be based on truth. You take the truth and you put a little curlicue at the end.
author: SID CAESAR

quote: Comedy is simply a funny way of being serious.
author: PETER USTINOV

quote: Always laugh at yourself first—before others do.
author: ELSA MAXWELL

quote: A laugh at your own expense costs you nothing.
author: MARY H. WALDRIP

quote: Happy is the person who can laugh at himself. He will never cease to be amused.
author: HABIB BOURGUIBA

quote: Humor is a spontaneous, wonderful bit of an outburst that just comes. It’s unbridled, it’s unplanned, it’s full of surprises.
author: ERMA BOMBECK

quote: Humor is a reminder that no matter how high the throne one sits on, one sits on one’s bottom.
author: TAKI

quote: You cannot hold back a good laugh any more than you can the tide. Both are forces of nature.
author: WILLIAM ROTSLER

quote: It has always seemed to me that hearty laughter is a good way to jog internally without having to go outdoors.
author: NORMAN COUSINS

quote: When the first baby laughed for the first time, the laugh broke into a thousand pieces and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.
author: JAMES M. BARRIE

quote: No symphony orchestra ever played music like a two-year-old girl laughing with a puppy.
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: A pun is the lowest form of humor, unless you thought of it yourself.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Wit ought to be a glorious treat, like caviar. Never spread it about like marmalade.
author: NOËL COWARD

quote: Wit has truth in it; wisecracking is simply calisthenics with words.
author: DOROTHY PARKER

quote: Wit is the salt of conversation, not the food.
author: WILLIAM HAZLITT

quote: Wit is educated insolence.
author: ARISTOTLE

quote: A caricature is always true only for an instant.
author: CHRISTIAN MORGENSTERN

quote: Wit penetrates; humor envelops. Wit is a function of verbal intelligence; humor is imagination operating on good nature.
author: PEGGY NOONAN

quote: The wit of conversation consists more in finding it in others than in showing a great deal yourself.
author: JEAN DE LA BRUYÈRE

quote: The only way to keep your health is to eat what you don’t want, drink what you don’t like, and do what you’d druther not.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: The only way for a rich man to be healthy is, by exercise and abstinence, to live as if he were poor.
author: PAUL DUDLEY WHITE

quote: So many people spend their health gaining wealth, and then have to spend their wealth to regain their health.
author: A. J. REB MATERI

quote: It would be a service to mankind if the pill were available in slot machines and the cigarette were placed on prescription.
author: MALCOLM POTTS, MD

quote: The best cure for hypochondria is to forget about your own body and get interested in someone else’s.
author: GOODMAN ACE

quote: Those who think they have not time for bodily exercise will sooner or later have to find time for illness.
author: EDWARD STANLEY

quote: It is part of the cure to wish to be cured.
author: SENECA

quote: You know you’ve reached middle age when a doctor, not a policeman, tells you to slow down, all you exercise are your prerogatives and it takes you longer to rest than to get tired.
author: Friends News Sheet (Royal Perth Hospital, Australia)

quote: An early-morning walk is a blessing for the whole day.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: As with liberty, the price of leanness is eternal vigilance.
author: GENE BROWN

quote: Your body is the baggage you must carry through life. The more excess baggage, the shorter the trip.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: You can’t lose weight by talking about it. You have to keep your mouth shut.
author: The Old Farmers Almanac

quote: You know it’s time to diet when you push away from the table and the table moves.
author: Quoted in The Cockle Bur

quote: Probably nothing in the world arouses more false hopes than the first four hours of a diet.
author: DAN BENNETT

quote: If it weren’t for the fact that the TV set and the refrigerator are so far apart, some of us wouldn’t get any exercise at all.
author: JOEY ADAMS

quote: It’s not easy taking my problems one at a time when they refuse to get in line.
author: ASHLEIGH BRILLIANT

quote: He who can’t endure the bad will not live to see the good.
author: YIDDISH PROVERB

quote: It has been my philosophy of life that difficulties vanish when faced boldly.
author: ISAAC ASIMOV

quote: When things are bad, we take comfort in the thought that they could always be worse. And when they are, we find hope in the thought that things are so bad they have to get better.
author: MALCOLM S. FORBES

quote: I don’t think of all the misery but of the beauty that still remains.
author: ANNE FRANK

quote: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
author: HELEN KELLER

quote: Nothing is more desirable than to be released from an affliction, but nothing is more frightening than to be divested of a crutch.
author: JAMES BALDWIN

quote: A certain amount of opposition is a great help to a man. Kites rise against, not with the wind.
author: JOHN NEAL

quote: What I’m looking for is a blessing that’s not in disguise.
author: KITTY O’NEILL COLLINS

quote: People need resistance, for it is resistance which gives them their awareness of life.
author: KARL RITTER

quote: That some good can be derived from every event is a better proposition than that everything happens for the best, which it assuredly does not.
author: JAMES K. FEIBLEMAN

quote: The worst thing in your life may contain seeds of the best. When you can see crisis as an opportunity, your life becomes not easier, but more satisfying.
author: JOE KOGEL

quote: Storms make trees take deeper roots.
author: CLAUDE MCDONALD

quote: Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors.
author: AFRICAN PROVERB

quote: It is the wounded oyster that mends its shell with pearl.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: The soul would have no rainbow had the eyes no tears.
author: JOHN VANCE CHENEY

quote: Some people are always grumbling that roses have thorns; I am thankful that thorns have roses.
author: ALPHONSE KARR

quote: He knows not his own strength that hath not met adversity.
author: BEN JONSON

quote: Adversity is the trial of principle. Without it, a man hardly knows whether he is honest or not.
author: HENRY FIELDING

quote: You’ll never find a better sparring partner than adversity.
author: WALT SCHMIDT

quote: A gem is not polished without rubbing, nor a man perfected without trials.
author: CHINESE PROVERB

quote: Drag your thoughts away from your troubles—by the ears, by the heels, or any other way you can manage it. It’s the healthiest thing a body can do.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: Borrow trouble for yourself if that’s your nature, but don’t lend it to your neighbors.
author: RUDYARD KIPLING

quote: Don’t meet trouble halfway. It is quite capable of making the entire journey.
author: BOB EDWARDS

quote: Simple solutions seldom are.
author: Forbes magazine

quote: No one has completed his education who has not learned to live with an insoluble problem.
author: EDMUND J. KIEFER

quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.
author: HELEN KELLER

quote: When you can’t solve the problem, manage it.
author: REV. ROBERT H. SCHULLER

quote: Most problems precisely defined are already partially solved.
author: HARRY LORAYNE

quote: If the only tool you have is a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
author: ABRAHAM MASLOW

quote: Nothing lasts forever—not even your troubles.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: People who drink to drown their sorrow should be told that sorrow knows how to swim.
author: ANN LANDERS

quote: The human capacity to fight back will always astonish doctors and philosophers. It seems, indeed, that there are no circumstances so bad and no obstacles so big that man cannot conquer them.
author: JEAN TETREAU

quote: How a person masters his fate is more important than what his fate is.
author: WILHELM VON HUMBOLDT

quote: All blessings are mixed blessings.
author: JOHN UPDIKE

quote: Most of the shadows of this life are caused by our standing in our own sunshine.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: Life would not be life if a sorrow were sad, and a joy merry, from beginning to end.
author: GERMAINE GUEVREMONT

quote: Night is the blotting paper for many sorrows.
author: LITAUISCH

quote: The darkest hour has only 60 minutes.
author: MORRIS MANDEL

quote: When you get to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on. And swing!
author: LEO BUSCAGLIA

quote: Every problem contains within itself the seeds of its own solution.
author: EDWARD SOMERS

quote: Worry often gives a small thing a big shadow.
author: SWEDISH PROVERB

quote: Little things console us because little things afflict us.
author: BLAISE PASCAL

quote: For every problem there is one solution which is simple, neat and wrong.
author: H. L. MENCKEN

quote: Inside every small problem is a large problem struggling to get out.
author: PAUL HUGHES

quote: People in distress will sometimes prefer a problem that is familiar to a solution that is not.
author: NEIL POSTMAN

quote: The first step in solving a problem is to tell someone about it.
author: JOHN PETER FLYNN

quote: Some people suffer in silence louder than others.
author: MORRIE BRICKMAN

quote: Untold suffering seldom is.
author: FRANKLIN P. JONES

quote: Never bear more than one kind of trouble at a time. Some people bear three—all they have had, all they have now, and all they expect to have.
author: EDWARD EVERETT HALE

quote: An adventure is an inconvenience rightly considered. An inconvenience is an adventure wrongly considered.
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: It is the loose ends with which men hang themselves.
author: ZELDA FITZGERALD

quote: Two dangers constantly threaten the world: order and disorder.
author: PAUL VALÉRY

quote: Nothing is really lost. It’s just where it doesn’t belong.
author: SUZANNE MUELLER

quote: One of the advantages of being disorderly is that one is constantly making exciting discoveries.
author: A. A. MILNE

quote: More things grow in the garden than the gardener sows.
author: SPANISH PROVERB

quote: Organizing is what you do before you do something, so that when you do it, it’s not all mixed up.
author: A. A. MILNE

quote: When one finds himself in a hole of his own making, it is a good time to examine the quality of workmanship.
author: JON REMMERDE

quote: When luck enters, give him a seat!
author: JEWISH PROVERB

quote: A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.
author: JEAN DE LA FONTAINE

quote: Fortune brings in some boats that are not steered.
author: WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE

quote: Heaven goes by favor. If it went by merit, you would stay out and your dog would go in.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: It’s hard to detect good luck—it looks so much like something you’ve earned.
author: FRANK A. CLARK

quote: Luck is the residue of design.
author: BRANCH RICKEY

quote: The luck of having talent is not enough; one must also have a talent for luck.
author: HECTOR BERLIOZ

quote: Luck never gives; it only lends.
author: SWEDISH PROVERB

quote: Good luck is with the man who doesn’t include it in his plan.
author: Graffiti

quote: Thorough preparation makes its own luck.
author: JOE POYER

quote: Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.
author: OPRAH WINFREY

quote: Miracles sometimes occur, but one has to work terribly hard for them.
author: CHAIM WEIZMANN

quote: Luck is not chance, it’s toil. Fortune’s expensive smile is earned.
author: EMILY DICKINSON

quote: One half of life is luck; the other half is discipline—and that’s the important half, for without discipline you wouldn’t know what to do with your luck.
author: CARL ZUCKMAYER

quote: With money in your pocket, you are wise and you are handsome and you sing well, too.
author: YIDDISH PROVERB

quote: Some people have all the luck. And they’re the ones who never depend on it.
author: BOB INGHAM

quote: There is no substitute for incomprehensible good luck.
author: LYNNE ALPERN AND ESTHER BLUMENFELD

quote: Serendipity is looking in a haystack for a needle and discovering the farmer’s daughter.
author: JULIUS H. COMROE JR.

quote: It is an all-too-human frailty to suppose that a favorable wind will blow forever.
author: RICK BODE

quote: It is perhaps a more fortunate destiny to have a taste for collecting shells than to be born a millionaire.
author: ROBERT LOUIS STEVENSON

quote: Superstition is foolish, childish, primitive and irrational—but how much does it cost you to knock on wood?
author: JUDITH VIORST

quote: The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible.
author: ARTHUR C. CLARKE

quote: I have learned to use the word impossible with the greatest caution.
author: WERNHER VON BRAUN

quote: What we need are more people who specialize in the impossible.
author: THEODORE ROETHKE

quote: The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person’s determination.
author: TOMMY LASORDA

quote: The impossible is often the untried.
author: JIM GOODWIN

quote: All things are possible until they are proved impossible—and even the impossible may only be so, as of now.
author: PEARL S. BUCK

quote: Progress begins with the belief that what is necessary is possible.
author: NORMAN COUSINS

quote: Start by doing what’s necessary, then what’s possible and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
author: ST. FRANCIS OF ASSISI

quote: Everything looks impossible for the people who never try anything.
author: JEAN-LOUIS ETIENNE

quote: The young do not know enough to be prudent, and therefore they attempt the impossible—and achieve it, generation after generation.
author: PEARL S. BUCK

quote: Nothing ever built arose to touch the skies unless some man dreamed that it should, some man believed that it could, and some man willed that it must.
author: CHARLES F. KETTERING

quote: Accomplishing the impossible means only that the boss will add it to your regular duties.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: If you want a place in the sun, you’ve got to put up with a few blisters.
author: ABIGAIL VAN BUREN

quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any one thing.
author: ABRAHAM LINCOLN

quote: Probably the most honest “self-made man” ever was the one we heard say: “I got to the top the hard way—fighting my own laziness and ignorance every step of the way.”
author: JAMES THOM

quote: You can’t expect to make a place in the sun for yourself if you keep taking refuge under the family tree.
author: CLAUDE MCDONALD

quote: The important thing in life is not to have a good hand but to play it well.
author: LOUIS-N. FORTIN

quote: Striving for success without hard work is like trying to harvest where you haven’t planted.
author: DAVID BLY

quote: Showing up is 80 percent of life.
author: WOODY ALLEN

quote: If you play to win, as I do, the game never ends.
author: STAN MIKITA

quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, learning from failure.
author: GEN. COLIN L. POWELL

quote: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom.
author: GEN. GEORGE S. PATTON

quote: Success is often the result of taking a misstep in the right direction.
author: AL BERNSTEIN

quote: Wherever you see a successful business, someone once made a courageous decision.
author: PETER DRUCKER

quote: Success is often just an idea away.
author: FRANK TYGER

quote: The only thing that ever sat its way to success was a hen.
author: SARAH BROWN

quote: Success has a simple formula: do your best, and people may like it.
author: SAM EWING

quote: As a general rule, the most successful man in life is the man who has the best information.
author: BENJAMIN DISRAELI

quote: You’re never a loser until you quit trying.
author: MIKE DITKA

quote: There’s no secret about success. Did you ever know a successful man who didn’t tell you about it?
author: KIN HUBBARD

quote: Success is more a function of consistent common sense than it is of genius.
author: AN WANG

quote: Don’t aim for success if you want it; just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally.
author: DAVID FROST

quote: Success isn’t a result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
author: ARNOLD H. GLASOW

quote: Success without honor is an unseasoned dish; it will satisfy your hunger, but it won’t taste good.
author: JOE PATERNO

quote: Sports serve society by providing vivid examples of excellence.
author: GEORGE F. WILL

quote: Always do what you say you are going to do. It is the glue and fiber that binds successful relationships.
author: JEFFRY A. TIMMONS

quote: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
author: JOHN MUIR

quote: There is nothing like walking to get the feel of a country. A fine landscape is like a piece of music; it must be taken at the right tempo. Even a bicycle goes too fast.
author: PAUL SCOTT MOWRER

quote: The universe is not required to be in perfect harmony with human ambition.
author: CARL SAGAN

quote: Our Creator would never have made such lovely days and have given us the deep hearts to enjoy them unless we were meant to be immortal.
author: NATHANIEL HAWTHORNE

quote: Climb the mountains and get their good tidings. Nature’s peace will flow into you as sunshine flows into trees. The winds will blow their freshness into you, and the storms their energy, while cares will drop off like falling leaves.
author: JOHN MUIR

quote: There is no silence like that of the mountains.
author: GUY BUTLER

quote: I have seen the sea when it is stormy and wild; when it is quiet and serene; when it is dark and moody. And in all its moods, I see myself.
author: MARTIN BUXBAUM

quote: April hath put a spirit of youth in every thing.
author: WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE

quote: Our Lord has written the promise of resurrection, not in books alone but in every leaf of springtime.
author: MARTIN LUTHER

quote: Spring hangs her infant blossoms on the trees / Rock’d in the cradle of the western breeze.
author: WILLIAM COWPER

quote: Spring, thy name is color.
author: LIBBIE FUDIM

quote: Spring is nature’s way of saying, “Let’s party!”
author: ROBIN WILLIAMS

quote: A little madness in the spring is wholesome even for the king.
author: EMILY DICKINSON

quote: Springtime is the land awakening. The March winds are the morning yawn.
author: LEWIS GRIZZARD

quote: The first day of spring is one thing, and the first spring day is another. The difference between them is sometimes as great as a month.
author: HENRY VAN DYKE

quote: Spring is when you feel like whistling even with a shoe full of slush.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Summer afternoon—summer afternoon; to me those have always been the two most beautiful words in the English language.
author: HENRY JAMES

quote: If a June night could talk, it would probably boast that it invented romance.
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: Until you have heard the whippoorwill, either nearby or in the faint distance, you have not experienced summer night.
author: HENRY BEETLE HOUGH

quote: Oh, the summer night has a smile of light, and she sits on a sapphire throne.
author: B. W. PROCTER

quote: The experience of drought and dust storms remains central to the psychology of the prairie west; more than the intermittent affluence of postwar decades, it tints a westerner’s outlook on life. He continues to live in next year country, where he smokes a pack of hope a day.
author: MARK ABLEY

quote: For man, autumn is a time of harvest, of gathering together. For nature, it is a time of sowing, of scattering abroad.
author: EDWIN WAY TEALE

quote: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
author: ALBERT CAMUS

quote: Autumn carries more gold in its hand than all the other seasons.
author: JIM BISHOP

quote: October’s poplars are flaming torches lighting the way to winter.
author: NOVA S. BAIR

quote: October, here’s to you. Here’s to the heady aroma of the frost-kissed apples, the winey smell of ripened grapes, the wild-as-the-wind smell of hickory nuts and the nostalgic whiff of that first wood smoke.
author: KEN WEBER

quote: Autumn is a season followed immediately by looking forward to spring.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Winter is not a season; it’s an occupation.
author: SINCLAIR LEWIS

quote: Few things are as democratic as a snowstorm.
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn.
author: HAL BORLAND

quote: All sunshine makes a desert.
author: ARABIC PROVERB

quote: I am sure it is a great mistake always to know enough to go in when it rains. One may keep snug and dry by such knowledge, but one misses a world of loveliness.
author: ADELINE KNAPP

quote: When there is a river in your growing up, you probably always hear it.
author: ANN ZWINGER

quote: I like trees because they seem more resigned to the way they have to live than other things do.
author: WILLA CATHER

quote: A man has made at least a start on discovering the meaning of human life when he plants shade trees under which he knows full well he will never sit.
author: D. ELTON TRUEBLOOD

quote: I never knew how soothing trees are—many trees and patches of open sunlight, and tree presences; it is almost like having another being.
author: D. H. LAWRENCE

quote: The soil in return for her service keeps the tree tied to her, the sky asks nothing and leaves it free.
author: RABINDRANATH TAGORE

quote: Everything is blooming most recklessly; if it were voices instead of colors, there would be an unbelievable shrieking into the heart of the night.
author: RAINER MARIA RILKE

quote: A woodland in full color is awesome as a forest fire; but a single tree is like a dancing tongue of flame to warm the heart.
author: HAL BORLAND

quote: He that plants trees loves others besides himself.
author: ENGLISH PROVERB

quote: Flowers always make people better, happier and more helpful; they are sunshine, food and medicine to the soul.
author: LUTHER BURBANK

quote: If we had a keen vision of all that is ordinary in human life, it would be like hearing the grass grow or the squirrel’s heart beat, and we should die of that roar which is the other side of silence.
author: GEORGE ELIOT

quote: People from a planet without flowers would think we must be mad with joy the whole time to have such things about us.
author: IRIS MURDOCH

quote: The Pyramids will not last a moment compared with the daisy.
author: D. H. LAWRENCE

quote: I don’t see why I am always asking for private, individual, selfish miracles when every year there are miracles like white dogwood.
author: ANNE MORROW LINDBERGH

quote: I don’t ask for the meaning of the song of a bird or the rising of the sun on a misty morning. There they are, and they are beautiful.
author: PETE HAMILL

quote: A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
author: CHINESE PROVERB

quote: Let us a little permit nature to take her own way; she better understands her own affairs than we.
author: MONTAIGNE

quote: I’ve always regarded nature as the clothing of God.
author: ALAN HOVHANESS

quote: The sky is the daily bread of the eyes.
author: RALPH WALDO EMERSON

quote: One touch of nature makes the whole world kin.
author: WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE

quote: Repetition is the only form of permanence that nature can achieve.
author: GEORGE SANTAYANA

quote: The repetition in nature may not be a mere recurrence. It may be a theatrical “encore.”
author: G. K. CHESTERTON

quote: Everybody wants to go back to nature—but not on foot.
author: WERNER MITSCH

quote: Never a daisy grows but a mystery guides the growing.
author: RICHARD REALF

quote: I would rather live in a world where my life is surrounded by mystery than live in a world so small that my mind could comprehend it.
author: HARRY EMERSON FOSDICK

quote: If the human brain were so simple that we could understand it, we would be so simple that we couldn’t.
author: EMERSON M. PUGH

quote: Science cannot answer the deepest questions. As soon as you ask why there is something instead of nothing, you have gone beyond science. I find it quite improbable that such order came out of chaos. There has to be some organizing principle. God to me is the explanation for the miracle of existence—why there is something instead of nothing.
author: COSMOLOGIST ALLAN R. SANDAGE

quote: Sometimes I think we’re alone in the universe, and sometimes I think we’re not. In either case, the idea is quite staggering.
author: ARTHUR C. CLARKE

quote: Unknowingly, we plow the dust of stars, blown about us by the wind, and drink the universe in a glass of rain.
author: IHAB HASSAN

quote: The universe is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
author: EDEN PHILLPOTTS

quote: The sun, with all those planets revolving around it and dependent on it, can still ripen a bunch of grapes as if it had nothing else in the universe to do.
author: GALILEO

quote: To define the universe would be to contain it, and that would be to limit existence.
author: DAVID BERESFORD

quote: The universe is merely a fleeting idea in God’s mind—a pretty uncomfortable thought, particularly if you’ve just made a down payment on a house.
author: WOODY ALLEN

quote: There is nothing in which the birds differ more from man than the way in which they can build and yet leave a landscape as it was before.
author: ROBERT LYND

quote: Don’t blow it—good planets are hard to find.
author: Quoted in Time

quote: What is the use of a house if you haven’t got a tolerable planet to put it on?
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: It is horrifying that we have to fight our own government to save the environment.
author: ANSEL ADAMS

quote: Growth for the sake of growth is the ideology of the cancer cell.
author: EDWARD ABBEY

quote: Progress might have been all right once, but it’s gone on too long.
author: OGDEN NASH

quote: Progress is man’s ability to complicate simplicity.
author: THOR HEYERDAHL

quote: You can tell all you need to about a society from how it treats animals and beaches.
author: FRANK DEFORD

quote: Since the beginning each generation has fought nature. Now, in the life span of a single generation, we must turn around 180 degrees and become the protector of nature.
author: JACQUES-YVES COUSTEAU

quote: We haven’t got too much time left to ensure that government of the earth, by the earth, for the earth, shall not perish from the people.
author: C. P. SNOW

quote: The activist is not the man who says the river is dirty. The activist is the man who cleans up the river.
author: ROSS PEROT

quote: I think God’s going to come down and pull civilization over for speeding.
author: STEVEN WRIGHT

quote: Civilization no longer needs to open up wilderness; it needs wilderness to open up the still largely unexplored human mind.
author: DAVID RAINS WALLACE

quote: If we do not permit the earth to produce beauty and joy, it will in the end not produce food either.
author: JOSEPH WOOD KRUTCH

quote: We abuse land because we regard it as a commodity belonging to us. When we see land as a community to which we belong, we may begin to use it with love and respect.
author: ALDO LEOPOLD

quote: A true conservationist is a man who knows that the world is not given by his fathers but borrowed from his children.
author: Audubon

quote: The other planets may not be able to support life, but it isn’t easy on this one either.
author: Banking

quote: There’s no dealing with a cat who knows you’re awake.
author: BRAD SOLOMON

quote: The only mystery about the cat is why it ever decided to become a domestic animal.
author: COMPTON MACKENZIE

quote: The cat could very well be man’s best friend but would never stoop to admitting it.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: Cats have it all—admiration and an endless sleep and company only when they want it.
author: ROD MCKUEN

quote: Cats don’t caress us—they caress themselves on us.
author: RIVAROL

quote: When dogs leap onto your bed, it’s because they adore being with you. When cats leap onto your bed, it’s because they adore your bed.
author: ALISHA EVERETT

quote: You can keep a dog; but it is the cat who keeps people because cats find humans useful domestic animals. A dog will flatter you but you have to flatter a cat. A dog is an employee; the cat is a freelance.
author: GEORGE MIKES

quote: When I play with my cat, who knows if I am not more of a pastime to her than she is to me?
author: MONTAIGNE

quote: Ignorant people think it’s the noise which fighting cats make that is so aggravating, but it ain’t so; it’s the sickening grammar they use.
author: MARK TWAIN

quote: No matter how much cats fight, there always seem to be plenty of kittens.
author: ABRAHAM LINCOLN

quote: It is impossible to keep a straight face in the presence of one or more kittens.
author: CYNTHIA E. VARNADO

quote: You can’t look at a sleeping cat and be tense.
author: JANE PAULEY

quote: The idea of calm exists in a sitting cat.
author: JULES RENARD

quote: Cats seem to go on the principle that it never does any harm to ask for what you want.
author: JOSEPH WOOD KRUTCH

quote: Never try to outstubborn a cat.
author: ROBERT A. HEINLEIN

quote: If dogs could talk, it would take a lot of fun out of owning one.
author: ANDREW A. ROONEY

quote: One reason a dog can be such a comfort when you’re feeling blue is that he doesn’t try to find out why.
author: National Enquirer

quote: There is no psychiatrist in the world like a puppy licking your face.
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: To his dog, every man is Napoleon; hence the popularity of dogs.
author: ALDOUS HUXLEY

quote: The great pleasure of a dog is that you may make a fool of yourself with him and not only will he not scold you, but he will make a fool of himself too.
author: SAMUEL BUTLER

quote: The dog has got more fun out of Man than Man has got out of the dog, for the clearly demonstrable reason that Man is the more laughable of the two animals.
author: JAMES THURBER

quote: Dogs laugh, but they laugh with their tails.
author: MAX EASTMAN

quote: A dog wags its tail with its heart.
author: MARTIN BUXBAUM

quote: A dog teaches a boy fidelity, perseverance, and to turn around three times before lying down.
author: ROBERT BENCHLEY

quote: Home computers are being called upon to perform many new functions, including the consumption of homework formerly eaten by the dog.
author: DOUG LARSON

quote: If you think dogs can’t count, try putting three dog biscuits in your pocket and then giving Fido only two of them.
author: PHIL PASTORET

quote: Any time you think you have influence, try ordering around someone else’s dog.
author: The Cockle Bur

quote: Door: What a dog is perpetually on the wrong side of.
author: OGDEN NASH

quote: We give them the love we can spare, the time we can spare. In return dogs have given us their absolute all. It is without a doubt the best deal man has ever made.
author: ROGER CARAS

quote: To understand a man, you must know his memories. The same is true of a nation.
author: ANTHONY QUAYLE

quote: The American dream is not over. America is an adventure.
author: THEODORE WHITE

quote: There are those who will say that the liberation of humanity, the freedom of man and mind, is nothing but a dream. They are right. It is the American dream.
author: ARCHIBALD MACLEISH

quote: It is a part of the American character to consider nothing as desperate.
author: THOMAS JEFFERSON

quote: What is the essence of America? Finding and maintaining that perfect, delicate balance between freedom “to” and freedom “from.”
author: MARILYN VOS SAVANT

quote: The saving grace of America lies in the fact that the overwhelming majority of Americans are possessed of two great qualities—a sense of humor and a sense of proportion.
author: FRANKLIN DELANO ROOSEVELT

quote: America is a religious nation, but only because it is religiously tolerant and lets every citizen pray, or not pray, in his own way.
author: The New York Times

quote: America is a place where Jewish merchants sell Zen love beads to agnostics for Christmas.
author: JOHN BURTON BRIMER

quote: America is great because America is good, and if America ever ceases to be good, America will cease to be great.
author: ALEXIS DE TOCQUEVILLE

quote: The things that have made America great are being subverted for the things that make Americans rich.
author: LOU ERICKSON

quote: How often we fail to realize our good fortune in living in a country where happiness is more than a lack of tragedy.
author: PAUL SWEENEY

quote: America did not invent human rights. In a very real sense, it is the other way around. Human rights invented America.
author: JIMMY CARTER

quote: What the people want is very simple—they want an America as good as its promise.
author: BARBARA JORDAN

quote: Being American is not a matter of birth. We must practice it every day, lest we become something else.
author: MALCOLM WALLOP

quote: What’s right with America is a willingness to discuss what’s wrong with America.
author: HARRY C. BAUER

quote: America is not like a blanket—one piece of unbroken cloth. America is more like a quilt—many patches, many pieces, many colors, many sizes, all woven together by a common thread.
author: REV. JESSE L. JACKSON

quote: America is a tune. It must be sung together.
author: GERALD STANLEY LEE

quote: In America nobody says you have to keep the circumstances somebody else gives you.
author: AMY TAN

quote: One of the fondest expressions around is that we can’t be the world’s policeman. But guess who gets called when suddenly someone needs a cop.
author: GEN. COLIN POWELL

quote: I thank God that I live in a country where dreams can come true, where failure sometimes is the first step to success and where success is only another form of failure if we forget what our priorities should be.
author: HARRY LLOYD

quote: Americans are optimists. They hope they’ll be wealthy someday—and they’re positive they can get one more brushful of paint out of an empty can.
author: BERN WILLIAMS

quote: Give the American people a good cause, and there’s nothing they can’t lick.
author: JOHN WAYNE

quote: The business of America is not business. Neither is it war. The business of America is justice and securing the blessings of liberty.
author: GEORGE F. WILL

quote: If the American Revolution had produced nothing but the Declaration of Independence, it would have been worthwhile.
author: SAMUEL ELIOT MORISON

quote: Whoever wants to know the heart and mind of America had better learn baseball.
author: JACQUES BARZUN

quote: Highways have made tangible the conviction that the truth about America, its heart and soul, is always to be found somewhere just over the horizon, somewhere around the next bend.
author: PHIL PATTON

quote: A frontier is never a place; it is a time and a way of life. Frontiers pass, but they endure in their people.
author: HAL BORLAND

quote: To agree to disagree, to harness diversity, to respect dissent; perhaps this is the real essence of Canada.
author: ROBERT L. PERRY

quote: The soul of Canada is a dual personality, and must remain only half revealed to those who know only one language.
author: FRANK OLIVER CALL

quote: A Canadian is someone who drinks Brazilian coffee from an English teacup, and munches a French pastry while sitting on his Danish furniture, having just come home from an Italian movie in his German car. He picks up his Japanese pen and writes to his MP to complain about the American takeover of the Canadian publishing business.
author: CAMPBELL HUGHES

quote: “Liberty” sounds awkward on the Canadian tongue; we use “freedom,” a more passive-sounding word. When I was a soldier applying for a three-day pass, I asked for “leave,” a word that suggests permission. United States G.I.’s were granted “liberty,” a word that implies escape.
author: PIERRE BERTON

quote: Freedom is to you, what the sun was for us. You take it for granted.
author: MOHAMED MAGHJI

quote: Such a land [British Columbia] is good for an energetic man. It is also not so bad for the loafer.
author: RUDYARD KIPLING

quote: Liberty is always dangerous—but it is the safest thing we have.
author: HARRY EMERSON FOSDICK

quote: Liberty, when it begins to take root, is a plant of rapid growth.
author: GEORGE WASHINGTON

quote: Let freedom reign. The sun never set on so glorious a human achievement.
author: NELSON MANDELA

quote: Free is not the same as free and easy.
author: LARRY EISENBERG

quote: Every generation of Americans needs to know that freedom consists not in doing what we like, but in having the right to do what we ought.
author: POPE JOHN PAUL II

quote: The cause of freedom, of the defense of man’s conscience, is indivisible. By defending it in one country, we defend it everywhere in the world.
author: VLADIMIR BUKOVSKY

quote: Freedom is the right to be wrong, not the right to do wrong.
author: JOHN G. DIEFENBAKER

quote: There are two freedoms: the false where a man is free to do what he likes; the true where a man is free to do what he ought.
author: CHARLES KINGSLEY

quote: Your liberty to swing your arms ends where my nose begins.
author: STUART CHASE

quote: The right to do something does not mean that doing it is right.
author: WILLIAM SAFIRE

quote: My definition of a free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.
author: ADLAI E. STEVENSON

quote: Many politicians of our time are in the habit of laying down as self-evident the proposition that no people ought to be free until they are fit to use their freedom. The maxim is worthy of the fool in the old story, who had resolved not to go in the water until he had learnt to swim. If men are to wait for liberty until they become wise and good in slavery, they may indeed wait for ever.
author: THOMAS BABINGTON MACAULAY, 1825

quote: Liberty is the only thing you cannot have unless you are willing to give it to others.
author: WILLIAM ALLEN WHITE

quote: Freedom is a powerful animal that fights the barriers, and sometimes makes people wish for higher fences.
author: LANCE MORROW

quote: The function of freedom is to free somebody else.
author: TONI MORRISON

quote: It is easy to take liberty for granted, when you have never had it taken from you.
author: DICK CHENEY

quote: Those who expect to reap the blessings of freedom must undergo the fatigue of supporting it.
author: THOMAS PAINE

quote: Those who profess to favor freedom and yet depreciate agitation are men who want rain without thunder and lightning.
author: FREDERICK DOUGLASS

quote: Freedom never yet was given to nations as a gift, but only as a reward, bravely earned by one’s own exertions.
author: LAJOS KOSSUTH

quote: The history of liberty is a history of the limitation of government power.
author: WOODROW WILSON

quote: They have rights who dare defend them.
author: ROGER BALDWIN

quote: The love of liberty is the love of others. The love of power is the love of ourselves.
author: WILLIAM HAZLITT

quote: Freedom is nothing else but a chance to be better.
author: ALBERT CAMUS

quote: Freedom is the right to choose the habits that bind you.
author: RENATE RUBENSTEIN

quote: If a nation values anything more than freedom, it will lose its freedom; and the irony of it is that if it is comfort or money that it values more, it will lose that too.
author: W. SOMERSET MAUGHAM

quote: A country free enough to examine its own conscience is a land worth living in, a nation to be envied.
author: PRINCE CHARLES

quote: The clash of ideas is the sound of freedom.
author: Graffiti

quote: Where opinions, morals and politics are concerned, there is no such thing as objectivity. The best we can hope for is that freedom will enable subjective points of view to meet and complement each other.
author: JEAN D’ORMESSON

quote: A people that values its privileges above its principles soon loses both.
author: DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER

quote: It is a seldom proferred argument as to the advantages of a free press that it has a major function in keeping the government itself informed as to what the government is doing.
author: WALTER CRONKITE

quote: A free press can be good or bad, but, most certainly, without freedom a press will never be anything but bad.
author: ALBERT CAMUS

quote: Where the press is free and every man able to read, all is safe.
author: THOMAS JEFFERSON

quote: Censorship reflects a society’s lack of confidence in itself.
author: POTTER STEWART

quote: Every time we liberate a woman, we liberate a man.
author: MARGARET MEAD

quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: EPICTETUS

quote: No woman can call herself free until she can choose consciously whether she will or will not be a mother.
author: MARGARET SANGER

quote: Freedom always carries a burden of proof, always throws us back on ourselves.
author: SHELBY STEELE

quote: Patriotism is not so much protecting the land of our fathers as preserving the land of our children.
author: JOSÉ ORTEGA Y GASSET

quote: If everything would be permitted to me, I would feel lost in this abyss of freedom.
author: IGOR STRAVINSKY

quote: Freedom is the oxygen of the soul.
author: MOSHE DAYAN

quote: Timid men prefer the calm of despotism to the tempestuous sea of liberty.
author: THOMAS JEFFERSON

quote: We are in bondage to the law in order that we may be free.
author: CICERO

quote: To live anywhere in the world today and be against equality because of race or color is like living in Alaska and being against snow.
author: WILLIAM FAULKNER

quote: The defect of equality is that we desire it only with our superiors.
author: HENRY BECQUE

quote: It is often easier to become outraged by injustice half a world away than by oppression and discrimination half a block from home.
author: CARL T. ROWAN

quote: There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest.
author: ELIE WIESEL

quote: History will have to record that the greatest tragedy of this period of social transition was not the strident clamor of the bad people, but the appalling silence of the good people.
author: REV. MARTIN LUTHER KING JR.

quote: There is no happiness for people at the expense of other people.
author: ANWAR EL-SADAT

quote: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: REV. MARTIN LUTHER KING JR.

quote: Equal rights for the sexes will be achieved only when mediocre women occupy high positions.
author: FRANÇOISE GIROUD

quote: To do injustice is more disgraceful than to suffer it.
author: PLATO

quote: A great many people in this country are worried about law-and-order. And a great many people are worried about justice. But one thing is certain: you cannot have either until you have both.
author: RAMSEY CLARK

quote: What is morally wrong cannot be politically right.
author: WILLIAM GLADSTONE

quote: In recognizing the humanity of our fellow beings, we pay ourselves the highest tribute.
author: THURGOOD MARSHALL

quote: As long as you keep a person down, some part of you has to be down there to hold him down, so it means you cannot soar as you otherwise might.
author: MARIAN ANDERSON

quote: One man cannot hold another man down in the ditch without remaining down in the ditch with him.
author: BOOKER T. WASHINGTON

quote: Justice may be blind, but she has very sophisticated listening devices.
author: EDGAR ARGO

quote: Justice is the insurance we have on our lives, and obedience is the premium we pay for it.
author: WILLIAM PENN

quote: A minority group has “arrived” only when it has the right to produce some fools and scoundrels without the entire group paying for it.
author: CARL T. ROWAN

quote: We are not bitter, not because we have forgiven but because there is so much to be done that we cannot afford to waste valuable time and resources on anger.
author: GOVAN MBEKI

quote: Efficiency can never be substituted for due process. Is not a dictatorship the more “efficient” form of government?
author: THURGOOD MARSHALL

quote: It is better to risk saving a guilty man than to condemn an innocent one.
author: VOLTAIRE

quote: Most lawyers who win a case advise their clients that “we have won” and, when justice has frowned upon their cause, that “you have lost.”
author: LOUIS NIZER

quote: Injustice is relatively easy to bear; what stings is justice.
author: H. L. MENCKEN

quote: That old law about “an eye for an eye” leaves everybody blind.
author: REV. MARTIN LUTHER KING JR.

quote: I would uphold the law if for no other reason but to protect myself.
author: THOMAS MORE

quote: I sometimes wish that people would put a little more emphasis upon the observance of the law than they do upon its enforcement.
author: CALVIN COOLIDGE

quote: The ultimate solution to the race problem lies in the willingness of men to obey the unenforceable.
author: REV. MARTIN LUTHER KING JR.

quote: The worst form of injustice is pretended justice.
author: PLATO

quote: The real beauty of democracy is that the average man believes he is above average.
author: MORRIE BRICKMAN

quote: Man’s capacity for justice makes democracy possible, but man’s inclination to injustice makes democracy necessary.
author: REINHOLD NIEBUHR

quote: Democracy’s real test lies in its respect for minority opinion.
author: ELLERY SEDGWICK

quote: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
author: RALPH W. SOCKMAN

quote: Consensus means that lots of people say collectively what nobody believes individually.
author: ABBA EBAN

quote: Democracy without morality is impossible.
author: JACK KEMP

quote: Democracy does not guarantee equality, only equality of opportunity.
author: IRVING KRISTOL

quote: Democracy cannot survive without the guidance of a creative minority.
author: HARLAN F. STONE

quote: One has the right to be wrong in a democracy.
author: CLAUDE PEPPER

quote: Democracy is a small hard core of common agreement, surrounded by a rich variety of individual differences.
author: JAMES B. CONANT

quote: Our political institutions work remarkably well. They are designed to clang against each other. The noise is democracy at work.
author: Michael Novak

quote: I like the noise of democracy.
author: JAMES BUCHANAN

quote: Democracy, like any noncoercive relationship, rests on a shared understanding of limits.
author: ELIZABETH DREW

quote: Democracy means that if the doorbell rings in the early hours, it is likely to be the milkman.
author: WINSTON CHURCHILL

quote: Democracy is not a matter of sentiment, but of foresight. Any system that doesn’t take the long run into account will burn itself out in the short run.
author: CHARLES YOST

quote: I’m tired of hearing it said that democracy doesn’t work. Of course it doesn’t work. We are supposed to work it.
author: ALEXANDER WOOLLCOTT

quote: People often say that, in a democracy, decisions are made by a majority of the people. Of course, that is not true. Decisions are made by a majority of those who make themselves heard and who vote—a very different thing.
author: WALTER H. JUDD

quote: Democracy, like love, can survive any attack—save neglect and indifference.
author: PAUL SWEENEY

quote: There can be no daily democracy without daily citizenship.
author: RALPH NADER

quote: Democracy is the recurrent suspicion that more than half of the people are right more than half of the time.
author: E. B. WHITE
